None of the wifi features are useful if you have to get your butt off the sofa and hit the fing button to preheat. Thanks cosori for bowing to the mob over a "hack" that requires the bad guy to have physical access to my device to compromise it. GIVE ME BACK MY REMOTE PREHEAT.6/2021. Contacted customer support. No response. Cracked handle. Looks like I can get a new basket for $25, screw keeps disappearing from front plate. I have metric screws from work so I guess I'm just going to have to keep some in house. Front panel buttons don't work. DEAL BREAKER! Ordering the fancy new version where you can program the presets and MOST IMPORTANTLY, PAYING $30 FOR. A WARRANTY THAT WILL REFUND MY PURCHASE COST WHEN THE SUPPLIER DOESN'T TAKE CARE OF THEIR OWN CUSTOMERS.Air flow in this product makes it work so much better than most.The fryer itself is good. I hesitated to get the wifi version with all the data leaks, etc. But after using it, was glad I did EXCEPT....the app is junk....it's a generic control app. It let's you set your fryer to preheat and cook. It notifies you it's preheated sometimes. If you are actively using your phone, notifications work. God forbid you set it down and the screen goes off. No notifications. Garbage. I have resorted to setting separate alarms for preheat and cooking. So many possibilities, such poor execution.
title: Good product, responsive CUSTOMER SERVICE, bad politics, weak philosophy, broke their own product.

author: Lilac Peach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019
review_content: Ordered model CP158-AF, which is nice matte deep red, on Oct. 14, 2019 with delivery window of the 15th by 9 p.m. It arrived before 5 p.m. It was packed nicely and the manufacturers box has a handle so it was easy to lift from packing box. There is a user manual which you should take the time to read and a recipe book about 110 pages of recipes. was starving but I went over it and over the manual.As my pictures show it was larger than I thought as I live in an apt. Make sure you have counter space to have 5" from your wall as steam escapes from the rear.*** There is a plastic cover over the basket release button.  Please make sure it's in place so it won't be pushed by accident. It will release the inner basket which is holding the outer basket and also have a solid surface to place it on before you release. I put mine on the large burner on my stove as there wasn't enough room on counter. It was enough room to pull it out so I could flip the scallops.I didn't release it until I was ready to wash it. I had to give a slight tug to remove basket from fryer because it is new. It should slid out easier with more use. The manual is very informative and the display is easy to use with pictures of preset food items.I will purchase additional accessories such as ramakens, cake and pie pan as some recipes call for them. I do have some small glass containers I can use. You can use Pyrex or anything you can use in an oven. Also a sprayer for oil.My first use was for jumbo scallops. I didn't have a sprayer so I used paper towels to dab olive oil lightly and Old Bay seasoning. There wasn't a recipe or temp and cook time so I did a search online. I did preheat of 390 and cooked at 390 for 2 mins each side. Checked and did another minute. I should of used the preset fish instead of shrimp but I'm learning.They came out delicious. They don't get brown like searing them in butter but the Old Bay added some color to them. I have Alaskan Pollack fillets I am trying next and pork chops. So far I love it and look forward to using it daily.I will do an update.***Update*** Love cooking with this! issue is the cookbook fell apart and I had only browsed through it once and a metal prong seperated from the skewer rack so I went down a star.
title: Great fryer but accessories had issues

author: Marie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2019
review_content: I heard so much about these things that I had to give it a try. The fact that this one has a Pre-Heat setting is what tipped the scales for me. That helps with the crisping of foods.We are a family of 5 and I got the 5.8qt. size fryer. It holds plenty, yet it has a low profile and fits under my kitchen cabinet.For those of you, like me, who were confused on what this appliance actually is; it‚Äôs really a counter-top convection oven. Not a ‚Äúfryer‚Äù. It circulates hot air around your food. The result is nicely cooked veggies, seafood, etc. in a short amount of time. The veggies turn out great... similar to roasting but it takes a lot less time. Just toss your what you‚Äôre cooking lightly in olive oil and the machine does the rest.It‚Äôs also very easy to clean.  The only thing I would improve is the release button on the basket... it‚Äôs a little tricky at first to get the hang of... but after a few surprise drops, I‚Äôm now trained to make sure it‚Äôs resting a counter before releasing the basket. We‚Äôre having fun with it so far.This would be a good appliance for very small apartments, motor homes, or boats because it can actually function as your main oven.
title: This is really a counter-top Convection Oven

author: C. Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2021
review_content: We have several of this particular fryer within the family, with the oldest being a 25 months old.  The main fryer component itself is still going strong in the oldest fryer, but the internal basket (the one with the holes/vents) seems to need to be replaced too often in my opinion.  But hey, at least you can buy a replacement as opposed to buying a whole new fryer so that's nice.  I don't feel that we're rough with using the appliance, it's just not well designed to withstand the weight of the outer basket over time pulling/pushing it out/in the the fryer.  The basket that came with the item lasted 15 months, and the first replacement basket has only lasted 10 months.  Today I'm making yet another purchase for a new internal basket.  At $24.99 per basket, and now on my second replacement, I've spent ¬Ω of what I paid for the original item just in replacement baskets (when I purchased the fryer it was only $99.99).  If you don't mind replacing the baskets, the fryer itself is pretty awesome, and so simple to use.  I would give it 5 stars if not for the fact that I've needed to replace the basket twice in it's 25 month life span.
title: Be prepared to replace basket often

author: jim r
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
review_content: Got in mail plugged in it flashed a couple times and never worked again
title: Not even one use died

author: Siggy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020
review_content: So, I've had this for almost four months. Overall I'm very pleased with the air fryer. I use it almost daily. I've made chicken, corn, eggplant, fries (of course), spaghetti squash, meat balls and more and everything comes out amazing, juicy on the inside, crispy on the outside. There are however a few design flaws that need to be addressed by the company. One is major. The screws in both baskets become loose after almost every use and I constantly have to tighten them. I discovered this when I found one of the screws in my food! The other issue, is that the material of the inner basket (with the holes), is different than the material of the drip basket. The drip basket is a non-stick material that is very easy to clean. The basket with the holes (roasting basket thing) does not appear to be. The first few times of use, it was easy to clean and with each subsequent  use, it becomes more and more difficult. I use a variety of cooking sprays when using the fryer and eventually the basket ends up with a sticky, oily residue that is impossible to remove unless you use an abrasive scouring tool, which would obviously ruin the basket, so I haven't done that and try to ignore the fact that I'm cooking in a pan that is less than clean. Just FYI, I clean both baskets after each use. I hope you find this helpful.
title: I love it, but there is a major design flaw that needs to be fixed.

author: R. Mallett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018
review_content: I‚Äôve had experiences with three other air fryers before trying the Cosori 5.8 qt. - Phillips, GoWise, and Habor.  All three were excellent.  But, they were BIG.  I‚Äôm so in love with this Cosori and can rest easy that I made the right choice in selecting this air fryer as the one I‚Äôm sticking with.  One of the main reasons I love it so much is the size ‚Äì so much smaller than most on the market (look at picture of it next to my Blendtec blender), but had just as much capacity in the basket!  The controls are intuitive and easy to use.  It‚Äôs the best looking one on the market ‚Äì and we know how important THAT is!  The programmable keep warm function is awesome and when it comes to cooking it performs amazingly well.  Clean up is an absolute breeze.  Last night I cooked a whole chicken and the drawer wiped clean with a paper towel and almost no effort.  Nothing stuck to the great nonstick finish.  While the chicken rested, I roasted asparagus in 6 minutes, then garlic toast in 3!  The chicken was so delicious, it almost brought tears to my eyes!  Fall off the bone tender, juicy, and parts of the skin as crispy and delicious as any pork cracklin‚Äô (chicharr√≥n) I‚Äôve ever tasted.  Thank you, Cosori, for making such an awesome appliance.  Not to bore you with yet more praise, but about 6 months ago, I purchased the wildly popular Instant Pot pressure cooker.  I absolutely love my Instant Pot ‚Äì was cooking dinner in it almost every night.  Until I got my Cosori Air Fryer.  I‚Äôve only used the Instant Pot once since then.  If you knew how much I love to cook, and how enamored I was (and am) with the Instant Pot, you‚Äôd know what a big deal that is!  Another small thing I like about the Cosori is that the corners of the basket are not quite as rounded, a little more "squared off", which makes it a little more spacious.  OH - like I said, over the years, I've owned/used now four air fryers - all top quality.  Of the four, I've only been contacted by ONE manufacturer - COSORI.  They emailed me and asked if I was happy with their product and if there was anything I needed or if I had any suggestions on how to improve the air fryer.  That's an example of exceptional customer service.  I was already completely sold on it, but if not, that would certainly have sealed the deal!!
title: Small on the outside, big capacity inside, best Air Fryer out there!!

author: Eric S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2020
review_content: I am blown away with the food results. I love it's ease of use. It looks great. Holds a decent amount of food. Very fast. 99% of it I love.HOWEVER, I bought this as A Christmas gift. It's early February at the time of writing this. While handwashing the basket a week ago, i started scrubbing (with a cloth rag) what i thought was baked on food. Upon closer inspection, i realized that the nonstick coating was gelling up and easily peeling off with the lightest pressure. I'm pretty pissed. I'm actually nervous about frying food in it now due to the known risks of PTFE. Perhaps the stainless version would've been a better choice.
title: Mixed feelings. Beware! Great food results though.

author: Joe Tairei
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: PROBLEMS FIXED!!!  PLEASE SEE END OF REVIEW FOR UPDATE.I want to love my Cosori air fryer.  I saw it used on a Youtube cooking channel, and so I figured, this must be a pretty mainstream product.  I got it seven months ago and it has become a mainstay in the kitchen, and all but replaced the toaster oven, the frying pan, and even the grill.The one problem I have is that the buttons, or whatever you call those little circles on the front panel, are very difficult to press, especially with damp fingers.  It just doesn't work. What's more, when I press them, they don't activate the function immediately; they seem to work only after my finger is lifted.  A kind of delayed reaction, in other words. I can't understand why they couldn't have used an old fashioned set of push buttons, or even a mechanical dial switch.  These technologies have been around for at least 100 years and are pretty well understood.I have tried and tried to figure out how to use the buttons but they are just persnickety and only work part of the time.  Extremely frustrating and that's why I knocked the rating down from 5 stars to 2.  I'm planning to finally contact them and ask whether I have a defective unit, and if they can somehow fix the problem, I'll be happy to alter this rating.Apart from that, Mrs. Lincoln, how was the play?As a cooking appliance, if you can get past the awful user interface, it's a great cooker.  It can cook 6-8 chicken drumsticks in 24 minutes and they come out absolutely delicious, juicy and tender, not raw in the middle, not burned on the outside.It makes toast reasonably well (though we don't make a lot of toast in this house).  It is great for reheating things.  It is wonderful for vegetables; one of our favorites is broccoli florets sprinkled with hoisin sauce and garlic -- just don't over cook or you get these nasty black bitter bits that are quite unappetizing.There are hundreds of videos out there demonstrating how to make just about anything in these gizmos.  I was an air fryer skeptic until I watched a few, then decided to take the plunge and get one, and now I'm sold... albeit, I wish I'd gotten one that was easier to use.They do make an app that allows you to control the air fryer from your phone.  It's what I would call a work in progress. The name of the app is "VeSync".  You run the app and it detects the Cosori as one of the appliances it can control.  That's fine for them, I suppose, but from the user's perspective, it would be so much better to have an app called "Cosori".  I have so many apps and it's impossible to remember that vesync means cosori.  Come on, who decided this was a great idea?Anyway, more on the app:  it sort of works well.  I say "sort of", because it promises more than it delivers.  There's a "cooking history" section (but no search function).  You can tap on a history item and it will start the Cosori for you, remotely; you can also alter the temp and cooking time.  Right now I can see last night's chicken, but it doesn't list this morning's pop tart from 15 minutes ago. WHY??? Maybe it takes a while to retrieve the data... I have no idea.  Just another annoyance.  The app does send you notifications when the cooker is done, if you choose to use that feature.I do like that you can add your own recipes to the app.  The thing is, it's not rocket science to use this fryer; just set time and temperature and go.  The saved recipe thing is mainly to help you not overcook or undercook, and that's a matter of trial and error.As far as cleaning and maintenance, it's pretty simple.  You pull out the basket and wash in warm soapy water.  If you're doing dry stuff like toast or reheating a bowl of soup, there's little or no cleaning.  If you're doing meat or wet veggies, you may need to do some cleaning.  I use a soft scratch sponge, but a brush also works well. It helps to soak the whole basket in warm soapy water for 20 minutes, and my wife has run the inner basket through the dishwasher a couple of times; that makes me nervous that it could damage the teflon coating, but so far it seems okay.The inner/outer basket design has plusses and minuses; you can lift the inner basket out, but if you're doing it one-handed (as one tends to do in kitchens) you need a surface under the outer basket or it will fall to the floor.  Not ideal; it would be nice if the outer basket could be retained in the machine somehow, maybe with a hook, so you don't have to position the air fryer 12" in from the edge of the counter.Liquid seems to accumulate sometimes in the space under the outer basket, maybe just condensation.  It's probably not a bad idea to wipe that up from time to time, just to prevent rusting or messing up the heat cycle.In my opinion, this appliance is still a work-in-progress. They have some issues to solve regarding the buttons and basket design.  Air fryers in general are still a new thing, but they've become very popular for good reason; they work very well for what they do.  With a few tweaks, this can be an excellent product worthy of 5 stars.UPDATE June 25 2020After I wrote to Cosori, they generously shipped me a new unit.  I'm happy to report that the buttons work much better.  As a test, I wet my finger and it still works.  I will say, the buttons still have a kind of delayed reaction -- they don't really engage until you lift your finger, which is odd, but I have gotten used to it.  Most importantly, the buttons all respond immediately now, and I don't need to repeatedly press the time/temp button to activate it.  Thanks to Cosori for properly handling this issue and I've boosted my rating accordingly.
title: Review updated after my defective unit was replaced for free.

author: Camilojv
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019
review_content: We love our Cosori Air fryer, it‚Äôs working and has worked as it is supposed to be working, however after 3 months of use we started to notice that the exterior of the air fryer (is made of cheap plastic) has started to crack.I will still recommend the Cosori however youhave to be aware that the exterior is made of cheap plastic.I will update my review on a few months.
title: After 3 months of use it started to crack (Exterior)

author: M. Reid
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
review_content: Sooo I‚Äôve been using my Cosori Air Fryer about two months now. One day I was using it to cook up a few turkey burgers for the kids and out of nowhere, and in the middle of cooking, the basket released itself from the fryer, slid out onto the countertop and since I have granite countertops, it kept sliding right off that surface and crashed to the floor. Very random! I was thinking I‚Äôd done something wrong. This device has to be perfect right? I mean it wasn‚Äôt exactly cheap. I‚Äôd done my homework and got one of the top rated. Maybe I didn‚Äôt lock it into place all the way. So from that point, I‚Äôd made it my business to be sure to push it in all the way until I felt it lock. All was all good for about 3 weeks and then this afternoon, I was making lunch for me and hubby. I‚Äôd put in two Burgers and was preparing us a salad when 5 minutes into the cooking process, I heard the fan stop and I turned around quickly but I was too late, the basket popped out, slid onto the countertop and then crashed to the floor. But this time, hot splatter popped onto my foot and leg...OUCH! I wasn‚Äôt badly injured but I‚Äôm baffled!!! Literally baffled! This is obviously a flaw in the design that can be potentially dangerous. Imagine if my kid was in there??? Realistically, I love this fryer! I love the design, I love ease of use and ease of cleaning and I love the way the food tastes when it comes out. But that right there, that‚Äôs BAD! One other issue...there are about 5 small screws inside that loosen on their own so I find myself tightening them at least twice a week. And lastly, don‚Äôt ever and I mean EVER hit the button that releases the basket from the tray unless you are holding it over a countertop or something. I made that mistake and the entire tray dropped out and fell on my foot. It wasn‚Äôt hot but it hurt like hell!!!Update: I contacted Cosori directly after my blackened mahi ended up all over my kitchen floor. They need to be aware of this problem. At first I was quite offended that one of the reps told me, ‚ÄúWe will look into this issue immediately. Meanwhile, take a moment to read your Cosori Air Fryer manual!‚Äù What???!!! So you mean to tell me there is a portion of the manual that mentions this malfunction??? Because I already read the manual and it was never mentioned! Anywho....they handled the situation for me and offered to replace my current air fryer and asked me to ship them the old one so that they could investigate this. So I‚Äôm feeling that this may not be a common problem as I‚Äôve only found a few videos of people complaining about this same malfunction (which apparently becomes progressively worse). So as of today, a new fryer has been sent and is on the way. Hoping I don‚Äôt have these problems again.
title: Major problems that are potentially dangerous!

author: Russ Lefebvre
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
review_content: It's almost twice the size of my other one.  If they made a bigger one I'd get it.  I own a smoker and would cook ribs in it for 6 hours.  I've cooked ribs in my oven.  But, 30 minutes in this air fryer makes the best ribs I've eaten.  I don't even use sauce.  Just seasoning.Bacon just 15 minutes for crispy just right.  Fries are great.  Steaks come out like they were on a grill.
title: This thing is great

author: ClaireWithLove
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019
review_content: This is my first air fryer.  It is basically a small convection oven that needs 3 - 5 minutes to pre-heat.  Cooking is about 20-40% faster than a normal oven.  Get the bigger size. We need to make a meal for 2 - 4 people and you want you food to lie flat for the best roasting. Temperature max is 400 degrees.Pros:- Preset - Buttons are easy to use.  French fried, carrot (root vegetables), meat, etc.- The cooking book and recipe manual are very helpful.- Clean-up is super easy - the metal is very non-stick as is the bottom pan that catches the drips- You can use a preset button to get an idea of recommended temperature and time but use the Time/Temp button to adjust it down- On the presets, it beeps half way through for you to "shake" the food which is helpful to see how cooked they are- I finally was able to make roasted brussel sprouts with a maple glaze that have not worked out in my normal oven- There was a plastic smell the first time I used it and a faint hint in the food, but now I do not notice it. The cooking area where your food is is metal.Cons:- Big and high so it does not fit in my pan cabinet- French fry preset was way too long.  Need about 12 minute instead, total.Tips:- Adjust the time to less than what is recommended or else they may be dry and overcooked- Spray the vegetables with olive oil and I use tongs to "toss" them around at the mid-point alarmI was worried about buying this brand since I had never heard of it before.  I have made complete meals, cooking the veggies separate from the cut chicken in the air fryer, and I am very happy with the purchase.  I have been using for about 3 weeks.
title: Faster than an Oven, Easy to Clean, Needs Less Time than Recommended

author: kathy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019
review_content: So disappointed. My daughter has an inexpensive air fryer so I decided to go better expecting more than looking nice. So loud I would never use with company in an open kitchen. Going back in the box relegated to the closet.  Basket size is nice, that‚Äôs the most positive comment I can make for an expensive mistake.Well I have to add their customer support team called today and offered to help me including a refund. Great customer attention! Debating my options but I will always do business with a company I trust.
title: Very loud.

author: Zhiping
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
review_content: The screws that fasten the inner basket and the handle are loose and lost. I am going to buy some in Home Depot but I don‚Äôt know the specification of the screws.
title: The screws are lost!

author: SchwebelJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2019
review_content: I added this product onto our wedding registry because I was running out of items we needed.  We didn't even know we needed this, but we love using it nearly every day.  Actually, the one we were gifted was broken and Cosori sent us a brand new replacement immediately so high praise for their customer service. We love the larger 5.8 quart size and is non-stick and cleans *super* easily which is great for someone like me who hates to wash dishes.A few tips to convince anyone on the fence about getting an air fryer:  - Costco pre-cooked bacon tastes AMAZING in this.  - Leftover pizza tastes even better than fresh pizza in 5 minutes, no preheat needed.  - Tons of Trader Joe's frozen foods cook perfectly and really easily in this like their cauliflower gnocchi, chicken tenders, corn, and turning fresh asparagus and butternut squash zigzags into alternative fries.  - Leftover veggies reheat well in this with a nice char which makes it better than the fresh dishOur so-called "instant" pot is never coming up from under the counter again while this Cosori air fryer is the only table-top appliance we don't store away between uses because we use it so often.
title: We didn't even know we would love this, but we do

author: valerie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_content: The thing  reeks of burrning plastic and the food tastes like plastic. It's horrible I was really looking forward to this but now I am totally put off of any air fryer. I may keep trying but today was WORSE than yesterday.  It did cook frozen fries and onion rings well bit I could have the same result from my oven. It's too bad they tasted like burnt plastic. I will never consider this product again
title: Horrible burnt plastic smell just awful

author: doug crowley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2019
review_content: stopped working after 2 uses and I left a bad review.  Customer service contacted me immediately and sent me a new one.  Hopefully this one will work longer.  It does an awesome job of cooking food and easy to clean.  Good customer service.  Would recommend
title: Would recommend

author: Just me
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2019
review_content: Or should I say, I‚Äôm paticular... yeah, that‚Äôs it, paticular.  I‚Äôm not one to jump on the bandwagon of a new craze or product right away.  (Case in point, I bought my first toaster oven last year üò≥ and have yet to purchase an Instapot).  My scenario for a kitchen appliance goes something like this...1) First and foremost, I have to be convinced that it‚Äôs something I will use... that will make my life easier.  Something that will make me want to kick myself in the posterior for not buying it sooner.2) Secondly, it‚Äôs got to look good (this is where the snob part comes in ;)  After all, if it‚Äôs going to take up precious real estate on my countertop, it better damn site look good.  No shiny plastic football shaped appliances for my kitchen, thank you.3) Third (and this is the most time consuming) I research it to death.  The pros, the cons, the ‚Äòmehs‚Äô, YouTube videos, manufacturer websites, Facebook groups.  Yep, I read user reviews like they were Consumer Reports (confession... always starting with the 1-star üò¨).So why do I suck all the joy out of making a spontaneous purchase you ask?  Because I‚Äôm at a point in my life where I‚Äôm tired of owning and storing things I rarely use (hello waffle iron, rice cooker, kitchen aide mixer, etc., etc., etc.)  Because I appreciate quality, utility, durability and attractiveness...throw in ‚Äògood value / price‚Äô and you‚Äôve just checked all my buy boxes.  Now, don‚Äôt get me wrong, I am in the ‚Äòyou get what you pay for‚Äô camp and have absolutely no problem buying top of the line.  However, if I can find a quality product at a good price, all the better.  So, how did the process go with Air Fryers?Air Fryer:Do I want it?  Yes.  Need it?  Truthfully, no.  Use it?  Probably.  Will it make my life easier?  Oh hell yes!  No more greasy cooktops to clean and that‚Äôs a huge plus in my book.  So, that‚Äôs a big YES for adding an air fryer to my kitchen appliances.  Here‚Äôs how Cosori did: Appearance -  Love the sleek design and classy brushed finish of the Cosori.  Can a kitchen appliance actually be described as beautiful?  Why yes, yes it can.  ;)Research / Design -  It seems that Cosori looked at all the complaints from different models of air fryers and designed their product addressing those complaints.  The top does not open so it fits on the countertop, under cabinets.  The footprint is relatively compact compared to some other models.  The basket is squarish with good capacity, by design accomodating more food than round baskets.  Large, easy to read display.  Digital presets including Preheat (Note:  Do NOT skip this step.  Despite what other manufacturers claim, preheating will definitely make a difference in many of your recipes).  Shake reminder.  Turns itself off when done.  Super easy to clean.  No problem with the basket‚Äôs non-stick finish flaking off.  Comes with a 2 year warranty.  Surprisingly nice cookbook included. Very responsive customer service.  Bottom line?  Quality product, 2 Year warranty.  So far, so good.Value / Price -  A big YES here.  The Cosori Air Fryer 5.8qt is $119.  The Phillips (my second choice) is $249+ depending on the model you select.Summary:  I‚Äôm sad to say I was unfamiliar with Cosori prior to my research of Air Fryers.  So although this is the first of their products I‚Äôve owned, it likely won‚Äôt be my last.  If the Cosori Air Fryer is representative of the quality of their other products... I‚Äôm definitely a fan.  I use my Air Fryer 4-5 times a week and am very happy with the purchase.  Style, quality, value... Cosori has it all.  Highly recommended.Disclaimer:  I did NOT receive a free Cosori Air Fryer to try in exchange for my review....  Dang it.
title: Ok, I‚Äôll admit it... I‚Äôm a snob.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: I don‚Äôt usually do reviews so I‚Äôll keep it short.First off..this air fryer for the most part was great.  A few coworkers talked me into it so I decided to give it a shot.What I liked:I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything prepared I did not like. Some of the best fresh fish I‚Äôve ever had. This by far is the one thing that I can say may be worth the purchase alone.... Phenomenal! Potatoes, chicken, the crunch in asparagus and broccoli that I‚Äôve never had before but could definitely get used to. Just a spritz of olive oil and seasoning. Just set and forget. Cook time is short and clean up is easy. Basket capacity is good enough to cook multiple items at a time.What I didn‚Äôt like:1.)Some may not consider this an issue but I can‚Äôt get over the smell. It‚Äôs overwhelming and can last for days.  It‚Äôs not a plastic smell that some complain about. That goes away in time. It‚Äôs a deep fryer smell that permeates through the house and lingers for days. An issue that others I‚Äôve talked to don‚Äôt seem to have with their air fryers. Maybe better air filtration would benefit.2.) I found 2 of the screws in the bottom of the basket after a few uses. This actually didn‚Äôt bother me as much as #1.  Just a small phillips head and problem solved.3.)This contradicts one of the reasons I liked this model but...  It‚Äôs big. Make sure you have counter space to accommodate. Likely fine for most. Just takes up too much space for me personally.So in summary..I liked it , recommend it and most probably would agree.. but I have to return this one.
title: 4 Stars But Its Just Not For Me

author: Daniel F. Quinn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
review_content: While it worked, it was one of the few new small appliance/gadgets that we used all the time. Great for warming up pizza, cooking vegetables, and especially making chicken wings.The only problem is that it just stopped working in the middle of making dinner last week. So, it doesn't matter how great it was when it worked, it's broken now and junk. And it's not like it's an inexpensive appliance. If I wanted a disposable piece of garbage, I'd have bought an air fryer for $30 - not $120.UPDATE 11/20/20 - The customer service department read my review, reached out, and provided a Amazon gift card in recompense to cover the full price of the air fryer. Updated to 4 stars - even though it stopped working )and that was annoying in and of itself), the company stepped up with solid customer service.
title: Broke after 8 months-Updated with Customer Service Response

author: Jenine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2019
review_content: I adore this machine. My mom and I have been wanting an air fryer for years now and shopped around EVERYWHERE for the very best one. Of course, Amazon had the best deal but was it the right one? For us? My mom‚Äôs not good at computers yet I am, what can I find that will work for us both? She needs something that she can easily figure out to use on her own while I want something that isn‚Äôt archaic looking with knobs and a CVS receipt-like list of instructions. Well, this was the answer to our prayers!It‚Äôs modern, easy to use (functions operate like a regular oven), easy to clean and figure out. Also, everything you put in it comes out instantly more delicious!We bought the accessories and the recipe book, as well, and I‚Äôm planning on cooking up a storm for Mother‚Äôs Day 2019 using just this air fryer and the recipe book! I don‚Äôt even like to cook!Forget that foods are 85% healthier because of less oil, this is so much fun! From breakfast to dessert, I‚Äôve never been so happy to eat!P.S. My one complaint is that it is noisy to me, nothing above annoying level but it does make a consistent sound when powered on. Dependent on your kitchen layout, it could be annoying. If I‚Äôm in the kitchen with it, it‚Äôs annoying; if I‚Äôm not, it‚Äôs fine. My mom doesn‚Äôt mind it because she says you need to know when it‚Äôs on, depends on the person, I guess.
title: Love love love

author: Marian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2019
review_content: Works amazingly well! I've had another air fryer, but it's nothing compared to this one. Cooked my fries within 25 min, crispy, and tasty. My only complaint is the basket is difficult to dislodge from the pan itself, and I've almost dropped it as a result (why I gave 4 stars instead 5). They need to work on a better means of releasing the basket so we can wash it, and retrieve the food from it. Other than that, I'm very happy with my purchase. I've already registered for the warranty to get the extra year. Very satisfied customer.
title: Super powerful, and VERY easy to use!

author: angela johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2019
review_content: I was a huge fan of this machine.  Used it daily for the first week i had it.  Then while using it on day 8 it stopped running in the middle of cooking.  Thought it may have over heated so turned it ofd and let it cool for an hour and I even tuned on a fan to help cool it down.  It started again but would not stay on.  The lights would flash on then off and then back on.  I  cleaned it up and put it away for the week and decided I wpuld give it one more try before returning and no luck.  Started and the turned off.  Went through it twice and then it would not turn on again.  Returning tomorrow
title: Loved this machine for its entire 1 week life.

author: Tom in Oregon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
review_content: When the air fry craze first hit I thought a multi-task unit was for me.  I used the Cuisinart for a year before I decided to buy a dedicated air fryer.  The Cuisinart gave me a great learning experience but it was an awful chore to clean.  Also the heating element consisted of 3 ceramic rods at the top which didn't air fry the whole basket evenly.  I settled on the Cosori after a week of You Tube videos and internet research.  In the 2 days of owning the Cosori I've only been able to fry 2 items:, ie:  chicken wings and this morning - breakfast sausages.  I can tell you that I do not miss the Cuisinart at all.  Reasons for my liking the Cosori are:  Very easy to clean.  The exposed heating element seems to burn off any grease splatter before it hots the fan grid work.  The square pan allows more food in a single layer than a round pan.  The large heating element eliminates any hot/cold spots in the fry basket.  Much smaller footprint than the Cuisinart.  There is a learning curve.  The 2 items I fried were a little too well done for my liking.  The Cosori cooks much faster than the Cuisinart so I will adjust my recipes accordingly.  I am glad that I had a year's air fry experience.  I know how to correct recipe instructions for my liking.  The experience is sufficient to allow me to review the Cosori without prejudice.  Between the Cosori and my Instant Pot I can use my range's oven for storage.
title: Way better than my Cuisinart TOA-60 Convection Toaster Air Fryer !!!

author: Rachel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2019
review_content: Just ordered this last week.  I have used it at least 10 times already.  As much as I love how it cooks food and everything comes out crispy,  the burning plastic smell has not dissipated.  It makes my whole house smell terrible and makes me nauseous! I really wanted to love this air fryer fromHow good the reviews were, but the smell is terrible!!!
title: Burning plastic smell

author: Larry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
review_content: My wife and I love this 5.8 qt air fryer. I was never much of a cook until we bought this fryer. Now I cook wings, sausages, and lots of other things in it. In fact, I cooked so much that I have now worn out the basket handle after four months of use. Two out of three screws that hold it together came out, and the handle just flops around. I managed to find one of the screws in the sink drain just after it fell out and before the disposal ruined it. However, the second one is nowhere to be found. Fortunately, the handle will kinda work with just two screws holding it together, but the whole thing feels less secure than it did with three screws. I have ordered a couple of spare baskets so I can keep using the fryer, but I am not happy with paying $25 a pop for a manufacturing issue. The screws should have been mounted so they would not back out under normal use and washing.
title: Handle falls off the basket after four months of use

author: cool boy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
review_content: I bought this air fryer after seeing the tons of review in Amazon. I was very doubtful that it might be one of those marketing tricks.Tried chicken and spicy fried peanuts.Unbelievable results. Both Cooked to perfection.1lb chicken took only 9mins to cook with 1tsp of oil at 360deg.1lb Raw peanuts + 1 tsp of oil, fried to crisp in 20 mins 320deg. Opened and Stirred every 5mins though.I couldn‚Äôt wait to try all the recipes listed in the cook book that came with the unit.I wish manufacturer provided more fixtures like other brands.Super happy with this product.These are the other factors I was worried about before buying1. Noise: I would say half of microwave. Much quieter than my hood at 1 setting.2. Plastic smell: As soon as I received the unit, washed it with soap water. Ran empty cycle for 20 mins. Smelled chemical for first 2 mins.  After that there was no smell at all3. Smoke: There was no smoke at all while cooking chicken.I was super impressed and surprised with the performance.
title: Perfect air fryer

author: Glencora
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2021
review_content: I really don't get the hype about this.  I was so excited to try it.  But then it arrived.  Here are the pros and cons, for me:Cons:1. The size. It's monstrously HUGE.  And because of all the safety space precautions, you can't just use it on a regular counter.  It would be too close to the wall, and/or too close to the cabinets above it.  And don't ignore those precautions, I've seen multiple reviews of air fryers burning or melting walls and other things.2. Cleaning. It's a pain to clean.  The baskets are also huge, awkward to wash, and awkward to dry.3. The cord.  The booklet says they purposely made the cord short, because excess cord could be a safety hazard.  But since it can't be used close to the wall, etc, you have to use an extension cord with it - how is that any safer?4. The release button for the baskets.  I keep my nails relatively short because I enjoy using mechanical keyboards; but even so, I had a hard time using the release button.5. Aesthetics.  I realize this won't matter to a lot of people, but personally I think an appliance that resembles a pregnant stormtrooper from the Death Star doesn't belong in my kitchen.6. The food. I followed every instruction carefully.  I did the suggested test runs.  And the food came out not crispy AT ALL.Pros:None that I could find. I get better results using my cooktop or my convection toaster oven.  Without the hassle of space constrictions and awkward washing.
title: Huge, a royal pain, yucky food

author: dg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
review_content: I'm sorry to say I'll have to change my review from 5 Stars to One Star.  I had learned to cook many different foods in my Cosori Air Fryer.  I have bragged to my cooking friends and relatives about how good the food was when cooked in the Cosori.  My daughter from TN visited us today and I was showing off demonstrating how to use the Cosori when the heating element in the Cosori quit.  The fan started blowing cold air.  My husband and I were cooking with this Air Fryer almost everyday.  I loved the foods I had learned to cook in my Cosori.  I am extremely disappointed that it only worked for four months.  I'll have to try another brand of Air Fryer.
title: Delivered Jan. 29, 2019 heat element quit May 24, 2019

author: Brendan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
review_content: Sorry, I'm not on the 5 star review bandwagon here.  It cooks well, but it's literally a burner coil with a fan that circulates air.  You're not going to find one hot fan that adds more flavor than another.  I wish I had done more research and bought something else instead.First off, it's LOUD!  We have a smaller house with an open concept kitchen/dining/living area.  When this is going it's totally disruptive to watching TV, kids doing homework, listening to music, etc...WiFi...why did I pay extra for this?  I never use it.  I can't think of a practical reason for it.  I get random notifications when I'm at work that my wife is cooking stuff in the air fryer.The buttons are hard to use.  They don't always register that I touch them more often than not.  The presets are useless.  They give you a general idea of temp and cook time, but you cannot blindly trust them.It's HUGE!  Despite it's huge size you'll find yourself limited in cooking space.  For 4 adults I have to cook fries or tots in 2 batches.Construction seems cheap.  The screws that hold the handle on are inside the basket.  One of them fell into the cooking basket and ended up in my mouth, the other two were extremely loose.If you're looking for one, look for something a little more basic.  A simple time/temp knob is all that's needed.  Look for something a little more quiet if you're cooking near your living area.  Save your money on fancy feature, you won't find yourself using them.
title: Meh....

author: Heldenbaer1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_content: Older gent (60+) never cared for having a fryer in the house, never 'deep fried' or 'air fried,' except for attempting to make Mitford Cookbook's "Louella's Fried Chicken" in a skillet -if you know, you KNOW... [https://www.amazon.com/Karons-Mitford-Cookbook-Kitchen-Reader/dp/0670032395/ref=sr_1_1?crid=2HNF7KOIKY5CS&dchild=1&keywords=mitford+cookbook+and+kitchen+reader&qid=1590771033&s=books&sprefix=Mitford+Cook%2Cstripbooks%2C167&sr=1-1]And one equally smelly, messy but delicious attempt at making tempura, 'just because,' when the kids were little- thank you, Japanese cartoons of the late 90's! (Gotta catch 'em all.  But, after both those attempts, our common question was, "where do you put all that old oil, if you don't live in the Upper Midwest, where you can freeze it and throw it the next day or two, when the garbageman comes?")  Fast forward 15 years. The wife would never have seen the benefit of this device had we 'debated' about whether to buy it or not, except that a serious medical emergency (me) mandated some lifestyle changes on our parts (I'm ok, six months down the road, GsD).After looking at all sorts and sizes of 'air fryers' we (I) chose this model for: a) cost, b) size, c) looks, and d) functionality. Couldn't be happier. We have used it alone, (just the two of us) to make Mustard Chicken skewers (amazingly yum), 'fried' sweet potato fries, regular potato fries, and now that our kids  are home (from college/Covid) they have used it to make 'spicy carrot chips' and 'fried tofu' (daughter 'says' she's now a vegetarian, whatchagonnadoo?)- but I'll admit, those things DID taste good, and no fuss, no mess, NO OIL. Not once.This summer we plan to use it at least two to three times a week, to help free up space in a kitchen with only one stove/cooktop unit... and too many cooks! Clean-up takes all of a minute with soapy water, paper liners that absorb most of the oil; the unit itself heats up quickly, runs as it's supposed to do,  and is relatively quiet. It's effective, and looks fantastic on our counter next to our single-cup Coffee maker (Daughter is hogging that, every morning, too- LOL) and the cookbook that came with it, will give us enough recipes for months to come, as we work on our 'slow and gentle' learning curve. But I'll admit - I am kinda lusting after Urvashi Pitre's Air Fryer Revolution Cookbook...[https://www.amazon.com/Air-Fryer-Revolution-Healthy-Recipes/dp/035812087X/ref=sr_1_5?crid=1DXGN3C3YBKO&dchild=1&keywords=urvashi+pitre&qid=1590771810&s=books&sprefix=Urvashi%2Cstripbooks%2C197&sr=1-5 [Oh and wife's cholesterol has gone down- not all due to the Cosori, but due (we know) to our lifestyle/food choice changes. So, is it the greatest thing since the microwave? -maybe.  But that big/little air fryer is now definitely a part of our cooking lives. Who'd a thunk?
title: Perfect for two, useful for four

author: SSD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019
review_content: Deserves zero stars. The air fryer sent to me has not only been used, but was not even washed. Very disgusting. I will never purchase from Cosori again. I‚Äôm very surprised that it came directly from the brand manufacturer itself, not a third party. It was sold as ‚Äúnew‚Äù. Thankfully it can be easily returned but it was needed for the holiday weekend.
title: Used and greasy; disgusting.

author: lala
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
review_content: I love this air fryer. I LOVE it!I chose this one over a cheaper 60$ one because I know it will last me longer. The digital screen is 100% worth it and makes using it so easy.This has made dinners so much easier for myself and my hubby. It's so big that I can use it if our family gets bigger, too. This has changed my life, just like the Instant Pot did.I hope you enjoy it, too!Update:Oct 2020, I started noticing the drawer part (not the basket) is bubbling up like the nonstick paint on the inside is about to come off. I am worried it will flake off and get in my food and, much worse, ruin the cleaning process.I've only used my air dryer maybe 20 times since I got it at the very beginning of July, but for 130$, you would think it holds up better. I only hand wash it.Changing from 5 star to 2 star.This is so upsetting.I attached a pic, it looks like water droplets but that is bubbles paint.UPDATE #2:Cosori managed my defective air fryer experience very well. I was able to get a replacement and I talked with the most pleasant customer service representative! Thank you so much, Cosori. I would buy from this company again!
title: Defective, fixed by Cosori. Great cust service and amazing air fryer (when it's not defective üòâ)

author: banjo player
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
review_content: I  just  received my Cosori  smart air fryer today.  I  am fairly new  to air fryers.  I  had a 2 quart air fryer for a couple months and it seemed a bit small even for just my wife and I.  My wife saw the Cosori air fryer and thought it looked good and was worth looking at.  I saw that there was a WIFI  version.  This looked interesting to me because it was advertised as  being available to operate by my iPhone.I am blind and usually do not find many appliances that are accessible for me to operate.  With a little help to connect the air fryer to the vesync app, I was able to operate  all the functions described in the product description using my iPhone.I tried a couple functions like preheat, delayed start, manual cooking, and preset for vegetables.  It all worked without a  flaw.  Pretty incredible!  I  ended up cooking a couple batches of asparagus.  They were just as good as if I had made them in the oven.  Probably a little better.  I was notified, when using the preset,  to pull out the basket for a little shake.  The  vesync app also let me know the current temp  and time remaining for cooking, with an option to pause or stop cooking.In the app there is a section for recipes along with a history of what settings I have used for cooking with corresponding dates.As I said I have not much experience with air fryers, so I cannot say this is better or worse than others.  I can say that this is the only air fryer that I have found that is totally accessible for a person who is blind.  I cannot overstate how unusual and impressive the accessible capabilities are for this air fryer.I wanted to add one more comment:  When the new version of the iPhone IOS 13 came out, the vesync app did not work for using the air fryer with my iPhone and the VoiceOver screen reader.  I notified vesync.  They were on it.  Within 2 weeks they had made the needed corrections to their app and now I am back up and running.  Wow!  that is customer support.  I will be a life-long customer of the Cosori and vesync products.  If I could give this product a 10 I'd do it.  Thanks so much.btw many times when I contact an app developer about using their app with VoiceOver, they just say too bad for you.  Not with vesync.
title: accessible for a  blind cook plus support

author: Sanjana Bryant
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
review_content: I really wanted to love this airfryer! It has a large capacity, heats up well and fast, and easy to clean. It was slightly louder than the one my friend has, but that one has a smaller capacity than what I wanted for my larger family so I decided to overlook that problem. The reason I ended up returning the product is because the yucky plasticky smell just never went away. The first two times, our entire kitchen smelled like burned plastic! So disappointed. =(
title: Persistent plasticky smell forced return =(

author: Teddy Z
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021
review_content: I was replacing our 4 year old power air fryer because the coating on the basket was coming off onto the food. I decide to go a little bit larger capacity and upgrade a little bit too. For me personally, the basket that lifts out of the pan with a handle like a deep fryer was a must. I readreviews on air fryers for 3 days driving myself crazy! Every time I thought‚Ä¶ Yes! This is the one! I would see a 1 or 2 reviews saying it was a nightmare, and I got cold feet.I never write reviews. Thought it was a waste of time. My theory is that most people typically don‚Äôt write a review if they are satisfied. They only go to the reviews to vent because they are mad‚Ä¶ so a lot of times, I feel like reviews on anything might skew on the bad side due to that. I finally settled on this one and ordered it. I found it on one of those sites where people use 10 or so things and then rank them. I saw some bad reviews on Amazon about the steam escaping and puddling on the counter. That sites review didn‚Äôt have that issue. I also saw some people saying it smells like burnt plastic even after using it for months. Some saying it was DOA and some had it die after a few weeks. Some said the touch pad didn‚Äôt work great.Well I‚Äôve had it for a good while now and used it a LOT, so that covers longevity issues. I have had none of those issues or any at all to this point. We love it. We got the red one and it‚Äôs really nice looking. It‚Äôs solid and doesn‚Äôt feel cheap. The non stick coating seems much better than what I‚Äôm used to. The keypad works good and the preset times are spot on. The preheat button is really convenient. I love that it has an alarm midway through reminding you to shake food. The basket that is a square with the corners rounded is probably one of my favorite changes than my previous fryer which was round. Comes in handy when heating up stuff like pizza. We bought a pump up pressurized olive oil mist sprayer and after a light mist of oil on fries, they come out as close to deep fried as you can get, but aren‚Äôt soaked in oil grease!I don‚Äôt know if I got lucky, or if people weren‚Äôt using it properly, but this is one of the best cooking appliances I‚Äôve ever used.I realize I wrote too much. Like I said, I‚Äôm not used to doing reviews. Good luck!
title: Perfect choice.

author: E. B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020
review_content: This is my second unit so these issues aren't with my air fryer only.  I sent my first one back thinking I must have had a defective unit.First-  The screws in the basket WILL fall out frequently.  They will fall into your food.  You will need to check and tighten them frequently or you risk choking on the screws.  I'm not sure how they can even continue to sell this like with this problem.  The screws on the outer portion (the basket holder) will come out too but not as frequently.Second-The timer resets everytime you 'shake'.  Those who have air fryers know you are to pull out the tray and shake it around while cooking to maximize air flow and crispiness.  Air fryers will continue right where you left off when you put the basket back in-that's one of air fryers biggest conveniences.  The problem with this one is it resets back to a full minute each time you do that.  For example, say you are cooking something for 15 minutes and you 'shake' 5 times.  If you pull the basket out and there's 12:02 left when you put it back in it starts back at 12:59 seconds.  After 5 times you might be adding around 4-5 minutes extra cooking time.Third-The least of the problems but still a problem.  The buttons are really weird on the front and you have to almost press through the panel to get them to work.  It was worse on my first one.Other than the big problems the air fryer is awesome.  I love the shape of the basket and the way the basket is designed to maximize air flow.
title: DANGEROUS!  CHOKING HAZARD! A few MAJOR design flaws-otherwise I would love this air fryer

author: Coffeerock5
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
review_content: I have LOVED using this air fryer, until the basket has broken twice now. The handle is constantly coming loose and having to be tightened back down, and after one year the plastic that attaches the handle to the basket breaks and the entire basket itself requires replacing. I have replaced it twice and the second time the handle broke off and caused the entire basket to fall onto the ground, causing the damage seen in the third photo. Unless you want to be replacing parts once a year, I cannot recommend this air fryer to anyone
title: Basket lasts for one year then breaks

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†This product arrived on April 29, 2020. Today is May 19, 2020. It's only been merely two and a half weeks (ok 20 days total) and the touch screen on my air fryer is already not sensitive to touch. Refer to video. It takes several times to even try to press a button, but sometimes it works right away. It is extremely frustrating to use, especially when trying to adjust the temperature or the time because it stops letting you adjust it after being idle for a while. I cannot believe such product like this cost so much money but it couldn't even last a month. I am definitely returning this product. It's really sad because I was in love with it for the short 19 days that it shown me potential.
title: Touch screen broke after 20 days

author: Saud
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019
review_content: This product has excellent reviews and I would love to believe that my order is not defective. I saved money and waited for long until they discounted this air fryer but was slightly disappointed. I'm having the same issue as one of the reviews mentioned that it has a burning plastic smell while operating. It's still my first try and will keep trying it for a few times and see how it goes.
title: Burning plastic smell

author: nc consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
review_content: These are pretty good overall, but about to replace 1 of them.  It works 80 of the time, but  the display shorts out  frequently and loses its place.The screws work themselves out after a few months on the basket.
title: Owned 2 for 1.5 years, the display on one shorts out frequently

author: Foolish_Mortal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019
review_content: I guess that it didn't "die", it just decided be lazy. My guess is a faulty temp sensor or some such malfunction, as it will run for 5 minutes or so, and then shut off until the whole thing cools off again. It literally behaves as it's unplugged.  If I set it to a low temp, like 200 or so, it will work for longer, but what good is that? Unfortunately, it's just out of the return window by a couple of weeks or so, and I had just discarded the original packaging thinking that it was good to go after using it every weekend for a month. I figured that I was out of luck.Cosori Customer service contacted me (see comments) and after sending an email as requested, they shipped me a new one right away. I'm typing this as delicious corn on the cob is frying in it. Yum! They shipped out the new unit quickly via FedEx and it got to me fast! I am very, very satisfied with Cosori.There's going to be a failure rate with everything, even if it's a very small percentage, and great customer service can make up for it. It did with me.
title: Died 2 weeks after return window, but amazing customer service saved the day!

author: TGJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2018
review_content: So, I've only cooked one thing in this so far, but it was steak and steak was what I bought this cooker for specifically. I cooked a decent sized ribeye and it was FANTASTIC! Well equal to anything I've cooked in an oven, stove top, or grill, but honestly also equal to steaks from most restaurants. The steak was tender, moist, evenly cooked and all around delicious.  Winner, winner, steak dinner!
title: Fantastic Steak!

author: Lynn Rudberg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2019
review_content: I‚Äôve used it twice...so still getting used to it. Last night I made chicken thighs and they took much longer to reach the proper temp than the recipe had called for and I had brought them close to room temp. Not quite sure how to get the crispness on veggies like broccoli and Brussels sprouts. Have to adjust to learning curve. Appreciate your interest.
title: Getting used to correct cooking times

author: MnE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020
review_content: So, ive had two of these both had touch display issues. The 1st the touch screen didnt respond unless you like wipe your hand across the display then random buttons would activate, however when u touch those buttons (lite, firm & hulk smashing) didnt respond. Power button wouldnt respond at all. However it worked via app n with Alexa. 2nd one responded to touch for most of the display, power worked but the manual temp n time touch buttons would work intermittently. Sometimes lite pressure worked, one time holding your finger for like 15sec activated it but not the follow-up attempts, hulk smash finger press worked but none of those worked consistently.  Returned both went with ninja. This was top rated n bunch of good reviews n cheaper then the ninja. After some googling found this is a known and common issue, so much so that i called the manufacture n after describing what was happened just offered to replace it, no try this or that just okay we will send u a new one but it would take upto 10business days. Returned thru amazon quick and easy. The features it has if touch display works would b a awesome machine. However if your touch display does work then setup to the app (once downloaded) was easy, setup with alexa (once skill for fryer app enabled via alexa app) was easy n part of setup process. It responded to the app n alexa no issues. I loved the features plus having the wireless abilities thats why i opted for a 2nd to see if just a bum machine which happens but 2 for 2 pretty much same issue moved on. Gave 2 stars just due to fact it semi-worked but not everyone has alexa or wants to use an app (mom hates using both). So id say buy it see if you get a working machine if not move on!
title: Touch display not working on 2 different fryers

author: Pete
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†I was excited when I found out that you can operate this from an app. The app itself is great. The problem was that the buttons on the fryer was not responsive. The power button did not work no matter how hard I pressed. So I returned it and got another one. The buttons on the second one worked but not all the time and you really had to press them hard. But I was ok with that because I still had the app to operate it. The thing that alarmed me was after soaking the inner basket and the outer basket in the sink, it was rusted underneath the edges. Look at the attached video. So I didn‚Äôt even get a chance to cook with it. I‚Äôm going to return it. That will be 2 that I have returned. I will have to try another brand.
title: Disappointed

author: Chandra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2021
review_content: So I read the reviews and went ahead and bought this anyway. I‚Äôm not new to new appliances and they all come with a ‚Äúsmell‚Äù. It‚Äôs all because of packaging, residue, what have you. These are the steps I took to avoid having this issue and was able to use my air fryer right away after taking these steps with 0 plastic smell:Pre step (optional): I wiped down each surface with a Clorox wipe just to disinfect but also the alcohol breaks down the residues better/quicker. You don‚Äôt have to do this, it‚Äôs just what I do.Step 1: wash with a sponge with the non abrasive side (of its a double sided sponge). Just like during Covid with washing your hands, wash for at least 30 seconds well on all of the surfaces of the basket.Do this with the baskets. Also, since I wiped the inside with a Clorox wipe, I took a damp paper towel and wiped the inside again to wipe that out.Step 2: follow the instructions in the booklet for ‚Äútest it out‚Äù. After each time you heat up the unit, carefully remove the basket and separate it, and repeat step 1.  I would suggest using a dish brush with a longer handle though so you don‚Äôt burn yourself. ** after u wash it make sure you dry it best you can too.Step 3: Heat the unit again like the instructions say, and then wash and dry again. Preheat one more time than the instructions say, wash and dry again. (Total of 3-4 heat and wash/dry cycles)After taking these steps, I was able to preheat my air fryer, and successfully make chicken parm with no plastic smells or tastes.Reading and taking the time to thoroughly clean your product goes a long way. The air fryer does what it says it will do and makes food quickly.Buy the thing, clean it well and you‚Äôll be a okay üëå
title: Great Product-Plastic Smell Goes away if you do this

author: mytran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
review_content: I hate hate hate hate the look of this frier. I bought the white one which I paid extra and thought would be a shinny sleak look. It looks like some cheapest matted 3D printed parts put together except the digital window looks very nice ( I have to be fair). It‚Äôs too bulky I didn‚Äôt want to return it, so I‚Äôm using it and it‚Äôs working ok so far. Made some fast and nice fries. Unlike other comments said, It could toast bread. Get your fact right people!!! I bet it could be a dehydrator too if you set the temp low enough. Man I‚Äôm so angry giving review for this air frier I don‚Äôt know why. I guess it takes me some time to make peace with the ugly look. I will come back and give one star if it breaks on me. üò°üò°
title: Hate the cheap look

author: Eurus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019
review_content: This air fryer is the best kitchen supplies I bought this year!Air fryer with WIFI is awesome!I don't have to go to kitchen to control it!This is not just fried,I can make a dessert too! I am glad they gave me the recipes book so  it makes much more easy to cook.And this size is totally enough for 2-4 people.Pretty incredible!
title: easy to operate

author: HTMAN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
review_content: I was excited to use this for the first time.  I turned on and then it turned off its own and that was it. Never came back up. A bit disappointed for the inconvenience I have to go through in returning it. I went on and ordered a replacement, I guess things happen. Just a bit of disappointing if it is new? the face seemed it had hairlines swirls, not sure if it was a return. All looked new. Will update once I get a working unit.********UPDATE********Ok, I received my replacement order Monday, Thank you Amazon! This is a night and day product compared to what I received before. First, the difference in delivered product. First, the external box was an "Amazon" badged box and smaller over all. 2nd, the box inside was a "Cosori" labeled box compared to what I had before (Leit or something like that). Third, the box inside the Cosori box was the actual box of the product (with all the pics of it). Lastly the big difference was the fact that the basket had tape holding the basket as many "new" products are done. All looked great, plus no Swirls on the face. A new product indeed. I have a feeling the first was a return. Not cool.Now for the product review.. Yesterday, I went crazy and cooked Battered frozen strips for kids and they were Crispy using the frozen option. Wow!  Also, cooked fresh cut fries came out awesome. I think I cut them to thin, but the bigger ones were crispy and no oil (except for olive oil per instructions). Lastly last night, a NY and it was perfectly cooked, a nice Med Rare, it was great. Today, was another test. My daughter and I, mostly her cooked the Jalape√±o popper from recipe book. They were great, only think I would of added to recipe was cream cheese, but followed directions for first time. Lastly, I cooked two giant chicken breast. I cooked then at 360 per online instructions, but I think the chicken preset would of done it just fine. Flipped them twice. Perfectly cooked at about 25-30 min.at 360. The president et is for 390 for 25.Wish I took pics, but let me tell you, this Air fryer is awesome. Don't doubt yourself in purchasing. You will be happy with results. I research and went with this brand, plus you sign up for warranty they give you an extra year for free. Cant beat that deal! You have nothing to lose, except the oil much to gain with good cooking!Go for it!  The one star less was from the beginning ordeal. Enjoy!
title: DOA...

author: R. Hipp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021
review_content: I live alone and for the past 3 years I've owned and used a simple Gotham Steel 4qt. Air fryer with a wind up timer. It has worked perfectly all of this time and I absolutely love it and have used it daily all the time I've owned it. But after discovering the joys of owning and using an air fryer, (which is really a mini convection oven) I wanted more capacity and a digital interface. This Cosori fits the bill perfectly at a great price. If you are new to air fryers and cooking in one, there are things you need to know before you begin. First, after carefully unpacking it and removing any plastics, cardboard, paper, Styrofoam from both inside, and outside of the unit.. before ever plugging it in! Wash the basket and holder in gentle dish detergent and use a very soft cloth such as a microfiber or similar to protect the non stick coating. Let it dry and the next step is very important. All of these machines have factory residues and oils on them and in them that needs to be removed before you actually use it to cook with. You want to do this in well ventilated area because it possibly smoke and it will smell awful, much like plastic and oil. To remove this residue, move the machine to a well vented area or under a range hood that exhausts the fumes outside of your home. This unit has a preheat feature that runs at 400 degrees for 5 minutes. Simply run it once, and then again once more. The residue from the factory will be gone and your food will taste and smell great. The next thing you want to do is register your new product at the Cosori website and you will receive an extra whole year on your warranty! I have included a picture of the sleeve that is included with the product, it takes you directly to the website to register üòâ. Also never ever ever use non stick sprays like pam in these machines. It damages the non stick over time and ruins it! Fatty meats and foods need no oils, anything that does, just simply use the cooking oil of your choice, such as avocado, olive, canola etc. You can apply it to the basket with a paper towel or a hand sprayer. You need very little. Just enough for a little flavor browning and crisping and to help seasoning stick to the food. The presets are a starting point, but you will have to experiment to find what Temps and times work for you. If you are using frozen foods usually the cook time and Temps will be a lot less because these machines cook faster and more efficiently. I recommend dropping the stated temp 20-25 degrees and shortening the cook time by about 10 minutes as a starting point. You can always add more time or adjust the temp as you go and get more familiar with it. One more tip: always allow the fryer basket and drip tray to completley cool off before putting them in water to clean or soak it. If you put them in water hot, you can damage the nonstick coating! So far, this new machine has worked flawlessly and is giving me fantastic results. I will update this review after I have owned it longer and will tell of any issues that may arise. Good luck and enjoy your awesome air fryer!
title: Great machine! New at air frying? Read my beginner tips!

author: Ricardo Serradas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019
review_content: I had a connectivity (WiFi) issue after I moved to my new apartment.As I could not connect the Air Fryer to the same WiFi, I contacted their support to try helping me figure it out.Tia, from the support team, kept in touch for around three weeks trying to help me with this, putting a lot of effort and dedication to solve my problem. They tried everything until they decided to send me a brand new Air Fryer to make sure it was a hardware problem.When the new Air Fryer arrived, Tia notified me that their team kept investigating and they wanted me to try a different thing, which then worked! So, the problem was with my new Internet Service Provider connection, not with the Air Fryer itself.I cannot express how impressed I was with Tia's and the support team's dedication to solve a customer problem. They also sent me a prize for being patient as a customer for that long.They've got all my patience because I could see how passionate they were to have their customer's problems solved. Also, as I worked on a remote support team in the past, I know how difficult it is to troubleshoot and solve problems remotely, with no access to the customer's environment.Congratulations on the great product and great, amazing post sale support. You folks are amazing! Thank you!
title: Cosori's support is awesome!

author: carolan s.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
review_content: I don't typically write reviews but I love this thing. So first the disclaimer... this review is for the parents because well that's me.What I love:The wifi connection with the app- when I saw this feature my first thought was who would need this much gadgetry come on. But then there's the fact you can preheat it before u get home so it's ready or I can start it and walk away and get alerts that hey I have something cooking. You don't think it's a big thing but once you use it your like man I wish every appliance reminded me I was doing something.The basket-some reviews complained about the plastic piece and feeling flimsy or that the basket came apart too easy. That clear plastic piece covers a button. You have to slide that piece all the way up which can only be done when you have the basket out. Then you have to push the button all the way down and that releases the basket which you still have to pull out. Again that's my experience... I know things happen but that's how I worked for me. Plus the thing is huge. I easily feed my family of 3 or 4 when friends are over.The food-there is a learning curve with already prepared food like chicken nuggets or French fries from a bag. Yes I cook that stuff because I have kids and am comparable to their favorite restaurants now with this thing! I have learned to cut the cooking time in half and that's pretty accurate. The app has a ton of recipes too that are super easy for parents and not too gourmet. I do cook things that aren't in a bag and they come out amazing.I read reviews for this item and about 20 other ones. This one looked good on paper but then some of the reviews gave me concerns so I waited a month to purchase it. I'm sure there are flukes and things go wrong but for my experience it was as good as it is on paper. From a single mom point of view who has very little free time... This thing rocks!
title: Single mom pov: it's amazing!

author: RDA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: Too easy, I purchased the wifi enabled model last week. It makes cooking to easy, if I find myself craving a snack and with in minutes I have a plate of fries, onion rings or jalapeno poppers. Clean up is fast and simple, hot water soapy water and a quick wipe down with a sponge  and all done. Perfect for a single person or couple. UPDATE!; I am not very pleased with this product, the control panel is defective. I can only operate it with the Wifi app. The fryer works great but I would never recommend the Wifi model. I just lowered my rating to a 0ne star. 09/29/2020 I wanted to add to this review. I just noticed that the non stick finish is coming off of the basket. I have used nothing but a sponge to clean the surface. Very disappointed. I threw the unit away not wanting to consume any of the material. Unfortunately I can't lower my rating below a one star or I would. DO NOT BUY!
title: Too easy

author: Emily Noel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
review_content: We bought the Cosori airfryer seven months ago as a replacement for a cheap but sturdy one we used for 3 years (heavy users), and now we're getting a new one because it makes us nervous. Despite that, I'm still giving this fryer three stars, because it executes its core function really well despite its quirks.The good/great:Fantastic air-frying capabilities - the crispy outside to juicy inside ratio is always perfect or near to it and cooks pretty evenly even when we're too lazy to flip items. Makes beautiful fries.Great cooking area - the shape makes for a good surface to put lots of itemsVery easy to clean - cleans well in the dishwasher as well as by hand. Easy to wipe up mess.Pleasing design - I like it's square, shiny red finishEasy to operateThe bad/why we're replacing it 7 months in:It blows out of fuses. This has happened several times, and the main reason we're getting rid of it - it's blown out fuses on its own and when other appliances are on the same circuit; our wiring is pretty sturdy, so it's disturbing.It's falling apart. From the beginning the basket and the basket tray sorta rattled a bit, and what they've been doing over time is undoing the screws. We tightened it but one went missing (maybe in the dishwasher?) and there's two holding on for dear life; we're constantly having to tighten it. It seems to simply be a side effect of how its built.The tray sometimes rattles itself out of place and stops cooking - the tray sometimes rattles itself out and will stop the cooking process; probably a bit of operator error, howeverI would have definitely given this machine 5 stars when I first got it, but it unfortunately hasn't held up very well.
title: Great Airfryer in function, but not very well made.

author: p.c.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2019
review_content: I like it that it is easy to use. First, I used it for fries. It says to preheat for better and faster cooking results. The thing that I did not like was the fact that every time I preheat or just started cooking, it will always smoke up inside my house. My purpose in buying this was for easy cooking and cleaning indoor. I took it outside and tried cooking bacon and chicken eith the pre-set setting on the menu display and it cooked well. The tray is easy to clean but the air fryer itself inside wasn't easy to clean.
title: Preheat smoked up inside my house. Cooking fries only smoked inside the house. Not good for indoor.

author: D. Young
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†I have used this air fryer a lot over the past half a year. At first, I wondered if Air Fryers were worth the hype, and I can attest to the fact that they are. I loved this thing for the first couple months, recommended it to friends who went and bought it too.
