Now, as much as I want to be loyal and keep the brand, find myself worried about longevity.I don't know if I would consider this air fryer to be expensive, because with as much as we use it, it is worth every penny and is about the price of a mid-range microwave. But it was a purchase I didn't have a lot of excess money for and I was bummed it hasn't lasted six months. It doesn't appear cheaply made so I wonder if I have a lemon or something.So let me jump into the issues I have after many, many uses. The worst is that the air fryer drawer pops open sometimes while cooking... almost shoots out a foot or more, clear out of the fryer itself. It had issues remaining shut previously, with steam coming out the bottom sides. I remedied that by firmly pushing it back in again and it typically "sealed" up. Now it just pops completely out of the unit onto the counter.Up until that point, the only thing I disliked is the touch screen interface it uses for programming time, temperature etc. It is finicky and doesn't always register a finger-press... sometimes pressing more than a few times to get it to register. Sometimes it will not register prints at all.So, I'm unsure if I got the lemon of the bunch, and I really want to love this air fryer. I still use it... just with caution and while I am around.
title: Pops Open While Cooking

author: K. Tallman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2020
review_content: Good capacityEasy to useAfter first use the plastic front of the unit separated/warped from the basket - interestingly after unit heats up the plastic moves back in placeFlaking of whatever material is used to make up the non-stick coatingInner basket warped after a few uses - does not interfere with cooking thoughHandle has fallen apart - have to click back in place on two sides before each useBasket has actually ejected on its own while cooking despite being latched - the unit does not operate unless it is latched so it is not operator error - one ejection actually threw the food onto the floorWill be replacing this air-fryer with another brand - really like the results of air-frying and don't want to do without
title: Will Not Do Without An Air-fryer Now - Just Not This One

author: me123
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019
review_content: This is a pretty good air fryer. I knocked a star off because I think its a bit expensive for a brand I've never heard of. Otherwise, I've cooked pork, fish, brussel sprouts, fries, all sorts of things in it and it works well. Size-wise, I can easily fit two mackerels in it - three very crowded. Food turns out well. I was afraid it would be another kitchen gadget I would buy, use a few times, and end up cluttering the countertop, but I have used it at least once a week, for the past few months. Cooking fish (especially mackerel) can be stinky, but I just put this gadget right over the stovetop, turn on the stovetop ventilation, and it is the easiest, cleanest, least-stinky way of cooking fish.
title: Decent sized air fryer

author: Rafael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: I was originally going to purchase another brand since it was 10qtz in size which was much more ideal for me, however it has been out of stock for a while so I decided to get this one instead and honestly.... im not disappointed. This air fryer actually hold its own in terms of size, and functionality, for reference you can fit a whole small chicken or 5 large chicken legs with no issues, and the pre sets are on point with the cooking time. Food cooks pretty fast, within 20 minutes you can get a few things done, Such as roasted potatoes and some fried/roasted chicken. Totally time efficient.Cons, the only issue I have with this air fryer is that the heat tends to flow more on a specific side, so food that tends to settle on the "weak spot" usually end up unevenly cooked, not horribly uncooked however, ive had an easy time fixing that by just shaking the basket and setting up 5 extra minutes to cook. I do like that the air fryer will tell you on the screen at some point to "shake the basket", it will almost always tell you this, so that you can redistribute the food evenly. Especially important if you're cooking things like French fries/loose foods. Another con would be the material for the basket.... it seems to be teflon or some sort of cheap non stick material which are usually not that great for our health so id caution everyone to NEVER scrub the basket and simply just use a soft sponge to avoid the material from scraping off over time.All in all, the air fryer is doing an amazing job. I havemt used my stove in over a week because I've been roasting all my food on this. However, if you're looking for something to bake a large cake, casserole etc. Then this is not it, its simply too small for larger dishes or a big family. A 8 to 10Q air fryer or convection oven might be more ideal. The air fryer also looks nice on the kitchen and doesn't take too much space. The noise isn't too bad either. It won't replace your stove altogether, but it makes an amazing addition for smaller 'side dishes' that would otherwise take forever to make on a normal oven or stoveBelow for reference are some photos of a medium and mini loaf pans you can fit in the basket:Both Mini pan dimensions: 5¬≤¬≥/32 in. X3 ‚Åµ/16 in. X 1‚Å∑/8 in.Medium: 8 in. X 3 ‚Å∑/8 in. x 2 ¬π‚Åµ/32 in.I will update you all in regards to the durability and functionality over time and see if anything changes.
title: It has its pros and cons, but so far so good.

author: thoughtful consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
review_content: I‚Äôve had this Air Fryer for about a week, and so far it hasn‚Äôt disappointed. I like the square basket-I think it fits food better. I was able to easily fit 6 chicken tenders with room for at least 2-3 more. Cleaning the basket (and the base that the basket rests in) has been very easy, but I do use a soft-bristle kitchen brush on a long handle to get into all the openings in the basket. The air fryer is big and does take up counter space, but it‚Äôs not heavy to move around. I keep it on my rolling kitchen cart and move it to my counter to use it. I do rest it on a large, wooden cutting board when using just in case the bottom gets warm. The instructions are easy to understand, and using the control panel is fairly intuitive. I haven‚Äôt used the pre-settings. I prefer to set my own temperature and time. The vent in the back releases hot air when in use. I was able to put my hand about two inches from the vent without difficulty. Still, I give about 5‚Äù of space on all sides just to be safe. I didn‚Äôt find it too loud. I mean, it circulates hot air with a fan so there‚Äôs going to be some noise, but It didn‚Äôt annoy me.So far I‚Äôve made French fries with russet potatoes, a chocolate cake (see photo) and chicken tenders (homemade, not frozen. See photo). All three items turned out delicious. The cake was divine-especially the second day (I have no idea why). The chicken tenders were crunchy on the outside and not the least bit dry on the inside. The fries would have been over-cooked had I left them in for the full amount of time the recipe called for. They were crisp on the outside. The cake recipe stated 30 minutes at 330 degrees. My attempt took 55 minutes at 330 degrees. I wasn‚Äôt surprised by this. I thought 30 minutes seemed too short. My advice is, check your food often at first to get a feel for the fryer. This is really no different than getting used to a new oven or other cooking appliance. You need to play around with times and temperatures a bit. Also, get a good air fryer cookbook or some highly-rated recipes online.Pros:-Easy to use, intuitive-easy clean up-keeps kitchen cool in summer-don‚Äôt have to heat up your oven for a small amount of food-1 to 2 minutes to preheat or no preheating for some recipes-Large basket, and square shape seems to fit food very well-basket has a safety feature so you won‚Äôt accidentally release it from the base it sits in-much healthier than deep fried foods, but you can still get that crispy crunchinessCons:-It‚Äôs large. You will lose counter space unless you can store it somewhere and take it out when needed.-if you are cooking for a large group, you‚Äôre going to be cooking in batches. The basket size works fine for our family of three with two light eaters, but even one more person at the table would have me cooking in batches.-If your looking for something to give you the same, exact taste as genuine fried food, this isn‚Äôt for you. It‚Äôs not an actual fryer. The name is deceiving. It‚Äôs really a countertop convection oven. The recipes use minimal oil (1 Tbsp for the fries I made and several sprays of olive oil on the chicken tenders with an olive oil spritzer).I would recommend this model so far without hesitation, but it‚Äôs only been one week and three recipes. If anything changes, I‚Äôll update my review. I hope this helps you make a decision.
title: Great appliance  if you have the space and understand this isn‚Äôt a true fryer

author: GB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
review_content: UPDATE 3:  I opened the fryer and found a screw in my food.  The screw came from the basket.  The other screws were loose, too.  I would advise checking the screws periodically to be safe.UPDATE 2:  They offered to replace the air fryer but shipping delays lasted for weeks.  Eventually, they refunded the purchase price.  I purchased another unit and have had no problem.  I use the replacement air fryer almost daily.UPDATE:  I initially rated this 5-starts.  I am sorry that I need to update the review.  The air fryer is not consistently recognizing when the basket is inserted.  While doing a 40 minute cook, it turned off after 7 minutes thinking the basket was not present.  I have had problems with this before but this time jiggling the basket would not resolve the problem.  I had to resort to using  a kitchen knife to get the fryer to recognize that the basket was installed (see photo).  Eventually, it won't recognize the basket even with the knife.I have also had issues with the touch panel not recognizing when a button is pushed but that wasn't a problem as I could use my iPhone and the WIFI connection to set the temp, time, etc.Original Review:I highly recommend the WiFi version of the Cosori 5.8 quart air fryer.  We have had ours for the less than a month and use it almost daily while we try out new recipes.The iPhone app connects with the Cosori Smart WIFi air fryer.  You can select a recipe illustrated in the app or you can manually set the time and temperature and start cooking.  The app updates you on the progress of the cooking -- how many minutes are left, when to shake, when cooking is done.If the air fryer did not have the WiFi feature, I would have returned the air fryer because the buttons for manually changing cooking time and temperature on the fryer are difficult to use.  The time and temperature buttons on  don't always register when you push them.  This is NOT a problem if you have a smart phone and purchase the WiFi enabled air fryer.I have recommended this air fryer to several family members.
title: There is a problem!  A screw loose!

author: Mona Lisa (M.W.)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: I was never going to jump on the air fryer bandwagon,... but alas like many, I finally caved in.  When I finally decided to take the plunge, I did a ton of research.  There are SO many different brands to choose from that it was overwhelming, to say the least.  I wanted white,  and I found out that not all brands have white as a choice,...which is a shame because many people would prefer white in their all-white kitchens.  Even the top (expensive!) Phillips does not sell their digital XXL version in white.  (only the analog XXL- I called them)Reasons why I chose Cosori:1. White was a choice, and I like the way it looks.  Some brands are just too gaudy looking for me and I wouldn't want to leave them out in my kitchen.2. I liked that it doesn't keep cooking when the drawer is pulled out, and that the count-down time pauses too. Some brands (including the Phillips) don't pause when the drawer is pulled out.3. I  liked the half-way shake reminder feature on some of the pre-sets.  Yes, I've been using them a lot. Very convenient for things like fries, chickpeas, cauliflower, green beans, etc.  You don't have to set a timer to remind you to shake.4. I liked the pre-heat feature.5.  The 5.8-quart size was right for the two of us. (anything smaller would be too small in my opinion,...even for one person!)Upon setup and after washing,  I placed the Cosori on a cutting board, on top of my stove under my kitchen vent-hood and set the temp on 400 for 30 minutes.  I had the fan on but yes we could smell the stuff burning off.  After the first session, I let the air fryer cool down and then repeated once again for good measure.  After that,  there was no smell.I've been using the Cosori for the past three weeks, sometimes several times a day.  I will say that air frying is somewhat of a learning curve,  but if you know how to cook in the first place it doesn't take long to get into the swing of it.  I have had some great results!  It's fun to try new things and experiment.  One of our favorite things that I've made thus far is Salmon.  THE BEST!  I will share my recipe below.For two people, we get a one-pound, skin-on, center-cut piece of Whole Food's farm-raised. ($9.99 per lb always)  I cut the thinner belly meat off of that to save for breakfast,  and then I cut the big piece into two pieces.Dry salmon with paper towels.Pre-heat Cosori to 400Salt and pepper all sides of salmon except for the skin side.Mix together well:1Tablespoon honey1 Tablespoon mustard (I use spicy brown)1 Tablespoon melted butter (I use ghee)pinch of salt-Sometimes I shake a little garlic powder in with the honey, mustard, and butter-Place salmon pieces in basket (either lined with a little foil or not)Spread the honey-mustard mixture over the top of the salmon pieces.Set the machine for 12-13 minutes and that's it. (no turning) The time it takes will be determined by the thickness of the salmon. I look for the albumin to start to form (the white stuff) and then I know that it's done.  So far mine seems to be done in about 12 minutes, but they are fairly thick pieces.  Start checking at about 10.  Serve with lemon wedges. It is absolutely delicious and my husband who is not a salmon lover says it's the best salmon he's ever eaten.Cleanup:Cleanup has been a breeze.  I just soak the basket inside of the bucket in hot soapy water for a few minutes and everything comes off easily.*I haven't experienced any smoking at all yet.You can't go wrong with the Cosori air fryer.  I bought another one to gift to my daughter. Recommended!UPDATE June 2021: I bought this in August 2020.  I can no longer adjust temperatures when I'm in the pre-sets. It hasn't even been one year.  Also,  I have to keep screwing the handle onto the basket.
title: Three weeks in and loving it!  Update: removal of 3 stars for poor lifespan

author: Chris Fisher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
review_content: I just finished making the most amazing batch of buffalo-style wings in our new Cosori air fryer.  Honestly, about the best I've ever had.  It is easy to use, easy to clean, and has earned a permanent spot on our kitchen counter.  It re-heats food like it was made fresh (think pizza etc.), doesn't require an oven preheat, no oil.Now, the customer support part.  We ordered this online and used it first for some fried chicken.  it was delicious, but it behaved a little strangely - would suddenly cut out for a few seconds, and then come back on.  I thought that's weird, but maybe that's what it's supposed to do?  Anyway, it got worse and eventually stopped working after the 4th or 5th use.  By this time it was too late to return to Amazon so I contacted customer support via their website chat.Within about 10 minutes we had a new one on the way, no charge, no return required, and 4 days later we received the properly functioning we have now.  I wanted to wait until we got the new one to check out before I reviewed.THAT's how customer service is supposed to work when things go wrong.  You back up your product when something's not right.  So kudos to Cosori for a really great kitchen appliance, and triple kudos for their customer support.I would not hesitate to buy another anything from Cosori.
title: Absolutely wonderful product, and great product support

author: Kellobyte
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
review_content: This thing is seriously just a convection oven but has a smaller cooking area. Buy the Nuwave or any other generic convection oven. They cook the same, have a much larger cooking area, and are far more affordable. If you have a family of 4 like I do you would have to have 3 of these air fryers to cook a full dinner. Buy a convection oven, load a whole chicken and veggies in it, hit the button and wait for an amazingly easy, and delicious, dinner is done in very little time.
title: Tiny cooking area

author: MikeL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2019
review_content: I bought this unit, in August 2019 and have cooked with it 4 to 8 times a week since. The food turns out delicious every single time! I have NO complaints about its ability to air fry food. This is my 4th air fryer but 1st Cosori.
title: GREAT Air Fryer For GREAT Price

author: Spencer Narwhal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
review_content: A reasonable air fryer, it is very easy to use and produces reasonable air fried food. It can be somewhat tough to clean, but I imagine this is a problem with just about any air fryer. The non-stick coating is wearing off in a few places because of how the machine is designed and the basket is supported, but this isn't a deal-breaker.I wish I could disable the beeps, but I understand this isn't a ubiquitous feature yet, so it's OK.The biggest problem is the durability. I used this machine moderately for 1 year -- maybe once per week. I was always gentle with it, never abused it. Really fair use. But after just over 1 year of use the handle cracked off, rendering the fryer useless. $120/yr is a lot to pay for an air fryer. I urge you to find another option.
title: Great function, poor durability

author: amazoncassius
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†My unit didn't work.  Took a few pieces of freshly julienned fries spaced evenly, 400 for 40 minutes then 380 for 25 minutes; setting button for fries gives 380 for 15 minutes.  pics and video upload.I posted my first review 9 days after ordering, when Amazon said they needed to get back to me about getting a replacement unit (https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/RUZ4FRYCLIAOX?ref=pf_ov_at_pdctrvw_srp) I posted my second review a few months later, after the item, linked to my purchase, disappeared from the site, and Amazon said they would get back to me (https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R1VJA7EM7BP0K2?ref=pf_ov_at_pdctrvw_srp).  I contacted Amazon just now, and they said they will get back to me.  Crossing my fingers, :).
title: Mine didn't work, but I hear air fryers are great when they do.

author: Pandamom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019
review_content: As a working parent, I don‚Äôt have an hour to spend in the kitchen preparing dinner, nor do I particularly enjoy cooking. Yet I want to provide a good nutritious meal for my child. I bought an instant pot thinking it‚Äôll reduce my dinner prep times, but most of the recipes have a long list of ingredients that I don‚Äôt have time for ....so when I received this air fryer and the recipe book with super easy instructions and fewer than 10 ingredients needed, I was overjoyed. So far I have tried frozen chicken nuggets, frozen sweet potato fries, grilled cheese sandwich and teriyaki salmon. My daughter loves every dish made in it! I couldn‚Äôt be happier.
title: A working mom‚Äôs perfect companion

author: Mr ATC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019
review_content: This was my first experience with air-frying, and it was awful. I cooked chicken twice, and although it cooked adequately the meat smelled and tasted of melted plastic. In fact, the smell from the unit (plastic smell) permeated throughout my house. I returned the product, and this unit has deterred me from trying another. Not recommended.
title: I returned it

author: Brandi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
review_content: The food that comes from this air fryer is incredible. I am in LOVE with air frying as a healthy option for quick and crispy food! BUT, DO NOT BUY THE TOUCH SCREEN MODEL!!! I have never wanted to throw something out the window so bad as this thing. It works absolutely perfectly 25% of the time, the rest it will not turn on or off! I have to unplug to turn it off almost every single time. I want to return it and buy one with a knob. So frustrating!!Edited to add: Cosori customer service is top notch! They are replacing my air fryer with a dial version (the one I wanted) and are refunding me the difference between the two models. They told me to keep the old one to use as spare parts if needed. In my opinion this is above and beyond.
title: Amazing - when it works!

author: Doctor B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021
review_content: My wife and I have been using for only about one week, and so we may change our review ratings and comments later.  Here is what we have found in our first week of use of this COSORIAir Fryer Max XL 5.8 quart:Pros:A. Nice design in general,  clean features.B. Lots of manuals and directions on how to set it up.  Make sure you remove the foam insert as well as the cardboard inserts and ALL the tapes before you plug it in and use it for the first time.  Triple check if necessary.  There are many inserts of different kinds in this air fryer for shipping purposes.C. Nice recipe book.D. Two year warranty if you register on the COSORI website (see insert in box).  Lots of info required including the batch number which is by the way on the bottom of the air fryer (you will have to till it over) . It is written sideways next to the tag at the bottom.Cons:1. This COSORI air fryer model is in general sturdily built except for the clear plastic slider on the front handle that allows the cooking chamber to be slid out.  Please see attached picture.  This plastic slider is flimsy, jiggles and will not last long.  I cannot understand why COSORI would build what looks like a nice air fryer and then insert such a flimsy slider on its handle. You will have to buy a whole chamber container when this slider snaps off--as it will.2.  COSORI does not provide any accessories. You will have to spend another $30 to buy necessary accessories.3.  Cleaning is a pain because again you will have to slide the above mentioned plastic slider out of the way to press a button to release the cooking chamber so that you can clean the bottom part UNLESS you buy parchment liners which again is another $7 to 12 expense.4. COSORI doesn't provide you with any sample parchment liner which would help keep the air fryer clean.  So you will have to figure out exactly what size parchment liner paper to buy from Amazon.  For our 5.8 quart air fryer, an 8.5 inch Square is what will work.  I found that out after searching the internet.  Nothing is mentioned about parchment liners in any of the manuals COSORI provides with air fryer.
title: Nice looking but flimsy handle plastic slider

author: Tina R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019
review_content: I have a total love/hate for this air fryer. I love the taste of the foods, the crispiness, and the ease of cooking in this machine. However, the smell of burning plastic or chemicals does NOT go away, we have used it many many times in hopes that it would. It's not as bad about halfway through the cooking because you start to smell the food, but the preheating and beginning of cooking is almost unbearable. My husband who isn't usually bothered by stuff like this, gets nauseous from the smell because it's so bad, and I have to leave all the windows open when cooking. I'm concerned what this smell could be, and how harmful it is that my children and I are breathing it in. Because of this, I don't ever really want to use it anymore! Also, it's a nightmare to clean when you make anything greasy in it, like fried chicken, or any kind of meat. The fat and grease have too many crevices to go in the inner container and you really have to scrub those out well, which is difficult. The bottom portion is easy to clean, but the one with the holes and slots is not. Also, there is no real easy way to clean the area inside the machine that all the grease is splattering on - the heating coils! I try to get up there with a wet towel to try to clean the grease off, but there are so many areas I can't reach and what comes off on the napkin is disgusting. I don't know if all air fryers are like this, but there should be an easier way to clean these things, but the deal breaker is mainly the burning plastic smell. It's just too powerful and potent, I just can't imagine that's not absolutely toxic for all of us.
title: Burning Plastic smell doesn't go away, difficult to clean

author: S. Hall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
review_content: **UPDATE**Stopped working after four uses.**UPDATE**I've owned other desktop / countertop ovens. Given the reviews I was expecting this to at least measure up to my previous experience.First, it smelled awful the first few times I used it even after washing it and priming it with a few pre heat cycles.Using the preset chicken option my chicken was burned, dry and tasteless. Cooking meat in it, even with marinating overnight, was a forgettable meal.I think you'd be happier with a convection oven plus a rice cooker. If I had to do it over again I would go that route and save a few $$$ and have a known better experience.
title: Stopped working after 4 uses.

author: Tom Copeland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
review_content: Purchased on March 21, 2019, COSORI Air Fryer 5.8 Qt. Electric Hot Air Fryer from Amazon.com Services, Inc with a certified, 2 year Warranty.  Quit working on May 18, 2019.  Need I say more! Worked for two months and would NOTeven come "on".  Started turning "off" and would come back "on" two weeks prior to its total failure! I contacted the manufacture on the COSORI and provided them with the information on purchased and a new COSORI arrived in a few days.  Great response on replacing failed air fryer, and great customer service!
title: Will Buy Again

author: Apollo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021
review_content: The touch controls on the fryer are a JOKE!! They hardly recognize touch so it‚Äôs very frustrating trying to change the cook time or temperature. Usually takes pressing 3 or 4 times hunting for the ‚Äúsweet spot‚Äù that works for the button.It took me 2 hours to get the device connected to my WiFi network because the application sucks!The non-stick is starting to rub off where the basket and bottom tray touch. There is no filter or anything on the back so the wall behind the air fryer has grease and small food bits all over it. Luckily the wall has tile so I can scrub it off with harsh cleaning chemicals. If it were a painted wall it would never come off.On a positive note, the fryer cooks nicely.
title: Dirty machine with very very poor touch controls

author: Miss Mocha Latte
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019
review_content: This is my first air fryer so I am totally amazed with the technology.  Instant, perfect results.  I was contemplating a new toaster oven when I got this, but one week later I unplugged the toaster oven to be replaced with my Cosori air fryer! It makes breakfast bagel sandwiches to rival Panera ... toast the bagel, fry the egg, and grill up sausage in the Cosori ... and cleanup is wiping out two baskets.  Hash browns, fries and onion rings brown to perfection ... way crispier than deep fry.  Corned beef hash cooks up great.  Turkey burgers from frozen to grilled in 12 minutes, and the bread toasts up in the same pan.  Fried chicken is wonderful with panko bread crumbs.  Hot dogs are perfectly grilled and buns are toasted to perfection.  I chose the Cosori based on customer reviews on Amazon but I checked out other brands in stores and none meet Cosori quality.  If you are new to air frying like me, an instant read thermometer is a must and something to lift dishes and pans out of the basket is good.  I use a lifter that came with a Insta Pot accessory set.  I found most of my cookware works fine .. that is, if it fits in the basket.  This air fryer has improved the way I toast, grill, bake and fry.  It's a popular cooking trend, you can Google any recioe you want online .... "How do you make a baked apple in an air fryer?"
title: Great Taste Without The Calories

author: shelia thomas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
review_content: The preset buttons didn‚Äôt work well upon purchase and now only a few buttons are functional. I wish I‚Äôd done more research and bought one with a knob. It‚Äôs very frustrating cooking something when the temperature button fails to work properly.
title: Buttons don‚Äôt work well

author: Dianne M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019
review_content: I researched air fryers for some time before I chose the 5.8 Cosori.  It arrived and although it looked great and was packaged well, I will return it.  The problem is the drawer. It is very difficult to slide in and out and just feels very clumsy.  I will be ordering a different one.  Since I haven‚Äôt seen mention of this on reviews, I am assuming it could be defective.
title: Disappointing

author: Lydia Byun
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
review_content: I wanted a new, larger air fryer as my OG Philips was getting old (albeit still running great!) - so I decided against my better judgment to try a cheaper brand based on the great reviews....but ended up regretting it immensely. Initial impression was that it looked great out of the box, but when using it I noticed the build of the machine was of much lower quality than my old Philips.Just some cons to note (tried it for 1 month):-The basket was really hard to pull in and out of the air fryer as well as difficult to detach from the bottom basket-Like other reviews mentioned, the touchpad is wonky and unresponsive. I had to touch buttons multiple times repeatedly for it to respond and it was really annoying-Biggest con for me... THE SMELL. Immediately when opening the basket, I noticed a very strong, unpleasant chemical/plastic smell. Based on instructions, it said to run the air fryer empty on high for 10-15min. However, the smell would not go away and seeped into my food, making it inedible (not to mention making my kitchen smell terrible). I tried washing multiple times, running with lemon/vinegar water, running on empty for MULTIPLE times, etc. This chemical smells reinforces my feeling that the materials they use are cheap and low quality.-Final straw... I finally got the smell to be bearable, but when I tried heating up some food, the machine started only blowing COLD air and wouldn't work...tldr; Smelled gross & stopped working after a month with less than 10 uses so I returned it and am going to buy a new Phillips XXL instead :)
title: Would not recommend...

author: Jean Turicik
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2019
review_content: 5.8.2019 UPDATE to my original review:  I have referred 12 friends to the Cosori Air Fryer since I purchased in January of 2019 and all of them have purchased it and ALL of them love it!  This Air Fryer cooks everything like a dream-beef tenderloin comes out perfect from medium on the ends to medium rare throughout the middle. Pork, Beef, Chicken, Lamb, Fish, Roasted Vegetables, hard boiled eggs, frozen foods-you name it. In fact I am thinking about purchasing a 2nd Air fryer so I can do my meat and veggies at the same time.  I highly recommend this model.We received our Air Fryer a few days ago and we are really happy with it.  We've made a blooming onion (80% fewer calories than old recipe), chicken wings, chicken tenders and tonight we will make a roast chicken, with roasted corn and sweet potato fries.  This Air Fryer is very easy to use, and very easy to clean.  I purchased after doing much research on many different models-finally decided on this one based on Amazon reviews, and again-we are very happy so far.  Motivation to purchase derived from being on Weight Watchers and wanting to experience that "deep fried" goodness without all the fat--and boy this is the way to do it.  I highly recommend this unit.
title: Best Kitchen Tool Ever!

author: That PC Dude
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020
review_content: Let me start by saying this is my go to for cooking lots of things. We even use it to reheat drive thru fries that have gotten cold by the time we get home which make them just like they came out of the fryer. I really enjoy is it being the wifi model and it works with Alexa.On the down side. After almost a year of use, the front panel is very hard to use. I'm glad I have the wifi model because that still works perfectly. I press on front panel buttons and sometimes have to do it hard. I often cannot adjust time or temperature. I'm afraid it fail completely soon. We wash the basket in dishwasher and found the screws holding the basket to he handle worked out. I lost two and was able to find substitutes and ended up buying another basket since I sometimes will cook different things for the same meal.There is a bit of learning curve but the included recipe book and the app are very helpful. You have to experiment because some things come out great and some do better cooking in the oven.I would have given it 5 Stars but I'm afraid it will not be a long lasting appliance.
title: I love it BUT...

author: Seth M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: BEWARE! I received the smart air fryer two days ago and every single time i used it, smoke comes out from the sides and smells like burning plastic.I reached out to Cosori customer service through email because you can‚Äôt get ahold of them through the phone and sent them a video of the problem. They have an automated message reply to me. I replied and the same exact automated message would reply back. This is ridiculous.I DO NOT want my kitchen to catch fire.Horrible customer service. Beware of this fire hazard
title: BEWARE

author: Jonathan Bartholomew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020
review_content: Alright.... First the positive.... The food tastes amazing. When it works properly you'll love it. It has a large basket compared to other so you can cook a decent volume of food too. Now for the reality check.... The screen buttons work about 15% of the time... Almost useless. It forces you to use the app... Which works great until it doesn't work anymore... I bought this and I'm ready to replace it 6 months later. Look for something that is higher quality and easy to use... The malfunctioning screen and app are enough to make you pull your hair out.
title: Screen failure and app failure.... Keep looking.

author: Steven G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_content: SEVERE SAFETY HAZARD  During cooking the unit shot the 380 degree basket out onto my kitchen floor.  It narrowly missed me and not the basket will not stay in the unit at all.  It just keeps shooting the basket out.
title: SEVERE SAFETY HAZARD

author: RileyMommy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: Have never been able to get the touchscreen front to respond. The app keeps making me reload and resume. It mainly just sits there and makes me wish I bought another brand.The very few times it has worked the food has been excellent- which is a shame as I cannot use it as intended (to work vs a taken up counter top space spot).
title: Touch screen doesn‚Äôt work

author: Adam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2021
review_content: This is easily the most annoying purchase I‚Äôve made on Amazon. I hated it immediately but was too lazy to send it back. I‚Äôll replace it eventually.The setting ‚Äúbuttons‚Äù don‚Äôt work 75%+ of the times they‚Äôre pressed. Then, because you‚Äôve pressed it 20 times rapid fire to get it to move 5 minutes, it starts skipping digits which would be helpful if the buttons actually worked. But they don‚Äôt.What‚Äôs more frustrating is that the power button is right beneath the button you have to press if you want to switch from degrees to time‚Ä¶ something you have to press twice for every cook. The amount of times I have accidentally powered it off amidst the frustration of having to press the button so many times is unreal. Granted, that‚Äôs my fault technically, but of course the settings are reset when it powers off and I have to do it all over again.The smartphone app is virtually just an alternative to the aforementioned settings. You can‚Äôt start the device with the app. I‚Äôm sure there are uses for it, but for me it is completely useless other than the alert when it‚Äôs done.Alexa never works well with it. It‚Äôs a gimmick.Whoever designed this device must have been going for looks with no concern for user experience.
title: Most frustrating Amazon purchase I‚Äôve made

author: Waldy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
review_content: The air fryer works great. I use it everyday and I know there‚Äôs plenty more that I can cook/bake in it. I fully recommend the product, however buyers need to be aware of the following:1) it is not the easiest to clean. The slots on the sides to allow air flow will routinely build up grease and it is not easy to get off.2) and this is a WARNING: there are a few screws that attach the handle to the basket. THESE SCREWS BECOME LOOSE AND WILL FALL OUT!! This is a common issue for other people that have purchased this air fryer. This could potentially cause the handle to fall off while carrying extremely hot food. Be sure to check and tighten them frequently!
title: Good air fryer but there is a WARNING!!

author: Glam Sparks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019
review_content: OVERALL: Other than the chemical smell that won't go away, the unit is cumbersome to use, not user friendly and lacks a good cooking process.OUR EXPERIENCEOur Philips XL was great and used so much, we eventually wore out the track.  Seeing reviews for COSORI and price difference between a new Philips XL, we purchased the COSORI.  So this review is between our experience with the Philips XL & the COSORI.1)  COSORI emits a chemical smell.  Washed the interior unit before use and after every use, however the chemical smell is getting stronger.  Have it stored in our kitchen utility cabinet and every time we open the cabinet we can smell the chemicals and it gets worse when cooking with it.2)  Instructions say to press preheat button first, before selecting what temperature and time you want to cook something.  So it's a 2 step process that requires monitoring.  The preheat button counts down from 5 minutes, then the unit shuts off.  So we are expected to press the preheat, watch it for 5 minutes and when it's done, select the temperature and cooking time for what we want to cook.  This is cumbersome !  Prefer the Philips where we select cooking temperature and time and it will beep when unit hits our desired temperature and maintain that temperature ready for us to put our food in anytime.4)  COSORI is bulky to handle when giving food contents a shake during cooking cycle:  - the entire bottom unit has to be shaken, not "just the basket"  - the unit shuts off every time the cooking department is pulled out so heat is not just lost by pulling the tray out to check on the food or give it a shake, but more heat is lost because unit shuts off  and must be manually started again.5)  maybe it's the unit shutting off every time the basket is pulled out to check or stir the food that causes COSORI unit does not even come close to cooking food as evenly as the Philips XLFor all the above reasons, after two weeks of using the COSORI, we dumped it and replaced it with Philips XXL so we are happy again; sure it's double the price but quadruple the quality!  We are no longer worried about chemicals in our food and have to endure bad chemicals smells in kitchen from the COSORI.  We are writing the manufacturer with our complaint - no one should feel comfortable with a unit that emits strong chemical smells.  As for the user experience in the cooking process, it takes the fun out of air frying.
title: Literally "stinks" & cumbersome too

author: John Q Public
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021
review_content: I wish it had come with some silicone pinch mitts.  The basket get pretty hot which is to be expected.  I have silicone gloves and silicone mitts but silicone pinch mitts would have been very useful.  Cleaning is simple but takes a bit of time.  Advice tip is to clean the inside of your Cosori each and every time that way you don't get things splattered and baked solid, you don't to have to do a deep cleaning.I wish Cosori had a kit with things you needed.  I'd be happy to buy it separately or added to the Air Fryer for a higher price.  When shaking the basket you will loosen the handle (at least that is what I've read online).  I've been shaking with the handle with my right hand and using a silicone glove grasping the basket.  Be careful about buying substandard gloves because they will only protect your hands for seconds.  Advice tip silicone gloves can be used in the Air Fryer, oven and cleaning the ice/snow off your car.  I'm looking for a small heat resistant spatula (like the George Foreman Grill type)  and a heat resistant tongs.  You probably have metal tongs in your kitchen but you don't want to scratch the nonstick coating so you want nonmetal tongs.  If Cosori sold their own branded utensils for the Air Fryer I'd buy from them with confidence.  I've been looking at various utensils for my Cosori and the reviews aren't so good, I don't want melting utensils.I'd happy purchase another Cosori Air Fryer as a gift because it is cool on the outside and seems to be made very well.  I've read online that they respect their customers and respond promptly about problems or replacement parts.  Same thing is said on Youtube videos.  Cosori gives you at 1 year warranty but bumps it upto 2 year if you do your product registration in something like two weeks (I think it is two weeks).  Get the extra protection for free.  I haven't actually contacted Cosori because I've have zero problems but it is nice to know that they stand behind their product.A problem that is confounding many customers is how to open the dang Air Fryer.  I couldn't find the answer in the instructions.You want to push the button down with your right thumb (and push right thumb forwards at the same time).  At the same precise time you want to pull your right hand back.  It opens easily but it can be a bit confusing at first.There are plenty of Youtube videos showing how to use the Cosori and I think if you have any questions fellow Youtuber or the cook who posted them will answer your questions.Oh yeah you can buy smaller and it will cook faster which might be better if you are single and want smaller servings. The Cosori seems to be the perfect size, not to small but not too big.  I'm happy with the basket size.This is my first Air Fryer so I can't speak with much experience.  Other Air Fryers brands might be just as good, I don't know.  All I know is that my Cosori has been running like a champ.
title: Great for quickly cooking.

author: Ed Dodson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021
review_content: I bought this air fryer because of a recommendation on a cooking website and a good rating by Consumer Reports and it has lived up to the recommendations.  It is easy to use and works well.  The included recipe book is really good and I have found a wealth of air fryer recipies online.  I am loving air frying and looking for ways to convert some of my old recipes to air frying.The produce is well constructed, sturdy, and easy to use.  Cleaning is also simple.  There is a safety lock on the handle of the fryer pan so that the inner basket that holds the food can't dethatch from the pan when it is lifted after removal from the oven.The controls are easy to use and arranged in an intuitive manner.  Cooking times are short and seem very accurate, resulting in a consistent level of doneness of the food.  My wife loves crisp French fries and the air fryer is able to produce them consistently to her level of crispiness.  Another real hit was Chicken Fried Steak;  I have avoided this due to the high fat content with conventional frying.  Preparing this in the Air Fryer was q
title: Good Product

author: Steve-O
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
review_content: My halogen convection air fryer finally died and after a little research I decided to purchase the Cosori 5.8 WiFi Air Fryer.Set up was a breeze and the AF worked really well. Clean-up is fast and easy. I used the WiFi connection via my phone and the Vesync App to control the AF. But when I tried to use the actual touch pad on the AF to control the cooking the Time/Temp button did not function properly. Sometimes it would work and more often than not it didn't work at all. That meant I could not adjust the cooking time or cooking temperature manually. Amazon did a quick exchange and sent me a new AF promptly. Cudos and thanks to Amazon. No down time. When I received the new unit first thing I did was check the touch pad for function and it worked fine. Fast forward to the 2nd time I used the AF and the Time/Temp button was malfunctioning again. The problem is not as bad as before but there is still a problem. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. There is a Cosori Air fryer group on FB and more than a few people have indicated that they have had the same problem with the touch pad on their WiFi models. I did not see any posts indicating problems with the non-WiFi models. So, not sure what do now: on my 2nd AF and undecided whether to keep it and use the Vesync app or exchange it for the non-WiFi model. My hope is that Cosori will find and correct the issue with a firmware update. If you are thinking about getting a Cosori AF I would definitely recommend the non-WiFi model. Also, I recommend the 5.8 size and you may want to shop for some accessories like wire racks to place inside the AF basket for multi-level cooking. All things considered I think it is still a good AF. If you want help, inspiration or cooking ideas check out the Cosori Air Fryer group on FB.Update: Received 2nd Cosori Smart Air Fryer and Temp/Time button still does not function properly. Have to use WiFi App to control cooking.
title: Problems with Touch Pad on WiFi Model

author: Guru
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†I know people have ADD and don't like to read reviews so if I picture is worth a thousand worth words, I think a video should be worth millions? For those who have not seen my video (you will have a good chuckle), I love everything from the easy cleanup, the awesome app, outstanding support, and all the money it saves. Seriously! 10 wings at a restaurant are at least .50 maybe .25 if you are lucky. 4lb bag at Walmart was $10. BIG shout out to Cosori support they are amazing!Working in the IT\IS field I really appreciate the after-sales support & the contact software\firmware updates. Since I owned it there have been 3 firmware updates already. Don't worry the updates are announced in the app and usually take less than a minute.If you ever have a problem with your Amazon Echo not connecting make sure to open the Vsync app and then try saying "Alexa, cook chinken in..." I'm working with them to help improve the Echo integration! ;)Please smash the Thumbs Up if you like this video as it gives me encouragement to make more.If you have ever owned an air fryer in the past and it did not meet your expectations, support was lacking, etc. please please please purchase this Air Fryer & don't give up on robbing yourself of possibly re-igniting your passion for cooking. :-)
title: Re-ignited my love for cooking. The integration with Alexa is almost Perfect!

author: Joan M Laird
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021
review_content: It took me two years to break down and buy an air fryer.  I just figured it was another gadget I didn't need.  Then I started researching them and listen to people who own them rant and rave how great there are.  I found the Corsoi and it had good reviews and people seemed to really like them, so I ordered one.  First thing I made in it was french fries and I was sold.  I then tried many foods and now use it at least once a week if not more.  I loved mine so much I ordered one for my sister.  Corsori even has a facebook group where you can get tips and tricks and learn all sorts things.  I'm so glad I took the leap and got one.  My neighbor even checked out mine and has since purchased one for her family.  Love, love air frying with this Corsori.
title: A Must In the Kitchen

author: Sondra Vollmer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
review_content: The quick review:  I love this AF. I‚Äôm glad I trusted the 10,000 people who gave this Corsori 5.8 QT AF high reviews. I can‚Äôt imagine anyone regretting purchasing this item.Detailed review:  This is my first AF and I read a lot of reviews and watched quite a few videos giving AF reviews. I have a family of 5 and my youngest is a 6‚Äô tall teenage boy so I basically cook for 5 adults so AF cooking capacity was a factor.  Other factors I considered where ease of cleaning, ease of use, how much I thought I‚Äôd actually use an AF, and cost.I only have had this AF for 5 days as of 7/24/20.  I will update this post in a few weeks. I have used this AF every day since using it.**UPDATE 8/5/2020**:  I have used this air fryer every single day since I purchased it.  I am amazed at how easy it makes cooking chicken breasts, chicken tenders, and pork chops.  I especially like how the meat is fully cooked (I test using a meat thermometer) but still so tender and juicy.  On my list of foods to try are a whole chicken and steaks.  My teens use it to toast their sandwiches for lunch.  It's awesome at reheating leftovers (especially pizza!!!).  Oh, yes, it makes awesome fries and onion rings.  I am so happy I finally purchased an air fryer, and this Corsori is still easy to clean (even after I made pork chops with a lot of sauce the other night), easy to use, and has made cooking so much easier.  I continue to highly recommend the Corsori 5.8 QT Air Fryer.What I have made so far:*French fries (frozen) - yes, excellent!!  Easily handled entire bag and the fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, just how I like them.*Fried zucchini:  the traditional flour, egg wash, breading. Instead of frying in a skillet of oil I simply misted the slices with olive oil. They were wonderful. Next time, I will try to make a keto version of these.*chicken breakfast sausage links - also very good*frozen salmon patties that I purchase at Costco - very good!  What I like about this is that the salmon patties are usually my lunch. I practice 16:8 intermittent fasting. I don‚Äôt have the patience to do a lot of cooking for my first meal of the day and I want protein. This AF quickly cooks my salmon patty, it is delicious, and clean-up is a breeze!*Italian hot sausage sandwiches - oh my! ‚ù§Ô∏è  I purchased the accessories for this AF. I used the cake pan in the AF to cook the onions and peppers.  Then, I removed the veggies and cooked the sausages. My entire family and I loved how the AF cooked the sausages - crisp on the outside but juicy on the inside. Once the sausages were cooked, I made the sandwiches (sliced the sausage roll, put a sausage link in the roll, topped the sausage with the already cooked veggies. I put the sandwiches in the AF at 380¬∞ for 2 minutes.  Oh my!  I wish I had better words to describe just how good these sandwiches were!  Disclaimer:  I could have squeezed 3 sandwiches in at once but everything I‚Äôve read says airflow is important, so I only did 2 at a time.** update 8/5/20:  I have also made boneless chicken breasts, bone-in chicken pieces (breasts, wings, drumsticks), and pork chops.  Everything has turned out great!Size:  the square basket (vs a round basket) seems to make the cooking capacity of the 5.8 QT Corsori greater than similarly sized AF‚Äôs.  I considered an oven style AF but I didn‚Äôt want to lose that much counter space. I am quite happy with the size of this AF.Ease of cleaning:  Every time I use this AF and then clean it, I am AMAZED at how easy it is to clean!  üëçüëçEase of use:  As I stated earlier, this is my first air fryer. I find it very easy to use. It‚Äôs fairly self-explanatory with the preset buttons.How much I thought I‚Äôd use an AF:  This point was very important to me.  I have been the proud owner for 5 years, at least, of a bread machine that I‚Äôve only used less than 10 times. Please don‚Äôt judge me, I hear about it all the time from my family. I have used this AF everyday since I received it, some days twice. I see this AF becoming an essential tool in my kitchen.Cost:  I am a big believer in ‚Äúyou get what you pay for‚Äù.  That said, I have 2 kids in college and another one that will be headed to college in a few years, so I can‚Äôt unwisely throw money around. I don‚Äôt have any experience with any other air fryers, so I can‚Äôt comment on whether I think more expensive brands are worth the extra expense or not. What I can say is that I think I definitely got my money‚Äôs worth with the Corsori 5.8 QT air fryer.Final words:  if you are lost in the sea of various air fryer brands, in my opinion you will be very happy if you decide to purchase the Corsori 5.8 QT air fryer.I purchased the AF with my own money and I am not reimbursed in any way for this review. I seldom write reviews but I am so impressed with this AF and I want to help anyone who is as befuddled as I was when I was trying to chose which AF to purchase.Other recommendations:  I did purchase the accessories that are available from Corsori for this AF. I am glad I did, they make the AF even more versatile. I recommend having tongs that are safe for scratch resistant surfaces. Lastly, I did put an insulated counter protector under my AF. It doesn‚Äôt seem to get that hot under my AF but I have new counters, so I am using a protector just in case.
title: I love my Corsori 5.8 Qt air fryer

author: Barbara D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
review_content: I've had this since January and I've loved using it however now the drawer won't close on it and I'm not sure what the problem is. And I'm down to months past the return date.
title: Do your research

author: Owba
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
review_content: We purchased the Cosori Air Fryer (the one with the App, though we don't use the App very often so far) for Christmas, mostly because we had Amazon gift cards that we haven't used in several years. We have had no problems with the air fryer so far. The touchscreen is pretty easy to figure out (the User Guide helps as well, of course) and responds from especially light touches. Cleaning is surprisingly easy: we wait until it's cool (roughly 10 minutes) then put in the sink, fill with hot water and a squirt of Dawn, wait until we've finished eating, then wipe with a soft rag or sponge and rinse. Done.Now, about recipes. You can find a stunning amount of recipes on the web, even recipes specific to the Cosori; HOWEVER, our experience is that we have to test recipes until we get results we like. This is where we think air fryers really shine. You can always adjust the temperature and/or cook for a couple of minutes longer, so we check it every 5 minutes or so. For example, we tried English Muffin Pizzas and had to cook them twice as long as the recipe called for. Same for Parmesan Red Potatoes. Chicken Tenders took 2 minutes less than the recipe called for. So it's best to assume you will have to tinker with time/temperature rather than count on the recipe being perfect first time every time.We found Fabulessly Frugal (on YouTube) to be a pretty reliable source for Air Fryer info, especially since the host has a Cosori 5.8oz and she is very good about giving clear instructions ... and because we like her sense of humor. Worth a quick search.
title: Great Air Fryer + Appropriate Recipes = Good Food

author: Y
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021
review_content: The machine looks good and looks easy to clean.HOWEVER, the the machine makes very strong burning plastic smell in the first several runs we experienced. The smell makes the entire family headache and did not go away after tried 3 times.. the temp we run is not high.. we run 350F and 380F but all times the smell is very strong and penetrates the food.Certain reviews said that the smell will "go away" after several use but it should not be there at the very beginning because this is something processing things we put in our mouth at where we live.Not recommend.
title: Please be aware of the burning plastic smell

author: DJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
review_content: Excellent customer service, basket issue was covered under warranty.Update: After about a month one of the screws fell out into my food. It stayed tight after screwing it back I'm but glad I saw it first!  Then after about 2 months it had trouble knowing the basket was closed. If I press down on the handle it turns on but then the basket is tilted out of the dryer, as soon as I let go it turns off.Original 5 star: Does so much more than appetizers. Perfectly cooks chicken, pork, potatoes, anything that you could bake or deep fry. Fried chicken in the airfryer is way  better than kfc. Reduces prep and cook time with no oil splatter, and an easy to clean basket (dishwasher safe). Works well with Alexa and the app is handy if you leave the room. Very much recommend
title: Love it but be careful with the basket

author: Wil
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020
review_content: If I could give this piece of crap 0 stars I would. It worked ok for a while and then stopped. I came on here asking for help from the manufacturer and they kept asking stupid ridiculous questions like did you plug it in. Is there too much grease near the button. It electrocuted me. It was a piece of crap. Know that I will never, ever purchase another piece of crap Cosori junk ever again. I am so pissed off right now I need to stop  before I say something that I will regret. Don't waist your money on this crap. The manufacture won't stand behind their product. I ended up tossing this piece of junk in the garbage. And know that I will take every opportunity to trash your company and your junk products on here and social media and anywhere else I am able. Your products are junk and your company is junk! Perhaps I have gotten my point across. JUNK!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And to the manufacturer, don't contact me, ever, for anything. I don't want to discuss how much you suck. I don't want to be reimbursed. You had your opportunity to make things right and you blew it. Now I will give my money to one of your competitors.
title: DANGEROUS PIECE OF CRAP!!!!!

author: Camino
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2021
review_content: I purchased two of these air fryers as gifts. In a relatively short time the screws on the handle came off. I phoned the company May 26 to ask for replacement screws to beMailed to my daughter. They said everything must go through email so I proceeded to email them all the info and the photos. When I contacted them again on 6/7 and 6/8 they claimed not to be able to see the product info so no screws had been sent. I re-sent photos and finally today 6/16 I was emailed that the  two screws were on their way. I chose these particular fryers due to the great customer reviews, however customer service is important to me as a consumer. I did not ask for a replacement basket and when I phoned I asked for the type of screw so that daughter could go out and purchase it herself. I honestly feel that the screws should have been mailed without me having to pursue them. I have asked daily if the screws had arrived and honestly was in shock today to see they were just sent. The basket does stick a bit and this is probably why the handle loosened.  It is a good product but I wouldn‚Äôt purchase from this company again.UPDATEThe screws arrived yesterday, however they neglected to include the nuts on the back to hold them in place. I emailed the company to explain the error. I was just contacted 24 hours later to say an entire replacement basket will be shipped out ASAP.While it has taken a long time to get to this point I am happy they are resolving the issue.
title: Handle came loose (UPDATE)

author: Charlotte T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
review_content: Definitely don‚Äôt buy a smart air fryer if you don‚Äôt need it; this is an unnecessary purchase but if you‚Äôre willing to splurge 80 bucks for something that‚Äôll help you cook in the kitchen this is ideal.I‚Äôm not the best chef in the world, in fact, I think the worst part of cooking is how long it takes and having to sit in a hot kitchen for hours. This air fryer is so quick and easy and it notifies your phone so you don‚Äôt have to sit in the kitchen or wait on it not to burn. You can go about your day and it will let you know when your food is ready. And you‚Äôll really have to play around with the settings. The presets are really good guideline but you‚Äôll have to take it upon yourself to really cook certain dishes properly.Now the main setback I have is actually cleaning it. I don‚Äôt have a dishwasher so I have to hand wash it myself and if I cook with oil or anything that stains even when I use parchment paper and foil all of that gunk sticks to the slits in the side of the basket. I would let it soak in Ajax and dish soap and come back scrub it out and it would still be dried grease stuck in between the cracks. This thing is almost impossible to clean entirely after the first use without a dishwasher.Another con would be cooking fries in this is not ideal; Frankly like all air fryers all fries come out super dry and dehydrated. Since many air fryers do this I‚Äôm not faulting this brand specifically, however I couldn‚Äôt help but mention it.
title: Almost perfect...

author: Superwildcatfan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2020
review_content: Plugged in. Excited to cook. Waited a few minutes. Only displayed the wifi icon and power icon. Push/hold power icon does not change state of device. Put some food in the basket, insert for operate, and waited a few minutes. Provided the same result. Instructions did not indicate wifi and app are required for operation. Was interested in newest model. Fail.
title: Won't function without wifi access

author: Amy F
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2019
review_content: When I opened this air fryer, the non stick coating was already coming off. The latch for the basket felt cheap and was tricky to open and close. I was disappointed and did not get to use it before it was sent back due to poor quality. I liked the smaller dimensions of this fryer but the one they sent me was a dud.
title: Lower quality than I expected after seeing the reviews.

author: Judith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
review_content: Update #2 July 2020:  I STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED MY REFUND AS PROMISED BY COSORI.  At this point I would give zero stars if that were possible.Thank you to the Customer Support Team at Cosori for their help in diagnosing my touchpad issues.  Apparently I got a defective one, and they are issuing a refund so I can purchase another.  (I am beyond Amazon's 30 day return window.)This air fryer has a nice, large basket, so I rarely need to cook things in batches. I love the presets and wifi connection, which makes cooking easier.  I can monitor the cooking process on my smartphone.  However, I find that the "buttons" do not always respond to touch, especially when I want to increase or decrease the time/temp.  The touch pad just doesn't work!  Don't know if I am doing something wrong or if the devices is not working properly.
title: Update: #2

author: Scott Carle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
review_content: We had heard great things and read some good reviews and I decided to try an air fryer. After looking around it seemed that Cosori has a decent reputation for support and that their non-stick has a good rep for not de-laminating. Enter a good sale and I purchased one.I think we have had it a little over a month and it has been used anywhere from once to four times  a day. We cook a range of stuff from garlic bread to fried chicken,  vegetables, fish sticks, hot dogs, fish, beef, french fries etc. in it.I gave up eating fried chicken a few years ago. My digestive tract isn't as friendly to greasy foods as it once was. I grew up in the south and fried chicken was a staple at my grandmothers house and my mom made it a lot also. When I left home I made it though not as often as I get irritated cleaning the spattered grease up. Finally with the digestive change it left my menu but I really missed it. Now it is back on the menu. I cook chicken a couple times a week now at least and it is great.for better than my mom's or grandmothers breaded fried chicken I take oil of choice and rub a light layer onto a couple large chicken breasts, sprinkle with salt and pepper (or other seasoning of choice) and then sift a heavy layer of flour and pat it in. (I can no longer eat wheat so use rice or oat flour and it is absolutely wonderful.) Place the chicken in the air fryer and just use the stock setting for chicken. It is crispy on the outside and moist and tender on the inside. If you cut the chicken up into smaller portions you probably want to reduce the cooking time from 25 min to maybe 15 to 20.. you'll have to get a feel for it.French fries took a few tries get right.. fresh vs frozen are two different ways of cooking. Fresh use the recommended setting depending on how thick.. if thinner then reduce time a little maybe. frozen you need to reduce time by about a 1/3.Fish sticks such as gortons frozen I use the chicken setting but reduce it to about 20 minutes.. they are lightly crunchy on the outside and moist and tender inside. other brands with thinner fish sticks need reduced cooking time so that they dont dry out.sausage dogs I use the chicken setting with about 18 minutes to get a bit of blackening and cracking of the skin going. For just cooked but not till the skin breaks probably 13 min maybe.anyways it is up there with our rice cooker and electric pressure cooker for devices we use a lot.
title: It's going to be hard not to rave to much

author: Beth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020
review_content: As my first air fryer, I was very excited when I started learning the ‚Äúins‚Äù and ‚Äúouts‚Äù of this thing. I am a stay at home mom of three that babysits so it‚Äôs important to have food fast when littles are hungry. This was definitely the answer! BUT...After a year of use I realized how extremely difficult it was becoming to clean. I would scrub and scrub after each use and it would still hold this terrible greasy feeling. Everyone assured me it was normal and our food still tasted great, so I considered it only a minor set back.Then one day while cooking lunch, I had put fries in the basket. I set the fries setting and had already shook the basket. (The setting gives you a warning to ‚Äúshake‚Äù halfway through your desired time/temperature.)A few moments passed when I noticed the screen started malfunctioning. The back of the machine started smoking and I immediately unplugged the item from the wall as quickly as possible. After letting it cool down I opened the basket to inspect. Fries were still slightly cold inside, but it looked like a French fry had fallen out of the basket and was stuck between the inside of the machine and the basket. I‚Äôm assuming it was laying on just the right spot to fry the machine (and the fry! Because it was black!) Had I not been nearby, we may have just had a house fire! I counted my blessings and the machine went in the garbage! I upgraded to a Ninja Foodi and am so thankful their basket system is not made the same! While I miss my handle.. I use tongs to ‚Äúflip‚Äù and I feel it‚Äôs much safer.
title: Malfunctioned after only 1 year of use

author: dustin howard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
review_content: Stopped working on me after the 6th use. Won't power on and return window was up 1 week ago! Thanks amazon!
title: Stopped Working after 6th use! And return window up  week ago!

author: Trustme
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2021
review_content: This is the third air fryer we've owned.Positives*Much better than average non stick surfaces.*Basket is very well ventilated and air flow seems relatively high, leading to fast, even cooking.*Basket & handle are stout with very little flex.  Overall fit and finish are very good, if a little heavy.Negatives* Fry basket is noticeably shallower than models with similar capacity. That limits the size of whole chickens to about 4 to 4 1/2 lbs because of limited clearance below the heating element. Other's we have owned with same capacity could do 5/12 to 6lbs. Probably limits size of other roasts too. (The basket is wider than others at the expense of depth.) Not a deal breaker because there are only two of us. IMO it's revealing that the manufacturer doesn't mention cooking whole chickens anywhere, which is always included in other air fryer charts. They don't say not to do it, they just don't mention it at all.* Its pretty loud, probably due to high airflow.
title: V Good Performance overall but Fry Basket is too shallow for larger whole chickens

author: Laurie Luciani
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
review_content: This air fryer has a very large basket. I easily fit in 15 chicken wings, single layer. They are, by far, the best wings I've ever had! It does a great job with frozen french fries, too. With the frozen french fries, there is a fair amount of condensation that comes out the bottom of the air fryer. Not a big deal, but still added wiping up. Fortunately, the air fryer is super easy to clean. Nothing sticks to it! Spray and a little suds and you are done. The only complaint I have is that it still produces a "plastic" odor while being used. I am hoping that goes away over time. I am still getting used to using the air fryer and putting it into my weekly routine. I recommend this air fryer to all the skeptics out there.
title: Surprisingly Good!

author: Happy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
review_content: I absolutely love the fryer.  After having using it daily for almost one year, a screw on the basket felt off. It is not a regular screw so I wrote to the factory for a replacement screw, they never reply.  The fryer still working great but I have to hold the bottom of the basket every time I pull it out from the unit.
title: No aftermarket service at all!

author: JEREMY D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2021
review_content: Want to love this thing... the food it makes is fantastic... but build quality is lacking and this is my 2nd one, 3rd basket. I purchased the prior model number as soon as it came out about 2 years ago. Love the air fried food it makes.  Sadly the handle came loose on the original one. Contacted COSORI and they blew me off. not wanting to scrap it, I found some replacement screws and made it work. New model came out and so did a replacement basket. Opted to buy the new basket and same thing happened. Seems they would have fixed it with the new model...nope Bought the new one again as the others on the market dont seem to be any better and bam8 months later... the screws fall out and the handle comes loose. nearly spilling 400* food all over me. Should have left this review long ago... fool me once shame on you, fool me thrice, shame on me
title: Want to love this thing... the food it makes is fantastic... but build quality is ...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: The ‚Äútouch screen‚Äù has never worked properly so there is only the pre-set 350 degree for 15 minutes that works. It takes about 10-20 button presses for it to even turn the power on and then start the pre-programmed cycle. I have learned to make do and the food really is great when you time it just right. I could never actually get it to sync even though it is WiFi compatible... I should have returned it but we were moving just after we got it and it didn‚Äôt get unboxed until after the returnable timeframe... pretty frustrating for the amount of money spent on it...  :/ I gave it two stars because it really does make great toast and frozen fries, you just have to set an alarm to stop it .
title: Not as Impressive as I was hoping...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
review_content: This is my second air fryer, my first one I inherited from my parents who love to buy all the gadgets but almost never actually use them.I absolutely love it, but one thing drives me insane. The controls. Instead of having individual buttons which adjust temperature and time, you have to select the temperature and then use the same + or - to adjust it up or down, then you select time and use the same buttons. It would be much easier to have them separate. Also the power button could just as easily serve as the button to turn it on. I can't tell you how many times I have adjusted the time and temperature only to turn it off on accident. It takes a lot of brain power not to. It might be because it is my second and my first had better controls.That said, this one is a superior cooker, it is superior at cleaning. It is absolutely beautiful to look at. I love the square basket. The handle and attachment mechanism is much better designed.But I must say, if Cosori updated the controls, I'd buy a new one and pass this onto someone else. It's that annoying.
title: Great cooker, annoying control board

author: dLyonBW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: I read many reviews before buying this air fryer.It has served me over the last several months very well. It is easy enough to clean. Not extremely easy, but the design also makes it harder to damage when cleaning, so I am grateful for that.The recipes it comes with are ok. But, there are so many online recipes and frozen foods now have another option for cooking. Also, there are so many options once only microwaveable that taste better and don't take much longer in an air fryer.This is high quality and hasn't scratched or cracked in any way. Not yet, anyways.No, french fries are not as good as a real deep fryer. But, they are pretty good and are a little bit better than frozen fries from the store.Fish was my favorite use for the air fryer. Very easy to cook and fast. It had a professional taste to it.Do not think that by using it you are eating healthy. It still requires oil that otherwise could be avoided entirely. Yet, it is better than a deep fryer. For occasions, this isn't that bad. I recommend a spray bottle with oil for easier cooking with less oil used.
title: High quality air fryer

author: geeky1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review_content: I have had this long enough to use it almost ten times, always for frozen food. Despite running it empty a few times and these actual instances of cooking with it, there remains a very unpleasant plastic smell that really makes it unusable. The smell gets into the food and stinks up the house to the point where I feel the need to open windows and air out the house. I really wanted to like this air fryer but unless I can bake this smell off somehow I will not be able to use it anymore.
title: Terrible plastic smell even after several uses

author: Timothy Wallace
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
review_content: I have owned multiple Philips Air fryers, and have been using them for at least 3 years. With that background, I can say I really like the features of this unit. There is one design shortcoming - if you wish to open the drawer and reach into it to adjust the contents (e.g., turn over items on a breakfast sandwich, for example), the drawer will not stay seated in the appliance. So, in order to do this, you must physically remove it, and place it on a flat surface (the Philips drawer can be pulled out enough, in place, to do this). This is considerably less convenient than just "adjusting in place." Also, I am a little disappointed the manual setting in the app does not have a dual temperature setting. So, for instance, if I want to put something on for 4 minutes at a low temp to defrost it, then switch to a higher temp to cook, that capability appears to be missing from the app. I would expect this is something that could be easily added to the programming, so perhaps the mfr will make some improvements. Another inconvenient thing is, when the lock screen comes on (app), and you have to log back into the phone to get to the app, it does not always seem to be in the same state where it was left. It would be better if the operation of the app would suspend the lock screen. I am not 100% sure this can be done, but surely it can. But, this "messing around" with the phone significantly negates the convenience of using the phone to set the time and temp (also coupled with not having two or three cooking steps available at one setting). That being said, this isn't really meant to be a particularly negative review, because all of the other design elements appear to be above average. I gave it three stars because of these slight shortcomings, but I really think it is 3.5 stars, but I am not strong enough on it to round up, so I rounded down.
