title: Great Features and Price. Issue with the pull out drawer

author: Sean M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
review_content: Update: December 2020 - Cosari reached out to me because of this review and after an email exchange they refunded me what I paid for the unit as an Amazon gift card because it was under warranty. Actually they offered me the choice of a refund or to put me on the list to send me a replacement as soon as they had new stock. Excellent customer service. I then bought the exact same model again (found another one on Amazon) and my new one does not have the issues with the freezing buttons I wrote about in my previous review. So in short I am very happy and am enjoying using the air fryer both through the control panel and the app (and Alexa).------------ Original review ---------------This one was a replacement for one that was a little bit bigger and would not fit where I wanted to stored it and it cooks just as (very) well. I do enjoy playing with the wifi/app control but would be the first to admit that it is a bit of a toy.What is not good and the only reason I am giving it 2 stars instead of 5 is that the buttons are not easy to push and register input. There often seems to be a short lag where it seems like the device is frozen taking the button input. This is pretty annoying as I often have to push a button multiple times to get it to register, even more so when you are changing time/temp so need multiple pushes to register, so I generally prefer to use the phone app to kick it off and adjust it. It is possible that mine is just a hardware dud where the senors for the buttons are misaligned with the buttons display, but that does not explain the input freeze behavior I am experiencing. My girlfriend hates using it and wanted me to return it.
title: Updated: replaced unit functions perfectly.

author: Neil White
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
review_content: As others have reported, mine arrived with a non-functioning control panel.  Everything works fine through the app. This seems to be a recurring issue based on recent reviews.  My guess is they've had a bad batch of hardware as this is an otherwise highly rated product.  Awaiting a response from Cosori Support as I type.UPDATE: Support were very responsive and acknowledged the issue.  They are sending me a replacement from a new batch once they are available.  They also seem genuinely interested in tracing all the bad items and asked for a photo of the etched batch number on the bottom of the unit.Upgrading to 3 stars for now.  Once I get the replacement and verify it works I'll review my rating again.UPDATE: My replacement arrived very quickly and I'm happy to report this unit is fully functional.
title: Dead Control Panel

author: TheProgressiveRedneck
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019
review_content: I'm super happy with the easy operation and performance from the Corsori air fryer.I think the 5.8L capacity is ideal and would encourage anyone shopping for one to stay away from the smaller capacity air fryers.  I think you get more bang for your buck with the larger capacity.Overall, I'm quite happy with it and have been cooking with it 4-5 times per week - thus replacing my oven.It's a lot faster to cook with also!Word of advice for simu-frying with this air fryer:Purchase an oil spritzer / mister and liberally spray down your food before cooking in the air fryer.  Increase your cook time by an additional 1 minute using the cooker's presets.I think you would be very happy using an air fryer.  Definitely worth one's attention.
title: Air fryers are the way of the future

author: blackstone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2019
review_content: Works great once you figure out how long you want to cook your food for the way you like it. I figured out what temperature to pull it out the way I like it and then it was actually pretty great for potatoes and my wife is Asian and she loves fish and cooks all kinds different fish in it, and it's really good some nice moist salmon. I find stuff to cook it at this point just because it's fun to use and it's easy set the timing and walk away. Good chicken wings too. if you get my point now I really like it you can go on rambling just like I already have but in the end it's worth buying. Update..........I have been using almost daily for about 2 1/2 years now several times a day. Works great for everything. BBQ everything in this thing. All vegetables. Poke some holes in eggplant. Use your imagination.
title: Ease-of-use. I want another one.

author: Jana S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021
review_content: I bought this Air Fryer last year and I love it SO MUCH! I use it all the time and I recently bought another one for my daughter.It's a great size and easy to clean.HOWEVER...The larger screws on the basket do loosen a bit after some time, but it's any easy fix. The reason for docking stars for an otherwise 5 star item is that TEENY TINY SCREWS FALL OFF! These are super small screws that once was covered with plastic. The plastic broke which caused the screw to fall off into our food! Serious choking hazard! Fortunately it was french fries so we saw it. We tried putting it back, but without the plastic to hold it in place it won't stay.Major design flaw so be careful! Otherwise it's super awesome.
title: Awesome! BUT BEWARE.....

author: jason101010
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
review_content: Great air fryer.  One thing I disliked was the super loud menu beeps.  I scoured the internet and emailed the company to no avail.  However I did take matters into my own hands and fixed the loud beep.  This was very easy to do, however, be warned and do not do this if you feel at all uncomfortable with the steps.There is no built in way to lower or disable the beeps from pressing menu buttons.  Here's what I did.  You can pop the top off which is held on with plastic clips all around. Oh btw do this at your own risk, I'm only reporting what I did which most certainly was dangerous risky voided warranty etc. And for goodness sake people, unplug it and leave it be to cool down and stuff. Anywho, pop the top and locate the round black speaker on the circuit board. You can take a pair of needle nose pliers and pull off the black cover to the speaker. You can identify the speaker by seeing the board notated as BUZR next to it. The black cover piece to speaker has a hole in center of it. After pulling it off (gentle force) there is a circular flat disc, seen in pic, appears to be possibly magnetic. Simply pick it off and replace the black speaker cover. Boom no sound. Here's the downside, there is no sound at all for anything anymore.
title: Nice fryer but Beeps are loud

author: G. Kilbride
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
review_content: All reviews from the United States are now gone. Apparently the truth is not appreciated. Like so many other recent reviewers I purchased this item on Prime Day -- supposedly new -- yet received a sloppily packaged model that had obviously been returned by a prior customer. The tell tale signs were all over the place, including a dented and stained box plus erratic tape aimed in all directions and covering a prior rip. The warning label atop the machine had a small stain and was partially coming off at the right front.Very disappointing. I still got a good price but I basically received "Like New" disguised as New.It took me several days to decide whether or not to return the item. I decided to keep it, despite the poor initial impression. Contrary to one review I read before they were yanked, this air fryer can be used manually. I have no interest in the smart functions. Plugging it in and tapping on the front screen reveals the On button. From there the full display shows up. The manual is above average and makes it easy to figure out the manual operation. I have enjoyed the items I've made so far. I've discovered that preheating is not really necessary. Find the time and temperature estimate for your item and then if anything subtract a minute or so. I prefer online consensus regarding time/temperature for each item instead of using the supplied material.Overall I'm satisfied with the machine but this has to be a low rating due to disgraceful Prime Day shenanigans.
title: Prime Day means dump the returned items as new

author: Shells
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
review_content: I made salmon and green beans after receiving this yesterday and i was not comfortable with the smoke/steam I cant tell which coming from the basket area, the food was not greasy frozen salmon and fresh green beans.  I know the steam is supposed to come out the back and i have another air fryer that never has steam or smoke from the basket area and so i have experience with air fryers I just wanted the larger capacity.  I will try cooking again but now i am worried how much is will smoke if i actually use oil to coat food ie potatoes etc.  I immediately took out the basket and rechecked everything to make sure there was no overlooked packaging that perhaps was left inside.Update june 2021 the display stopped working and after sending video to the seller they replaced the fryer.
title: Replaced free great seller.  steam or smoke coming out of the bottom basket is scaring me a little.

author: Deborah B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
review_content: I decided to start with the fried chicken. My thought was, if it can't do well with this, I don't want it. Wow! It exceeded my expectations.  Amazingly, it looked like it might be a little dry because the outside didn't have the usual fried sheen. Not only was the skin crispy and tasty, inside was some of the juiciest fried chicken I've had in recent years. The air fryer was a little intimidating, especially when removing it during the cooking process to flip it over. It was super easy to clean which also surprised me. I'm really glad I bought it. Since then, I've tried the fries and they were wonderful as well.
title: My new favorite appliance

author: Kale
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019
review_content: I had the Airfryer XL for years and I told everyone I came in contact with that it was the best thing since microwaves and ovens, and that I would take it to my grave because I loved it so much, lol. Having said that, I have ceramic tile floors and I dropped it 20 or more times (anyone who has that type of floor knows it is rare for anything to survive such a fall, but the XL hanged on). Over time the XL became so banged up that I decided once I move I would re-purchase it. However, after moving, Amazon was having a sale and my pocketbook was tugging at me to make a change. "I could always return it if I hated it and buy the XL again," I said to myself. Well.......... I LOVE THE COSORI MORE!!!!!!! It has a square basket which fits items much better than the oval one, it's quieter, it's still a spaceship in size but it is very nice looking with the matte textured black plastic, it's truly awesome and is my addiction for life. I use it to warm up food, toast bread, make pizzas, cookies, fries, onion rings, etc., you name it. You can do almost anything with this gorgeous machine and it is super FAST (which saves you on electricity and cooking heat in your house). If you are questioning some brands, I strongly encourage you to just buy the Cosori because you will be happier sooner than later. Lastly, please be sure to take out ALL the cardboard after unpacking and before cooking anything. I washed the basket but I was so excited to try it I had blind eyes to the cardboard which was still "underneath" the basket area. Very careless of me. All is well, and I use my Cosori every day.
title: Better than my last air fryer

author: L. Bean
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021
review_content: We were really happy with the product & only until recently did we realize we should have been able to use it manually. The control panel never worked & we were only able to use the wifi app- which was great until we upgraded our wifi & couldn't reconnect it.We've been in contact with Cosori & hope to replace the product. We're pretty sure it's a short in the control panel that was always there.Why would we want another you ask?It cooked perfectly & was easy to clean. I have a Breville Smart Oven that I love but the air fryer option is so messy, it's not worth using. The other air fryers look too cumbersome.This product was big enough for a family of 4 & small enough to easily store.The wifi app is nice- especially with working from home. The recipes they give are also phenomenal.I can only imagine getting one that keeps working!!!
title: Never worked manually- then it just died

author: Johnazon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021
review_content: There are three small machine bolts, inside the basket, which screw into the handle to hold it on.  These bolts come completely loose and fall into the basket with your food. You could easily swallow one, or break a tooth.  The company did not permanently attach the bolts for some reason.  We bought this brand after a recommendation from someone and when we told them about ours, they said they had to throw theirs away for the same reason, and the loose bolts eventually made their handle snap.  It‚Äôs a very unsafe fryer to cook with.
title: Dangerous, Unsafe fryer should be recalled

author: J0salgado
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†My life is changed forever omg. Buy it. Its not even debatable.  I will never cook the same. Personally I dont like cooking all that much cause the mess you have to clean up and bc of how much time it takes but this baby eliminates both problems. 10 minutes you have PERFECT fries, salmon, I cant even express my gratitude for who ever created such magic. The cook book is BOMB, cant wait to become Martha Stewart. Cant wait to throw brussel sprouts in this baby. I‚Äôm literally buying my mom one and celebrating ‚Äúchristmas in july‚Äù bc shes an actual cook and this is gonna changer her life. If I could choose one machine out of all I the ones I have in the kitchen this is 1st without a DOUBT.Now. Regarding plastic smell - sure ~now~ I am noticing a slight smell that comes with the frying (I thought it was what I was cooking) but its so minor and irrelevant. The machine is magic and honestly I‚Äôm sure they all have more or less of a funk. Considering the reviews this one didnt have nearly as many as others. The number of reviews cant lie. Do yourself the favor - this is one of those items that goes on the ‚Äúbest life investments‚Äù next to pre TSA. so buy it. And as drake once said - YOU CAN THANK ME NOW.
title: HOLY GRAIL

author: Wei-ju Wu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2021
review_content: I got this air fryer on Prime Day, which makes this an even better deal. I have the unit for 3 days and I have used it a lot already. It is so fast and makes things so crispy which makes them more attractive for kids. I have picky kids who are hungry all the time, it's great to have an appliance which can make something they like within 10 minutes or less.So far I have done fries, sweet potato fries, chicken nuggets, breaded fish fillets and breaded chicken breast which I put in the sous vide first.Since I hate deep frying at home because of the smell and oil waste I am happy that I can now use only as much oil as necessary.About the user interface:I started out with the presets, but I think custom works better for me. I also have seen other reviews where the buttons have worn out. I just wanted to remark these buttons will react to relatively light touch, it is not necessary to push them very hard, but they respond a bit slow, which might lead people to believe they need to press harder.This is the first kitchen appliance with a Wifi feature I own and now I actually want each of my appliances to have this feature. It's nice to have not only a remote control but also a remote monitoring function over the progress of your cooking while you tend to other tasks in the household. I think this is a worthwhile purchase.
title: Almost an essential purchase for parents

author: Drew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021
review_content: I'll be honest. I don't like small kitchen appliances sitting on my counter, especially when they're often rarely used. I dislike clutter. Toaster, slow cookers, all get stowed in a cabinet. I'm also not into buying gimmicky items. So more or less, I was really hesitant to buy the next "new" small appliance and put it on my counter. I mean, after all, this is just a mini oven right?I did a lot of research. Way too much really. Brands, features, size, color, uses, reviews, videos. What to buy!? This is too complicated! Needless to say, I settled with the one I'm reviewing here. Why? I liked the size. If I'm going to give it a chance to be used for my family of 4, I wanted to be able to use it as often as possible. Not too big, not too small. Shape. I like the square tray. Easily fits more items than round and takes up the same counter space width. Color and texture. Brushed, flat finish hides things. It doesn't look like "cheap" plastic. The buttons are only visible when in use. Clean look. Features. Several presets, although I could honestly just do with a heat dial and a timer. Treat it like a microwave and wing it. Maybe a little hidden cheat sheet. Price was reasonable and it had great reviews.So we kept it on the counter for a few months now we made a spot for its permanent home. We use it several times weekly which surprised us. No, we aren't regularly making meals and suddenly becoming gourmet chefs, but when we want to warm up a few chicken strips or nuggets, mozzarella sticks, left over pizza slices, or basically anything we want to retain a crisp to that the microwave can't, it goes in the air fryer.Realistic expectations. Yes, there's a lot of hype around air fryers. The reality is, this isn't a miracle machine. Sorry, it's just not so don't expect it to be. It heats things up. Your other standard appliances, microwave and oven, can ultimately heat food in the same manner, just on a different scale and different speed. It's a small version of your oven...for the most part, with the speed of a microwave. It compliments the other 2 but you can live without it.What have I learned now having used an air fryer? Great for small quantities use the oven for bigger amounts or multiple items. Who wants a full basket of fries that have been cooling for 10 minutes while we wait for the chicken strips, when I could put it all on a cookie sheet and toss it in the oven? Not much of a time difference either. Also, don't cook steak in it. Can you? Yes, but you could also microwave a steak or have thrown one in the oven the last umpteen years. It's just hype and a steak will never be better than over a flame on a grill. Last one I'll mention, it doesn't heat through to the center fast. A microwave does better at getting the center. An inch or less thick is about all I'd suggest.Hope this helps!
title: Unsure if you even need an air fryer? Please read.

author: Natalie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021
review_content: Our air fryer has served a great purpose and constantly provides us with a delicious meal. I was eager to give this product a 5 star review but here‚Äôs why I won‚Äôt. The French fry button should work for majority of all frozen French fry options, however, this has given us burnt fries on more occasions than I care to admit. I typically use the frozen food button for french fries instead of the fry button due to this issue.Aside from that flaw, everything else has been a perfect meal! Cooked flawlessly and doesn‚Äôt leave a huge grease mess or pot of fry oil to clean up after later.
title: Convenient for a busy family, mostly cooks to perfection!!

author: J. Thunderbolt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
review_content: I bought this Air Fryer for my mom earlier this year and after hearing her rave, bought one for myself. The air fryer is awesome. It's a good size to cook a whole bag of frozen veggie tots or sweet potato fries and the food is just terrific. It's super easy to clean too.Unfortunately, mine stopped working after about 4 months. One night, mid cooking it just shut off and wouldn't turn back on. I contacted Cosari and that same day they notified me they're shipping me a new one. This is after the 90 day warrantee had expired and they raised no issues about it. My mom's is still going strong after 7 months of constant use, so I think I just had a bit of bad luck with the first one. That being said, based on the product and the outstanding customer service from Cosari, I would highly recommend this air fryer again!
title: Great Air Fryer; Superb Customer Support

author: Brian K.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2019
review_content: Product turned off withing 7 minutes of cooking. Occasially screen will flash and beep then turned off again. Power button does not even display like when first plugged in. Will be returning this unit.
title: Deffective

author: BethGB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
review_content: When my husband came home from the hospital after a heart attack and triple by-pass the first thing I purchased was this air fryer. It's great. At my urging he has become vegan. I've been vegan for 21 years but now I had to make it palatable for him. The air fryer does a great job on making tofu and seitan, crispy and recipe ready without using oil. French fries are are big hit.  I make "chicken cutlet" parm with plant based alternatives which he very much enjoys. Loved it so much I bought one for my daughter. My grandson decided to become a vegetarian but he couldn't tolerate tofu - until he tried the crispy air fried tofu. He loves it!The unit is easy to use, easy to clean, and does a great job. Highly recommend.
title: LOVE the Air Fryer

author: Trish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: Love this product! If you are thinking of buying an air fryer this is probably the best on the market. Here‚Äôs why you are going to love it...easy to use (not rocket science), lots of video supports on YouTube, easy clean up, lots of recipes to try, two year warranty if you register the product right away, the presets, shake reminder, large basket, 85% more heat distribution which means a faster cooking time, you can pull out the bin to check foot without having to reset the temp/time, impressive basket design that makes air flow productive, online AF community presence, smart technology (which provides a real time cooking display and tons of recipes and the ability to creat your own-‚ù§Ô∏è this!), and great accessories to purchase. It is fun to use. It has easily become favorite go to gadget!We cooked chicken, cookies, kabobs, and so much more! This was so easy.The product exterior is not hot to the touch, only the back where the hot air comes out.We have tried several air fryers and this was the best.
title: ‚ù§Ô∏è Favorite Go-To-Gadget! ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: EDWIN LOPEZ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019
review_content: BUY THE COSORY AIR FRYER XL 5.8 QTSEPTEMBER 6, 2021MY COSORY AIR FRYER (2ND) FROM NOVEMBER 2019 THRU AUGUST 2021 ONLY LASTED ONE YEAR AND NINE MONTHS. THE AIR FRYER MOTOR IS VERY GOOD BUT THE QUALITY OF THE PRODUCT IS VERY BAD.I WANT TO FIX MY REVIEW {TO BE FAIR} IN THE REVIEW OF THE COSORI 5.8 QT. I LOVED THIS AIR FRYER WHY? 1. PERFECT SIZE {SQUARE} 2. BEAUTIFUL STYLE 3. WONDERFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE, QUICKLY THEY SENT ME A SECOND AIR FRYER. SO WHAT WAS THE PROBLEM? 1. THE FIRST COSORI LASTED FOR AROUND 6 MONTHS AND THE SECOND ABOUT A YEAR AND A HALF. SO WHAT IS THE PROBLEM? THAT THE SCREWS WERE LOOSENING, THE DRAWER HANDLE LOOSEN, IT WAS ANNOYING, VERY ANNOYING TO HAVE TO BE SCREWING EVERYTHING AT EVERY TIME UNTIL THE DRAWER COMPLETELY COME OFF, CONCLUSION COSORY AIR FRYER IS BEAUTIFULL, BUT CHEAP MADE. SORRY FOR THIS COMMENT.
title: COSORY AIR FRYER XL 5.8 Q

author: PM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
review_content: I bought the version with wifi that lets you connect to it with an app. You can connect it to Google Home for absolutely no benefit if you wish. The app will let you know when it's done pre-heating, cooking, or when it's time to shake. Apparently, you do have to actually touch the start button to run it though. The app will also show you a bunch of recipes, which haven't proven themselves very reliable so far. Googling helped quite a bit and also, similar to real world cooking, time and temp recommendations definitely don't fit all scenarios. I found that for some things I want crispy, it was best to run at a lower temp initially to help dry the surfaces, then run it at the higher temp. You might need to run some items longer than suggested if the basket is a bit full or they are thicker cut than the recipe.The pan is easy to clean. Exterior wipes down easily enough too.It seems pretty functional.The main thing I disliked, is the control panel. It uses touch controls that are easy to clean, but often misread my presses. I have found zero use for all the pre-programmed buttons. I saw an Insignia brand fryer at Best Buy that appeared very similar, but only had knobs / dials on the front. One for temperature and the other for time. Super simple. It looked like the perfect control panel that I wish my air fryer had.
title: It works, but I'm not fond of the control panel.

author: Sarah Lima
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2019
review_content: So this airfryer is good quality in my opinion. It makes great french fries from scratch and makes crispy tater tots no oil needed. Also I made hamburger patties on the steak setting and pork chops. The pork chops came out pretty crispy but I did notice that putting just one allows the meat to crisp up more than having two peices. I would say this works better for individual meals than for large quatities when it comes to meat. I feel that this fryer gets a bad rep because the cooking times in the cookbook are wrong but the temperature at which they should cook at are right. A lot of the times when I let the food fry for the time said in the cookbook it would burn. My recommendation would be to cook the food for less time than precribed and then if it needs more time simply add more time. That is how I started to get better results whith the airfryer because it acctually does a good job. Its just the cookbook thats off. The machine is pretty easy to use and manual explains everthing clearly.  Clean up is easy just make sure to use hot water, the manual said cold water could damage the fryer.
title: Cooking time may vary

author: JM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2019
review_content: I've been wanting an air fryer for awhile. Mostly to make crispy pork belly in half the time without heating my entire kitchen up from the oven. My brother got the Cosori a few months before me, so I figured I'd get the same so that we could try things out and make sure our temps were consistent since air fryers vary. I love this air fryer. The buttons are easy to use. I like the pre-sets. I like the shake reminders. I like the overall size as well as the size of the basket. I've made cornish hens, a whole chicken, spareribs, french fries, kabobs and yes... I've made the crispy pork belly! Customer service is great and they've got a group on Facebook with more recipes and lots of sharing from other Cosori owners.
title: Love it!

author: CCTKnight84
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
review_content: It is pretty obvious that some of the reviews here are by bots or competitors (or even perhaps paid for by the manufacturer?) I'm just an old guy who isn't much of a cook. First the bad - about 8 months of ownership, and the switch that activates when the draw is pushed in failed. The good -  Cosori replaced it quickly, very good customer service. More good - it works well, it is easy to clean, and in spite of what some other reviewer may have noted, it makes great french fries from raw potatoes (cut them, soak in water for 20 minutes, dry, spritz with oil, 13 minutes at 400, flip, 8 minutes at 400.) We also use it to bake potatoes, fried fish (also for frozen fish and fish sticks), breaded pork, chicken and more. Now, I've only had the replacement for the failed unit for 7 months, so we'll see if the bad switch was a one time thing. But overall, I have been very satisfied with this item.
title: First one failed, but overall very pleased

author: LostinSouthBama
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021
review_content: Because of the complete failure of customer support I will NEVER PURCHASE ANOTHER COSORI PRODUCT.  Air fryer CS358-AF (5.8 Qt w/WiFi) purchased from Amazon.  WiFi can only be accessed using the VeSync app.  I‚Äôm the IT person in my home and very familiar with WiFi procedures and connections. After 15-20 connection tries (through the app) and three fruitless calls to Cosori I was referred to the software company (email only). They responded that I should send them a video of the their app during the entire connection process.  That was the extent of Manufacturer and Software support.  Amazon was very gracious in settling the issue.  Unit cooks ok and is easy to clean, just don‚Äôt expect any WiFi.
title: WiFi doesn‚Äôt work and don‚Äôt expect help from Cosori

author: James F Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
review_content: I purchased this unit after internet research on reviews of the best units. This one is rated by many sites as the best of the best. Now that I've had mine for a few weeks, and have used it daily, I am very pleased with my purchase. Most of today's kitchen appliances have presets that are actually quite hard to figure out. But not on this unit. The preset choices are extremely easy to use. The temp/time menu is so simple that even this old man can do it without getting confused. The basket is square, which gives it a bigger capacity for more food than a round one. It has a higher power rating than many others, so it cooks fast and thoroughly. To clean it, all I do is put the basket in the dishwasher. That's it. Nothing else. I have a cabin where I spend half my days. So after I bought my first one for the house and used it for a week, I knew I needed one at the cabin too. So I bought a second, identical one. That way I can cook in it pretty much every single day. This is the best kitchen gadget I've purchased in years.
title: I liked it so much I bought a second one for the cabin

author: Larry Clark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2020
review_content: This is NOT a review of the air fryer.It IS a review of the customer service that I received.I purchased the unit (via Amazon) in January 2020. I used it often for a variety of items and found it very useful as a single dad of a teen ager.After a few months I noticed that the touch buttons were no longer as responsive as they had been when the unit 1st arrived. At first I thought it was because my finger was wet or dirty. But eventually one of the primary buttons stopped responding to my touch no matter how soft or hard I touched it. It was the button that changes the display from degrees to time and so I couldn't set the unit to preheat. (I could set it for cooking via Alexa.)So, I contacted COSORI. I tried to call them but the west coast was on fire and they had limited personnel to answer the phones. I emailed them and had a response within less than a day. They asked for some details concerning what unit I had and when I had purchased it and from whom. Within 3 days of sending them the info I received an email that they had sent me a new unit. I received the unit today.And now excuse me while I go and make some yogurt bagels in my new COSORI air fryer.And thus - - - the 5 stars for customer service!
title: 5 stars for customer service

author: Drew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2021
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†I have not cooked with it yet as every animal in a square mile radius started shrieking as soon as I turned it on! K. So will update after actually cooking with. Order the #1 air fryer on Amazon. ‚úÖ Scrub the kitchen counters down ‚úÖ Wire a new outlet ‚úÖ Plug in air fryer and proceed to go deaf ‚úÖ Who in their right mind would make a product with a beeper louder than a cruise ship??? ü§¨ So‚Ä¶10 minutes later I tear into a brand new appliance, locate the ungodly loud beeper and pry it off the board. Reassemble‚Ä¶plug in‚Ä¶oh the beautiful sound of silence! ‚úÖ
title: Unacceptable beep sound levels(will adjust rating after using)

author: Sam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
review_content: I've used this Air Fryer the past week, and right from the start it had issues. The Time/Temp touch button doesn't seem to work well. Have to press it like 8 times, and you use it alot to set the cooking temp and time. Also, there is a strong plastic smell after the first cooking. A week later and the unit continues to produce a burned plastic smell that stays in the house for hours. As far as cooking, we done a variety of food, including steak, and I've noticed that most foods don't get done well inside and isn't nice and hot, even though it's done on the outside. I don't have this issue when using the oven range or outside grill. For the price, I would expect better cooking results, the touch pad to work for all buttons, and not a burning plastic smell. What's interesting is that other reviews have said the same issues with the touch pad and plastic smell. So I'm returning this and may look to try another brand.
title: Touch buttons have issues, and bad plastic smell.

author: Kirby 21
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: Last May we bought the Cosori and this month, 11 months later we had an issue with the control buttons not always working correctly when my wife was cooking.  It had to be hit several times for it to connect or actually worked.  I called Customer service and they requested a short video of what it was doing and then confirmation of the past order, which we did.  The next day I received an email saying that they would send a new one, which they did and it arrived today.  We use the air fryer a lot and really like it.  It is perfect for us.  Customer service does not get much better than that.
title: GREAT!  Customer Service and the rest is great also.

author: A. Li
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
review_content: I got this fryer against my wife's wishes (she wanted to wait for a sales event), so I really really wanted to like this machine (else I'm in for a continual litany of "I told you so").  The fryer was working fine for the first few days; it was easy to use with plenty of button options, the recipe book was helpful, it was a quiet machine, big enough to cook up pork chops, fries, vegetables, etc.  Unfortunately, on the 4th day, while trying to make fries again, it died.  Power was not getting to the machine.  I swapped it around to different outlets in and out of the kitchen, hoping that it was actually my home electrical system (that's how much I wanted this machine to work).  Alas, it was not my electrical system, it was the fryer.  I tried it again the next day, the same issue, it worked for a few minutes, then died.  So, I had to wrap it back up into the box and return it.  Worst yet, I'm now listening to "I told you so" from my wife - and we are not allowed to get another fryer until she sees the sale she wants.
title: It stopped working after 4 days

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019
review_content: This unit continuously overheats and turns off after barely a few minutes in. Takes 6-10 minutes to restart.
title: Disappointing. Had to return.

author: Monty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2021
review_content: My Cosori Wi-Fi air fryer has immediately become an indispensable kitchen appliance.  We prepare meals a minimum of 3 times a week.  With a tiny amount of olive oil we are able to prepare an entr√©e or side with an average of 8 minutes.  Then we rinse and place the basket in our dishwasher for quick clean-up.  We purchased the air fryer over 3 months ago, have used it at least 40-60 times and the basket's Teflon coating remains intact with no evidence of wear or defect.  We use silicon utensils to remove food so not the scratch the basket's interior surface.  This particular Cosori air fryer has a large capacity 5.8 quarts and the outstanding Wi-Fi smartphone and Alexia interface with Cosori's smartphone software application.  This application contains a large number of recipes and permits the user the capability of inputting their own air fryer recipes.  My smartphone and Alexia bring outstanding smart technology to manage my cooking times and technique with perfection.  Without hesitation I say my family are EXTREMELY satisfied with our Cosori Wi-Fi 5.8 quart air fryer!  Imagine during the last 3 months, 40-60 uses, we have used less than a half cup of olive oil for cooking!  That's VERY heart healthy!  An outstanding choice for a top rated air fryer.  Yes choose Cosori!!!  We are a satisfied Cosori consumer!!!
title: Cosori Air Fryer 5.8 qt Wi-Fi Is Efficient, Heart Healthy, Food Preparation Perfection!

author: Kara mia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: I was very skeptical about purchasing one of these (air fryers) but after a visit to my niece's house, seeing how quick and easy it was to cook frozen chicken strips in less time than it takes my oven to pre-heat, I decided to give it a go.  After it arrived and I initially washed it/found a place for it in the kitchen, I went to the store and purchased a variety of frozen foods to put it through its paces. I made french fries first and they turned out great, very crispy just as I like them.  Next was jalapeno poppers, chicken strips, and frozen battered fish.  I just finished making some breaded mushrooms and turkey burgers in it this evening and everything has turned out either as expected or has surpassed my expectations.It's easy enough for just about anyone to use and clean up is a breeze.  I'm only giving it four stars at this time because I have yet to try out some of the other cooking features but will be happy to up it to five stars if I continue to be as please with it as I have been so far.  I also really like the look of it; it's not a shiny black, it is more of a matte black which makes it match better with my other appliances.  I also like that it's more square than round, fits better on my counter.  It is rather large so if you don't have the counter space you might wish to order a smaller version.  So far it's been one of the best things I've purchased for my kitchen in a long time.
title: Better than expected.

author: KH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021
review_content: So why the low rating when I absolutely love my Corsori air fryer? A few months ago, I bought a smaller (3.7) RED air fryer which came with a skewer rack. I paid $10 extra for the RED. I loved my air fryer so much, I brought the red one to a little vacay home I have in PA and bought the bigger 5.8 for home use in BLACK on prime day. It was a great deal, but alas, it was missing the skewer rack. I called company support only to find out that BLACK Corsori AFs do NOT come with the rack which I use often.  Only the WHITE and RED come with it- they do that because the red and white are not as popular as the BLACK so it is incentive to buy red or white. Heads up to Corsori- people buy what goes with the kitchen decor- not because of the skewer rack. Perhaps if they didn't charge MORE for colors other than black, you might sell more AF with color????? Then I was told, if I wanted the rack, I could buy a kit- a minimum of $18-$20 MORE with items I do not want. This just seems like a deceitful business practice. Why not charge less for color and put racks in all of them?
title: If you want the skewer rack- don't buy BLACK!

author: Ski Vieira
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2020
review_content: I got this air fryer, COSORI Air Fryer,Max XL 5.8 Quart, and used it to fry chicken drumsticks and root vegetables. I had to fry the drumsticks in 3 batches because of the quantity. There were 15 drumsticks, so I thought that this would be  a great way to quickly fry and save time without having to deep fry. As the unit cooked there was a smell of plastic but the top of the unit is plastic. I figured that the smell was coming from the top plastic - heat rises! However, the frying basket is metal and coated with a nonstick application. I did not think or believe that the smell was coming from the basket as well. Well, all the food cooked in this air fryer tasted like plastic! I had to throw it all away. Even my 16 year old grandson who will eat pretty much anything, wouldn‚Äôt eat it after tasting it. So, 3 batches of chicken drumsticks and 1 batch of root veggies was wasted. That‚Äôs 4 uses of the COSORI Air Fryer Max XL! Save your money and time and invest in a deep fryer or oven fry to save on fat consumption. I live in Arizona, so running the oven is rough in 100+ temperatures.
title: If you LOVE the taste of cooked plastic, this is the perfect air fryer!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
review_content: This is NOT a paid review...I swore I'd never buy a air fryer or insta-pot or any other "fad" device, but when my convection oven died I found that this cooker was less expensive than the replacement so I gave it a shot. Within 2 weeks I was so in love with this device I actually gifted it to my parents and they love it as much as I do.I use it daily for salmon or chicken as my daily protein, and carrots or brussels sprouts or other options for my veggies. I also cook my work-week lunches and they turn out amazing as well. For items I'm not eating immediately i go for skinless versions as the skins soften after fridge time. But for eating on-demand items it's perfect for amazingly crispy chicken thighs or legs or wings better than a deep fat fryer. For my salmon it's a quick 6 minutes and done PERFECTLY! and when it's done I slip off the skin and return the skin to the cooker for a few minutes and it's a crispy heavenly treat that even the pickiest of my kids' friends love and can't get enough of (if you've never had crispy salmon skin you've never lived!).I'm still working on perfecting some of the recipes but for the most part once you get used to the cooking times and heats, you'll be so amazingly in love with this cooker.Fried shrimp, pork chops, chicken wings/thighs/legs, crab cakes, it doesn't stop!You'll love this cooker. I HIGHLY recommend getting a good digital probe thermometer so you can quickly pull meats from the cooker and test them out for proper temps - it makes sure you reach the proper temps while also not overcooking the meats and ensuring tenderness!I'm a grill purist over the past years and have cooked food professionally for a decade or so, and I completely will admit to using this device for most if not all cooking needs. I have yet to find something that I CAN'T cook with this, but maybe some things that I just prefer to cook otherwise.My only downfall for this is that it does take a few minutes to clean. It's dishwasher safe and it comes clean there, but I use it daily and it does take about 5 minutes to clean since i don't run my dishwasher daily. But it does take an effort to get clean daily -- though less than the plates and dishes themselves just to eat the food.You will NOT regret this purchase.  BUY IT.
title: BEST cooker ever, use it every day

author: Mrs. B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
review_content: This is a beautiful machine, The packaging is top notch, and it looks like it‚Äôs good quality. When I first got it, I fried fresh cut potato‚Äôs and they turned out wonderfully, Ybe second time I used it, and I now recall reading this in some of the reviews, it‚Äôs not working as well, and the buttons do not always work. I haven‚Äôt had this a month yet, and I‚Äôve only used it twice, and it‚Äôs already showing signs that it‚Äôs going to conk out soon. Very disappointed because it has an app, delayed start, WiFi, and tons of other features, but sadly I think I will have to return this one.
title: This will not last long.

author: Robert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
review_content: When I purchased the Corsori, I also bought the wavelu silicone pot, 5 stars to both, received fryer 2 days ago, have since made chicken breasts and cheeseburgers everything came out great. No matter what, Corsori and other customers say, including entertaining and  informative Fabulessly Frugal, Kathy, it"s very difficult and time consuming to clean properly, all those slanted vents. I put metal rack in  Wavelu, when I put burgers in preheated fryer they sizzled and left grill marks, you lose a little space in basket, but when food is done baskets are spotless. You won"t regret  buying this Cosori air fryer or silcone pot. Oh, also comes with very nice glossy recipe book. I purchased with 20.00 amazon coupon.
title: No need to ever clean baskets, Read

author: MonteL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: First use was to cook french fries.  Instructions followed precisely.  Some fries were overdone while others were under done.  Second use was to cook grated potatoes for use as a bed for pulled pork.  Followed an air fryer recipe.  Noted that the potatoes were becoming very brown and crisp on the outside but not cooking on the center.  Tried to stir them and continued.  Checked again before time was up ‚Äì they were over done (very brown and dry).  Placed on warm cycle while pork and corn were heated (4 minutes).  Potatoes continued to cook and were just shy of being charcoal.  Third try was broccoli.  It also turned out overdone and somewhat charred.  Last attempt was an egg test.  Cooked egg in a silicon muffin cup.  Egg was overdone and uncooked, possibly according to the burner pattern.  This is unacceptable.  Returned the unit.
title: Appears too hot

author: Sarah Klein
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
review_content: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I researched all the air fryers on the market and Cosori consistently came up as the highest rated. Our Cosori arrived last week and when we started it up, none of the buttons on the ‚Äútouchscreen‚Äù worked when we touched them. Nothing. The only way we could work the device was through the app.  Figured it was defective and returned it to Amazon and received my replacement on Thursday. Just fired it up again and the same problem occurred. None of the buttons on the touchscreen work. We can‚Äôt turn it on, preheat, change the temperature EXCEPT when using the app.  This can‚Äôt be correct. How can this product advertise its easy to use  touchscreen when it doesn‚Äôt work?  It‚Äôs nice to be able to operate remotely, but I‚Äôd prefer to have a fully operational product. Not sure if Amazon has a bad batch of these, but we‚Äôll buy a Ninja or Phillips instead next time.
title: Product Defective‚ÄîTwice

author: Reynolds Family
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
review_content: We've had a Cosori for over a year. We did a warranty replacement on the basket six months into owning it.  The basket has broken several times over. The nonstick coating peels and flakes. Today screws popped out of the handle. The handle for the basket is suppose to let you pop the basket out to shake food but we haven't been able to do that because it's so flimsy.  The touch pad works when it wants. The system beeps when it feels like it. Won't turn on lately. It's been a very problematic piece of kitchen equipment. We really love air fryers and use one every single day. We have very active kids who love frozen quick foods and the air fryer is used more than our oven. So. Maybe it's just not up to par for daily use? We're replacing it with another brand this week. I'm disappointed this hasn't last. I have a Hamilton Beach blender thats lasted me seven years with multiple uses per day. It's definitely a poor quality brand issue.
title: Quality issues

author: E.S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021
review_content: My first meal was two frozen veggie burger patties, and about two cups of frozen broccoli and frozen brussels sprouts.I'd rate the fryer "promising but not mind blowing". Keep in mind the meal choice, at best, is a 6 out of 10 no matter how you cook it.The fryer made the outside of the frozen veggies sorta charred and crisp, but moist in the center (frozen sprouts are always mushy in the middle so they sucked as usual). I didn't use any oil, but lightly coating them I think would improve the results.Veggie patties are essentially hockey pucks regardless of cooking method. Fryer did nothing to improve them nor make them worse.The fryer connects to Alexa, but I can't think of a scenario where I'd have to remotely tell it to cook or stop cooking.With better ingredients, I think it could be pretty decent, though I think figuring out cooking times will be key. Gonna go grocery shopping and maybe try some of the recipes it comes with.Recipes are accessible via the app, then after you prep the food, you control the fryer through the app to cook the recipe to the recommended settings. Kinda cool.Lastly I got the 5.8Q size which I think is the largest from Cosori in the "cooking bucket" format. Personally think is fine for cooking for one person, maybe 2 depending on what you're making.
title: I like it. But it's not life changing.

author: M. Chambers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2018
review_content: After much comparison shopping, I settled on this large capacity air fryer with a square basket and it has been a great purchase. While it is not the cheapest unit on the market, it seems to be reliable, solidly made, easy to use,  and have the right mix of features, in my humble opinion.Calling this an "air fryer" is a bit of a misnomer: it is really more like a handy-sized countertop convection oven. While it can "air fry" foods that you might normally deep fry or pan fry, it also does a great job of toasting, roasting, or baking. Since we got it, my entire family has been busily using it to cook almost anything and everything. It is easy to clean and easy to operate. The controls are simple and straightforward with all the things you need (digital time and temperature, a good number of presets, etc.) and none of the things you don't (Personally, I think features like a touch screen are overkill for this sort of appliance - a touch screen would be just another thing that might break down prematurely....).The only downside I have detected is that most air fryer accessories on the market (e.g. racks, grill plates, liners, etc.) are either round-shaped or sized for a smaller capacity unit. It seems hard to find decent accessories that accurately fit and take advantage of a larger square-basketed air fryer like this one. My recommendation would be that Cosori come up with an accessory bundle (racks, silicone cooking pads, liners, grilling plates and mesh plates, etc.) specifically designed for this excellent appliance.
title: Excellent Air Fryer with Large Capacity / Square Basket

author: victoria s.yunker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†I received this wonderful Airfryer about a week ago , and really gave it a good testing. So Far it‚Äôs all great. Maybe the inner Basket is a bit smaller then expected . Also take the pre set cooking times with a grain of salt, because of course , for example sizes of steaks, or even fries vary .it‚Äôs running super Quiet and cleaning the light weight Basket is a Breeze with a few drops of Dawn. I didn‚Äôt try to clean it in Dishwasher yet.. why, because it‚Äôs so easy just to hand wash.I tried also multiple vegetables and they all worked out perfectly. I would say so far absolutely the perfect Airfryer!
title: Absolutely wonderful!

author: Buffy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_content: Left overs like pizza and fries actually  taste better a day or two old once warmed up in the air fryer. Chicken thighs are more crispy in 20 minutes vs an hour in the oven. Less time and taste better, so moist. Utilize you tube videos...so helpful!Baked potatoes so yummy, asparagus awesome in like 5 minutes. My husband LOVES crispy chicken wings in the air fryer...best he has ever tasted :) Easy clean up. So many wonderful videos on youtube...for how long to cook and at what temperature. Would highly recommend the Cosori Air Fryer 5.8 qt.  We had our first one for a couple of weeks and noticed a vibration. We sent it back at no charge and ordered another one that is working perfectly. Would make a terrific gift!!
title: We love our air fryer!

author: Alyssa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
review_content: ...and it's pretty incredible. 5 minutes or less to pre-heat versus my oven that takes 30 minutes? Talk about pizza rolls WHEN NEEDED. I have a large range of foods I've tried that are better in the oven, some are better in the microwave, and now some foods are better in the air fryer. Leftovers are a freaking breeze. Just go to the freezer aisle, pick out some random quick meals (like egg rolls, corn dogs, something easy a 13 year old boy would eat) and I promise the air fryer will not let you down. Stick to the oven for meats - the air fryer does seem to dry out more than I'd like.Probably my only complaint about this is the basket itself - the main basket has the handle so even though I'm comfortable sticking the metal extras in the dishwasher, the main basket gets pretty gross. It's hard to clean in my opinion because of all the ridges - sponges will be ripped apart. I would definitely recommend purchasing separate dishwasher-safe accessories if you're super lazy like me and hate handwashing.
title: This is my first air fryer...

author: Chanel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021
review_content: I‚Äôm officially obsessed with this air fryer. I don‚Äôt know who came up with or how they came up with this technology but I am soo grateful.. Not only do my foods taste the same as stovetop frying, but to know I‚Äôm saving a significant amount of fat and calories - it‚Äôs almost unbelievable to me. This was a gift and it‚Äôs hands down the best gift I‚Äôve gotten. Better yet, it‚Äôs one of the best products I‚Äôve ever had in my possession period and I don‚Äôt take lightly to saying that because I‚Äôm very picky/particular about everything.Unless it‚Äôs a mechanical error which happens with any gadget (that‚Äôs why warranties exist), if your food isn‚Äôt coming out right, it‚Äôs probably almost always due to user error. You have to actually know how to use it and also how to cook because if you don‚Äôt, I‚Äôm sorry but your food will suck regardless.. With that being said, of course it takes some trial and error.Anyway, as far as convenience, health and easier clean-ups goes, the decision to me is very simple. I would recommend this to any and everyone, truly.
title: Obsessed

author: Bev G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
review_content: We have two of these. One no longer works after just a few months, and one works but rarely gets used. My biggest complaint is that Cosori appears to no longer be honoring their warranties. Before purchasing, we did extensive research in which AF to purchase, and settled on the 5.8 Cosori based on great reviews and the large, square basket. Just three months after we purchased, and after only once weekly usage on average; the handle screws became loose to the degree that they had to be tightened after every use. Then the drawer started popping open during cooking. Then the non-stick coating on the basket started flaking off, even though the basket had never been cleaned in the dishwasher (though it says dishwasher safe) and the care instructions have been strictly followed. There are many Facebook groups for Cosori AF owners, which is where I learned that the drawer and handle problems seem to be a fatal flaw, and also that others were having increasing difficulty getting Cosori to honor the warranty. Currently, Cosori is offering customers a partial monetary refund for bad baskets such as ours; however, if you cannot get a replacement basket then having money refunded doesn‚Äôt do much good unless it‚Äôs for the entire cost of replacing the unit. Cosori used to ship unit replacements to consumers directly, from the sounds of it, but that kind of service appears to be a thing of the past. The fryer itself is decent; it does what it says it will, with the appeal for our family of three primarily being that the basket typically fits servings for 3-4 people. If we can‚Äôt locate a replacement basket soon, we will definitely not purchase another Cosori brand item again, but we do enjoy an air fryer and in general are now hooked on this appliance craze.
title: Beware if your unit breaks; and it‚Äôs likely it will!

author: Tatiana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: The reason I am only given this one star is because I wanted to alert everybody if they are buying this for a Christmas gift. Or if you are buying any other gift from Amazon  early due to the pandemic thing twice. You only have 30 days to return it to Amazon. Otherwise you have to deal with the manufacturer. I just went through this with another product and now I am screwed. I now have a product that doesn‚Äôt work and I‚Äôm stuck with it. I bought this air fryer plus one of those hydroponic gardens which were going to be for gifts because of the early sale. However, unless you plan on opening them and using them out and trying them before Christmas and gift giving them, the person you were giving them to will be stuck with dealing with the manufacturer of the product and good luck with that. Word of warning do not buy anything 30 days longer than you intend to give it. The gifts I bought just now became mine.
title: Do not buy Christmas gifts more than 30 days early on Amazon.

author: Big Angie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
review_content: I previously purchased one of these when they first came out; unfortunately, it was just a little too complicated for my liking. So, I gave it to my friend, and she loved it. Years passed, and then my aunt told me about this wonderful new thing she had purchased and didn't have to stand over a stove. Of course, when she told me what it was, I couldn't believe it. So, I started to research in order to find one that was just right for me, because my aunt neglected to mention the brand she had. And I still don't know to this day, and honestly I no longer care. My Corosi, however, is the best. Everything is pre-set. It comes with a recipe book and the clean up is way to easy no matter what you cook. I basically got it to cook wings for football games, but now am cooking most of everything I eat. I have read other reviews that talk about the plastic smell, and even the taste of plastic; however, I can say that once I smelled the plastic I felt defeated. I didn't want to return this possible dream come true, I had dreams of not buying stock in BWW. But low and behold, while retrieving the lot number, I noticed that parts of the styrofoam had broken off, and gotten caught up in a crease; after I removed, everything was great.  Once, I get some of the accessories or air fryer containers for other stuff I don't think I will ever use a conventional stove again. I have already purchased one for my mom. When anyone mentions their air fryer, am there to brag about what I believe is the best air fryer on the market, but don't tell my aunt.
title: Say What????

author: Julianne Davies
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020
review_content: I‚Äôve run this thing for hours now trying to get the awful plastic smell out. After using it in my kitchen for 20 minutes and getting that nasty smell all through my house I spent the day today running it outside on my porch and then cleaning it with hot soapy water. Rinse and repeat. Hours. Food still taste of plastic. And now so does my porch. I can‚Äôt see that I‚Äôll ever be able to use it so I consider it a waste of $130. And don‚Äôt believe the manufacturer responses in here that says there‚Äôs no way the plastic smell is getting into the food. It does, and has continued to do so all day, after hours and hours.I admit that I‚Äôm a bit sensitive to smells, but from the reviews on here I‚Äôm not the only one. Before you order, if you think you might be one of those people, don‚Äôt ignore the warning reviews on here like I did. Save yourself some money and don‚Äôt bother.
title: The plastic smell is awful

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
review_content: Had this for about a week and have been using it daily. So far it works well. I made simple food like fries, various vegetables, and some marinated chicken (not together, all were separate meals).My fries certainly cooked through but were a bit limp the first time around and I expect this was because I used too much oil when I coated them in spices. The second time I didn't use oil at all and even patted the potatoes dry before cooking, and they came out very crispy. Next time I'll try for something in the middle. All of the fried veggies were tasty but nothing that I can't get from baking them on a sheet pan in the oven. They took less time in the air fryer so that is a benefit. The chicken would have benefited from less time in the fryer but that is my own trial and error since meat cuts can vary in size. Still came out tasty and moist since they've been marinating for a few hours.Cleanup is simple; just have to wait for the whole thing to cool down, then I've been giving it a gentle wipe down but haven't made anything messy enough to warrant a full scrub yet.Overall I'm happy with the purchase. It hasn't done anything unexpected yet (I saw some reviews about it leaking steam but have not had that happen. My coffee machine makes more visible steam than this thing does). Its been a good addition to my kitchen so far.
title: Simple to use, gets food cooked faster than oven

author: kjs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021
review_content: I'm enjoying this air fryer a lot. It's our second one and I love the features this one has compared to our old one.I like that we can change the cooking time and temperature to whatever we want, there's a "shake" reminder on this one for fries that's handy. I also like the basket shape better. This one is square whereas our old one was round. Not a big deal, but it seems like it's a lot easier to fit things into a square basket rather than a rounded one.Because of the flexibility of the timer and temperature settings, we tend to use the air fryer in place of the microwave for many things. It yields much better results reheating french fries, chicken, even hamburgers. Everything tastes better reheated in the air fryer. I'm glad we got this new one.Be sure to use a non-aerosol cooking spray to keep the nonstick finish nice and smooth!
title: Fun and Easy to Use

author: hwatkins
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019
review_content: I just had to write a review.  I have a Nuwave AF, but didn't like it as much as my Cosori.  I love the basket vs the Nuwave, so much easier to clean.  The non stick coating appears to be better as well, my Nuwave started to peal just after a few uses.  Over this past weekend, I used it all weekend.  I made chicken drums that turned out perfect and made some honey glazed carrots from the awesome Cosori cookbook that it came with.  I also, made some muffins and two Cornish hens...came out awesome as well.  Last night I made pizza's ....delish!  This AF is so easy, you won't be disappointed if you bought one for yourself!  A very satisfied customer.  I have a Cosori pressure cooker as well and love it too!
title: I love this Cosori Air Fryer!!

author: yankeefan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
review_content: I ordered this Sept. 3, 2019 and received it today, Sept. 5th, 2019. I was excited to use it and had the food ready. I preheated it and after 2 mins, it said E1. I called the company and they said its defective!!!  Since I just had major surgery, I can not repack it. I called the company and they emailed me information which I sent the information they wanted. I will edit my review when I get a new unit. I tried 3 times to use the unit and E1 kept coming up which is open circuit temperature monitor issue. I am now waiting for a new replacement. Such a disappointment since I saw a lot of good reviews for this.Update: 10/16/19 I received a new unit but wanted to wait a few weeks to see how it works. No problems so far, and it works well. I like how it cooks food. I was told that smoke that comes out from the bottom is normal when cooking certain foods like chicken or wings.  Easy to clean baskets in dishwasher.  I look forward to using this product.
title: Updated review..works good

author: J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
review_content: I originally had a philips air fryer for years. I wanted something bigger so I came across Cosori on Amazon. The smart feature sounded so nice so I bought it. The first one I received, the touchscreen did not work at all. It worked only on my iphone.So i returned itSo i placed another order but They sent me a totally different model. I returned it again.So i ordered it again telling myself this has to be the last time. Touchscreen works but now it won‚Äôt connect to my iphone. The wifi signal kept turning on and off!!!!!!!!The food comes out delicious but I am totally annoyed by the fact that their product is partially broken every time I got a replacement.BUY SOMETHING ELSE. The smart feature sounds nice but it does not work anyway!!!!Not worth your time to try and return !!!
title: Do not buy Cosori. Worst experience

author: Kimberly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021
review_content: I bought this in late October.About two months ago the screws started getting loose, I would retighten. As of two weeks ago two screws would no longer tighten and the basket stayed with one screw. Well tonight that screw randomly popped off while taking out my food and the baskets separated. Very annoying because some of my food fell. It‚Äôs only been a few months and I barley use it. Broke way to soon and this air fryer is expensive. So not worth it.
title: All the screws came off and won‚Äôt retighten

author: Larry E Scoggin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
review_content: I bought the fryer in November 2018.  I registered it for an extra year (2 years) of warrantee.  I recently contact the company explaining the drawer no long locked (clicked) in place as would not operate unless I jammed it closed with something heavy in front of the drawer.  I sent a picture of the top of the drawer showing the piece that "clicks" when you try to push the drawer in place.  I also sent a copy of the extended warrantee I had registered.What I got back from their customer support was instructions to send them a video of the drawer being inserted (and presumably popping back out), a copy of the purchase order and a (re) statement of the problem.  I suspect all that is designed to make me just go away.  It has, except for this review.What the company got from me is a (former) customer who will not replace this fryer with another one from CORSORI.If you think you will like this fryer, roll the dice and hope you never need it warrantee service.  Other than the lousy customer service and the drawer latch design, it's not a bad fryer.
title: The warrantee and customer service suck.  Will not repeat purchase.

author: Ikram
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021
review_content: Love my new Air Fryer! Did a lot of research! Almost wanted to wait another year before getting one. But peer and family pressure forced me to make a decision. After reading all the reviews, blogs and vlogs, I chose this model. For three reasons: 1. Size: Live in a 2br apartment with an apartment sized kitchen. So space is at a premium. I can easily put this on the counter. And stow away inside the now-soon-to-be-useless oven. It's not heavy (for me) so this is a win-win. 2. Features: I can ask Alexa to do something useful finally? Are you kidding? This was a no-brainer. I can now boss Alexa around and have it cook stuff for me. 3. Cooking mode: A bachelors life can be filled with frozen foods. So something that can cook me a steak dinner without having to thaw them first was another no-brainer!The setup was super easy. Got all the packaging, plastics outs. Did the first time use steps (preheat for 5 minutes, do a fake "steak"). Wifi setup was super easy! I already had the Vsync app in my phone for my hi-tech weighing scale, so just added the "Smart Air Fryer". The App automatically picked it up. Just had to specify the model I have and it was done in a few minutes.Couldn't wait to pop-in my cornish game hen. Was marinating it for half a day in some spicy cajun spice mix. Did put the water that had the marinate in the tray. Read somewhere that having a bit of water in there prevents smoke. Put some foil in the basket. Patted dry the chicken, sprinkled some more of the rub and popped it in. Set it at 380 for 25 minutes (also had the preheat button on). Used my phone to start it. But had to actually physically press the start button on the unit. Read somewhere that Alexa can actually do the pushing part for me. After 25 minutes, opened the tray, flipped over to the non-breast side, set for 380/20min. And that was it!The smell was amazing! It filled the apartment with the smell of smoked\grilled\fried chicken! The taste was awesome too! But I think next time I have to add a bit more salt. I relied on the salt in the rub but I think I'll need to add a little more.Really happy with this purchase!
title: What a gadget!!

author: Rita Review
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review_content: Clarification of ONE Star:  All categories provided for "stars" were very good, the actual unit isn't at issue.  The Air Fryer does not product the intended results.  There is no such thing as frying with air!So I wish I had seen even ONE bad review for this mode of cooking or this manufacturer (did read the 2% 1-3 stars reviews on Amazon AFTER I bought it.  Hadn't done the math..it was 2% of 59,000 reviews, that's really credible number of people).  But after reading multiple good comments, conferring with friends and reading magazine reviews and Amazon reviews, we chose a medium sized, middle range price. A very good looking unit.  It did not show pictures on a normal counter but somewhere it said it was large.  But it really wasn't too big and it looked great.  I did the initial start up  "test", it worked perfectly.This is where the good review ends.  This is NOT about Cosori, it worked exactly as it said it would and they designed a well made product.  It's more about how the end product turns out and the prep time and the noise and the remnants of aroma hanging in the air.First, we could not keep it in a front facing position because warm air blows around it all the time it's cooking, which could have affected our under cabinet lighting.  So it had to be pulled out from under the cabinets and turn it sideways, or there would have been no place for the large drawer to open. That worked but was a less than ergonomic.  Some people said they used it on their stove, but if you're making a meal you need your stove top.I tested using it by making two different veggies...eggplant and potatoes.  After partially peeling the eggplant and cutting it into cubes and salting it well, I put it on paper on my large edged baking tray.  Layered more paper over it and added the weight of a second tray on top.  Got rid of a LOT of water that way.  Thoroughly dried and oiled (a tablespoon) the eggplant.  Followed directions for air-fryer and in they went.  About 20 minutes later (at 400 degrees) the eggplant was creamy inside, but very chewy (not "fried") outside.  Ground it all up in my new Cusinart grinder (thank you Amazon) but had no tahini so couldn't make baba ganoush from it.  Tossed it in the garbage.Next night: "Fried" potatoes.  The thing that inspired me to buy the unit.  Imagine real french fries with fewer calories!Two Russet potatoes.  Cut in strips.  Soaked in cold water...1 hour.  Drained, covered with boiling water...10 minutes.  Cooled...10 minutes. Towel dried.  One tablespoon of oil, seasoning.  Temp 380 for 20 minutes.  400 for 5 or so more minutes.  And...the potatoes looked fantastic.  BUT the skin was super dry and they were not "crispy", even tho they looked "crispy".  Not limp, nice and brown. The insides were delicious, but no better than when cooked in my convection toaster oven or in a fry pan. And a lot more prep.Add to all of this the thing is extremely loud when cooking, three times louder than my microwave (which, btw, was also cooking and I could not even hear it).  When it was all cleaned up there was an aroma of oil in the air, lasted for two days, probably carried by the warm air continually blowing out of the back of the unit while it's "frying".One reviewer says "there's no such thing as air frying".  She's right.All and all, not worth the time or the money.  Decision made.  Returned it.  So disappointed.  Thank you Amazon for making this experience "doable".  I am your customer forever!
title: My Drudgery Air Fryer

author: kong xiong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2021
review_content: The good:Easy to clean, use and cooks great with certain foods like chicken wings, frozen pizza but not so great for others like fries.The bad:The design stinks.  The screws used to hold the inner basket isn‚Äôt strong enough so after repeated uses, they get loose and fall off.  I have replaced the screws 4x.  Also there are times the latch Mechanism Will unpatch and the base basket will fall splashing oil everywhere.  Happened to me 3x now. Had some great meals with this air fryer,  but I won‚Äôt be buying another one after this one dies and I don‚Äôt recommend it since there are so many others with better designs.
title: Cooks good bad design, basket issues.

author: Anna Kim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: I'm not a great cook, but the air fryer is pretty fool proof. There are a few things that catch me off guard when I use it though:1. The temperature only goes up in intervals of 10, so if directions tell you to cook at 375 you have to either go 370 or 380 and adjust cooking times. Not a huge deal, but still a little off-putting if you aren't cooking savvy.2. Cleaning the product is kind of weird. I'm very careful about keeping things clean, and this airflow fryer tests me each time. There are these little air hole/vents on the part you pull out. Whenever I soak the basket to make sure I can get everything off while damaging the basket coating as little as possible. When I go to clean the basket and drawer, little food particulates end up stuck inside. It takes a lot of poking and prodding to get everything out. There are screws holding everything in place, so in theory you could take it apart to clean, but who wants to take something apart each clean?Aside from that the air fryer itself works wonders. I've made a couple of chicken dishes that turned out wonderful, crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Pre-made things are good too, like store bought sweet potato fries from Trader Joe's. I received this as a gift, but I would have little hesitation buying it for myself again.
title: Great except...

author: Estrella
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2019
review_content: I consider myself to be a tough cookie when it comes to reviewing products but also I‚Äôm fair. I‚Äôve had a couple of different machines similar to this one and I wasn‚Äôt happy with them. If you‚Äôre thinking of buying one of these, I HIGHLY suggest it. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS MACHINE!! If I could give it 10‚≠êÔ∏è I definitely would! I‚Äôm a happy customer. üëçüèª
title: You WILL love this cooker!!

author: Cruzer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
review_content: Update... while I continue to love the function of this air fryer, I am very disappointed that we have had this for less than six months and the nonstick coating is peeling off. We only hand wash the basket, and only use silicone tools, yet the non-stick coating has begun to peel off. I feel it is unsafe to place food directly in the basket m, so we are now using parchment squares. Unfortunately some things are not as crisp with the use of the parchment. Really disappointing.Love this! I rarely write a review, but feel this earned it! I mainly bought it to shut my husband up. He wanted to make wings in it. I thought maybe tator tots would be crispier in it than in the oven. Oh my gosh!! Almost everything we put in the oven (meats, baked goods, sides, etc.) we‚Äôve been making in here! Everything is delicious and made in 1/3 of the time it takes in the oven without heating up the house. I spent three hours with it running last weekend baking multiple batches of bread. I would normally have spent 6-8 hours baking that bread. With temps over 100¬∞ outside, that‚Äôs a miserable day in the kitchen. Three hours and it never raised the temp in the room. I can‚Äôt say enough good about this air fryer. It is definitely worth spending a little extra to get some parchment paper squares, the cookware set, and some silicone items (little cupcake forms). But those things are not a must. We bought them after trying out the air fryer for a couple of weeks. Be sure to go through the included recipe book. We‚Äôve used some recipes from the book, but even more have used it as a guide to determine how long and what temp in adapting our normal oven recipes.
title: 6 months later... DISAPPOINTED...  Best small appliance I‚Äôve purchased in years!

author: Tanya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021
