review_content: So far so good. Easy to use. I experiment with new foods and am happy with results. I made cake with the small circle pan and noticed the middle rises more, but was fine. I think for cakes I will use my small toaster oven. Since many frozen foods do not provide directions on using an air fryer...yet...it is sometimes just googling an item and determining the weight of your food against that which is listed, nice thing is many have already done it, so using is made easier, you don't really need a cookbook to use this...my opinion. I do notice my chicken breast come out juicy, which I was happy and surprised, thought the air fryer would dry them out, but it depends again on weight of your food. So far no issues with air fryer, works well and I use it often, more than I expected. Less time cooking, easy to clean, and healthier. Will report back if any issues after longer time...fingers crossed.
title: Works Well

author: K9 trainer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: I was very excited when I first received my air fryer. However I did notice that sometimes the touch screen didn‚Äôt work. Over a couple of weeks it reached a point where it didn‚Äôt work at all. I called Customer Service with the company and was told I needed to get an invoice and bill of sale or something else a picture of the bottom of the fryer and I don‚Äôt remember what else. I‚Äôm 75 years old and I am limited in what I can do so nap. So now I have a lovely black paperweight. I don‚Äôt recommend this not because it‚Äôs not potentially wonderful but because any support does not exist.Update: Got a replacement and it is fantastic! I don‚Äôt cook a lot - but I decided to make baked potato - WOW I ended up with really h delicious potatoes: soft and fluffy on the inside and delicious crispy skins. Now I look forward to more cooking.
title: Amazing kitchen tool!

author: Busymama03
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
review_content: "Turn the beeping beeps off!" cried the dogs as they huddled trembling in the farthest corner of the house. Their humans were again making tater tots marveling at how fast their food was cooked to crispy perfection. Noticing their rescue dogs' reaction every time, they looked for a volume nob an on/off switch for the beeping. Nothing. They wrote to the manufacturer asking for help. Nothing could be done. You see, the year was 2020, the year of the upside down, the year even Murphy ran out of laws to write, the year a family could not enjoy crispy taters without terrifying their dogs. The beeps will only stop when the machine is replaced.
title: The almost perfect machine. Humans vs Dogs

author: Jqbuckley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020
review_content: Love this air fryer. We had the Power xl air fryer in the 3 qt model and the 5 qt model. We used the Power Xl on a daily basis but began to have trouble with the switch located at the bottom where you put the basket in early on. You had to put the basket in and sort of jiggle it to get it to toggle the switch on to allow the air fryer to operate. Eventually, that stopped working and the power xl would no longer turn on. So, it was time to replace it.  The Cosori Air Fryer Max XL does not have this problem. There is no switch at the bottom. The basket slides in easily without having to maneuver it to catch the switch.  I believe it does a better job air frying than the Power Xl.  The preset cooking times and temperatures are great. It is easy to change time and temperatures and it has a pause feature.  The basket handle is sturdy and locks into place easily.  It is non stick and easy to clean.  I like the design of the square basket, it can easily fit a 5 lb chicken. It is easy to use and does a better job than the power Xl.  Wish I would have bought  this one to begin with.  If you are looking for an air fryer this is the one.
title: Love this

author: worm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2021
review_content: These are best if used for finger foods like wings, mozz stix, fries, etc. I've done 4 cuts of meat (pork tenderloin, boneless ribeye, filet mignon, and chicken breast) exactly how the included recipe guide tells you and all have come out raw, not rare, but raw inside and browned up on the outside.As far as these being a healthy alternative, you need to still use oil on most foods. better than a deep fryer but still not healthy dieting. do plenty of research first, like watch popular youtube videos or read pintrest recipes to see if this is really what you are looking for. I found a Foreman Grill to be healthier for you than this actually.
title: Rather have a grill when it comes to meat

author: DR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021
review_content: I‚Äôm definitely impressed with how easy this is to set up and start using so easily.  It does come with great step by step instructions, but it‚Äôs very user friendly.  I held off on buying an air fryer for so long because I know how to cook, and basically air fryers are just small convection ovens. BUT air fryers heat up so much quicker and do cook a bit faster. Nothing magical, but it‚Äôs definitely a time saver!  I‚Äôm also realizing what people have been saying about reheating food being so much better in the air fryer vs the microwave. I‚Äôd say the air fryer takes a little longer than the microwave, but not much and I like the way it reheats many things over the microwave. I‚Äôve also found that you get used to knowing how long to cook and at what temperature pretty quickly. There are many presets but I‚Äôve never used them.  Since I‚Äôm a cook, it‚Äôs more intuitive for me to play with the time and temps.  The unit itself is attractive. I got white to match my kitchen while it‚Äôs out, but it‚Äôs definitely small enough to store in a lower cabinet.  I gave 4 stars because the minute you grab the handle for the basket, you‚Äôll think it‚Äôs broken.  I‚Äôve read people talk about the flimsy plastic slide cover over the button.  Also when you do grab the handle to pull out the basket, it feels like it‚Äôs not aligned.  Every time I pull the basket out or push it back in, I feel like it‚Äôs going to break. I won‚Äôt be surprised if that plastic piece breaks off at some point.  I did sign up for the extended warranty so I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm ok.  Final verdict : I‚Äôm glad I have it. It is very convenient.  I bought a second one for our other home.
title: Great for small meals

author: Lynn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021
review_content: This product got good ratings and that's what I go by, but it disappointed. I eat healthy all the time and thought I'd be able to get crispy foods without fats but was wrong. Most people use a spray of oil to cook with. Unless you preprogram all of the settings...you have to know when to turn or shake half way through cooking. It's pretty loud. I can place way more foods on a cookie sheet spread out in my oven then in the air fryer. It actually takes up too much time in the kitchen to monitor it. I prefer my oven over this. I also have friends who have different models that stop automatically half way through and tell you to turn your foods without pre-programming first. I feel this is just another fad. If it helps you eat healthier than you do now...research other models for ease. I was really hoping to like it.
title: Disappointed

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2021
review_content: I finally jumped in that bandwagon and after loads of research settled on this one. Setup was easy out of the box. I opted for 2 recipes out of their book to start since I‚Äôm a beginner. First, homemade fries. Fail. 50 minutes (!!) later and I finally just deep fried them. It was even a tiny batch, not even covering the bottom of the basket. Ok‚Ä¶frozen chicken nuggets. Fail. 30 minutes later and they‚Äôre warm but soggy. Guys, I‚Äôm following the directions to the T, preheating and everything. I finally managed to cook a grilled cheese sandwich haha, but it still takes much longer than my grill press and with my press I don‚Äôt have to flip it to cook both sides. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs just this unit or air fryers in general but I am UNIMPRESSED :(
title: I finally bought an air fryer‚Ä¶ :(

author: Kayla Gross
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021
review_content: I have never before used an air fryer so I don‚Äôt have anything to compare this to. However I have made donuts I have made chicken thighs a small ham frozen chicken tenders. This list goes on I use this for everything now and it‚Äôs so quick! The only thing I have made in this machine I didn‚Äôt love was sweet potato tots and I can‚Äôt rule out that the product just wasn‚Äôt good itself. I‚Äôve heard French fries aren‚Äôt exactly the best in the air fryer so I have been hesitant to try but as for everything else absolutely delicious! I looooove the automatic buttons on the machine as well I use them more than I follow the recipes directions and they never fail me. I would recommend you cook meats covered in foil with some oil/juices it keeps it from going dry and then to crisp it up turn the heat up and uncover it. I don‚Äôt like to waste counter space but this has a permanent spot for as long as it works then I‚Äôll probably buy another one. It‚Äôs just that good.
title: Just buy it already

author: Celeste T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2019
review_content: Like most people, I have a very busy schedule.  When I get home, I don't feel like cooking......and, I'm just an OK cook because I really don't have the patience when I'm tired after a busy day. BUT NOW......I find myself looking forward to coming home and trying new things in my air fryer.  I am single and cooked a cornish hen in my 5.8 qt. fryer.  It came out beautiful.  I also did some chicken wings and they were DELICIOUS.  I even baked a sweet potato in my fryer and it was scrumptious.  I showed my pics to a friend and she had me order a Corsori for her right on the spot!  Thanks Corsori!  The fryer is very simple to use.  Cooks quickly.  Food tastes delicious and there is practically no clean up at all.  I couldn't ask for more. And no, I wasn't given anything to write this review.
title: TERRIFIC AIR FRYER!!!!!

author: Greg
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2019
review_content: I bought this air fryer to assist in making chicken nuggets and fries for the kids.  What I learned is it does so much more.  I have evolved in to using it daily and cooking almost anything I would normally fry or bake using my stove/oven with much less cleanup and hassle.  I have to admit, I am a sucker for new appliances.  I jumped on sous-vide, which I actually think is the most delicious way to cook cuts of meat especially when entertaining or cooking large cuts but it takes time and some preparation and some mess (mainly in that you still have to use the stove or grill to sear the meat).  Still love it but use less often than at first (it doesn't take much room so no bother).  I then jumped on the insta-pot.  Tried to use it a lot but now it has ended up mostly just being a smaller slow cooker than the one I have.  The pressure cook feature (and other features) can be convenient but not worth having a bulky extra appliance for if you already have a slow cooker.  Now comes to the air fryer.  I had big concerns because of it's size - larger than the previous two things I mentioned.  I saved all the packing material with expectation that I would ship it back.  Much to my surprise, not only does it cook the fries/nuggets (and chicken wings I might add) much better than the oven, it cooks hamburger, chicken, steak, seafood, vegetables, garlic bread . . . almost everything you could cook on the stove/oven quickly and with a really good result (once you get a handle on the temp/time requirements).  On top of that, the cooking is all contained so it doesn't make a mess of your stove, oven, countertops, or pans and it 's cooking tray is very easy to clean - imagine no grease to clean up from the stove area after frying..  I often make 2-3 different things sequentially which makes me at times wish I had two.  That way I could cook the main and side dishes (ie. nuggets/fries) at the same time (although you probably can do it with just one but I have done that yet due to capacity).  My stove/oven usage has dropped by at least 50-70%.  Because of that, I leave this unit out all the time.  It is bulky for a small kitchen (like mine) but fortunately I have a small table just off the kitchen in the breakfast area where this fits without being in the way.  Yes, in the breakfast area because this makes no mess outside of the cooker and it looks attractive enough not to be an eye sore.  Now lets talk size.  I bought the 5.8qt and am so glad I did.  One of the only two wishes I had for this unit is that it held more, although I find this to be mostly adequate for a family of four and I don't think I would want it to take up any more space.  It can cook 3 - 4 large chicken breasts or 4 hamburgers at one time and I am sure it would cook bacon very well but you may not get more than 6- 8 slices in there.  I don't think this brand is any better or worse in this regard compared to other brands of the same volume spec.  I believe there are some models that have a rack so you can increase food capacity.  I'm not sure how well this works but from simple observation of how air fying works I think it would.  Also note, the smaller volume (ie. 3qt) versions are not that much smaller on the outside but noticeably smaller in cooking capacity.Now for the fryer review.  Having not had another, I am very pleased with this model and would recommend.  As I have noted, I like the way it cooks and looks.  Food is very crispy on the outside and finished nicely on the inside and it cooks the entire contents very evenly.  It seems to be well built and the cooking pan/parts are very easy to clean.  The controls are logical and the buttons are touch sensitive.  My second minor wish is that the buttons would be more consistent in their sensitivity but I realize they were designed this way for easy cleaning - so probably a worthwhile trade-off.  In short I highly recommend this brand.  I've only been using it a month and so far no problems.  If I have any problems in quality or durability moving forward I will update this review.  Most of all, I highly recommend having an air fryer.  This is an appliance I can see myself using every day and for a long time.
title: Not Just Another Fad Appliance

author: Micseydel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021
review_content: This was the best purchase I made in 2020, for sure. I eat a lot more veggies now and I enjoy them so much more. Overall, I am quite pleased with this model, though I have a couple of small concerns.The biggest frustration is around the buttons being hard to press. My roommate doesn't have the same issue, but me and a friend can't reliably push them. With practice, I find that I can do it reliably, though not always on the first try, which I find frustrating. I'm surprised button technology in 2020 is this flawed.On a more minor point, there are screws that loosen and we need to tighten with a screwdriver occasionally. This is infrequent enough that it doesn't bother me much, but seemed worth mentioning.I've been considering getting a bigger air fryer, and I've liked this one enough that I'll check this brand first. Any complaints about the buttons or screws and I'll do more research, but I *am* a brand loyalist so we'll see.Also, me and my roommate are nerdy engineers but neither of us has needed to try out the wifi feature.
title: Almost perfect

author: Vbauer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2021
review_content: So so so happy I finally purchased an air fryer! I‚Äôve got a family of five and I needed a big one so when the 5.8 quart was on sale I snagged it immediately. It arrived in perfect condition, the instructions were very easy to follow for set up. I did have an issue connecting the air fryer to the app, I did call customer support to help with that but I had pretty much done all the troubleshooting I possibly could so they unfortunately were not really able to help me. But they were very nice about it and they gave me some advice as far as how to troubleshoot it at another time. I have yet to do it but honestly it‚Äôs more so just a convenient aspect to be able to use the app rather than I needed function of the air fryer. The air fryer itself is really easy to use, just be sure to read the instructions very carefully and you should not have any issues whatsoever. You definitely have to play around with the temperature as well as the timing at first though. We ended up getting some pizza rolls and bagel bites and stuff like that to just sort of play around with because we figured if we burnt them then no harm no foul. I‚Äôm getting the hang of it but I still overcook some things here and there lol. It took me like two or three times to realize that because it‚Äôs a smaller device rather than a huge oven you really do not need to use the exact same temperature that a lot of frozen foods require for an oven, as well as the timing. clean up is a breeze, just use a sponge with warm water and a little bit of soap and if you scrub it right after it cools off then you‚Äôre good. I believe The instructions said you can put the basket, the small basket, into the top rack of the dishwasher (definitely read the instructions when it comes to that though!) but I was also told I could put this new set of knives that I got in the dishwasher as well and they started rusting really fast so I‚Äôve just been hand washing the basket and drying them immediately after. Prior to buying this air fryer I saw a lot of people who did use them use foil in the small basket as well just to help with the cleanup afterwords. I tried that with bacon just as a test but unfortunately because of the amount of fat and grease that came off of the bacon it didn‚Äôt really crisp up very well and I ended up having to leave it in the air fryer for longer than recommended. Overall you just have to play around with the settings, definitely do the test run of the instructions tell you to to begin with just so you get the hang of it. But I absolutely love this and I‚Äôm really excited to make more with it than just frozen food.
title: Now I don‚Äôt have to wait for my oven to heat up!

author: Paul
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_content: Ease of use - well, I had to train myself to not press the power button again, which is very easy to do thinking that it is how you would start the machine. No, you need to press the button once to turn the machine on, and then press 'play' button above. At first, my hand will automatically turn the machine off instead of starting the air fryer cycle :)Functionality-wise, it is very good. Have no complaint so far.One thing I have noticed wit the drawer latch - drawer is secured by a little knob at the bottom which will find its place when you push it in. Over time, this will wear off and the drawer will not fit - and the air fryer will not turn on without it closed all the way. Called COSORI and they sent me a replacement - which did not yet develop same issue.Looking at the design though, that plastic knob looks like it will eventually wear off and will cause same issue.
title: Nice air fryer - little knob that would lock the removable drawer seem to wear off in time though

author: Artistic Soul
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2019
review_content: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my Cosori Air Fryer!!!  Fried foods are my favorites, but I hate cleaning up the mess.  Even though I am on the keto eating plan, I still don't like cleaning up the mess of frying food, especially bacon.  I knew a year ago I wanted an air fryer, and it took me awhile to pick out which one was right for me.  I researched, and I read reviews.  Finally I decided upon the Cosori.  The main reason I picked this one were the reviews, not only for the air fryer, but for the positive Cosori customer service reviews.I waited to write this review because I wanted to see how I liked it.  I've had it for two months now, and I purchased it at the regular price.  I also have not had any reason to contact their customer service.  I have used it everyday now, sometimes 2-3 times a day.It is sooo easy to clean.  After cooking, any grease I pour into an old coffee container, and then wipe it with paper towel before I use soap and a sponge (the soft side, not the scouring side.)  The baskets can go into the dishwasher, but so far I have washed it by hand each time because I use it so often, and I don't run the dishwasher every day.I have cooked bacon, steaks, sausage patties, frozen chicken wings, frozen chicken breasts, hamburgers, hotdogs, vegetables, etc.  I plan on experimenting with desserts eventually ... just haven't done it yet.  The first week of using the air fryer, I overcooked a few items, especially frozen vegetables like broccoli, trying to figure out the time of cooking.  No big deal.  I ate it anyway.  It has preset times, which I use every so often, but I wanted to understand the fryer so I experimented more.  I only cook for three people, sometimes four, so the size is just right.  If there is something in particular that I want to cook in it, I read air fryer recipes and ideas from others, then I adapt it to my likes and eating needs.  I am so very happy with my purchase!!!!  I hope this review helps make your decisions easier.
title: My FAVORITE kitchen gadet!!!

author: Michelle R. Rolon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021
review_content: I absolutely love this air fryer. It‚Äôs so versatile and easy to use. I prepared a whole chicken in it and it was amazing. It took a fraction of the time to air fry it and the skin was so crispy and the flavor was awesome. I‚Äôve air fried wings, panko shrimp, garlic bread, etc. I‚Äôve also baked cookies in it with great success. I use this air fryer every day.I‚Äôm updating my first review. Since I reviewed this back in June there was no issues with this air fryer. Absolutely loved it, loved using it. Now the option to change the temperature and time isn‚Äôt working. No matter how many times I press the time and temperature option won‚Äôt  let me change it. I used it almost everyday. I live in Puerto Rico where it‚Äôs hot and it saved me from having to turn on the oven and gave us healthier options to frying on the stove. I‚Äôm so disappointed.
title: Update

author: Chad P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review_content: Excellent air fryer. We purchased this after a recommendation from a coworker who also loves it. It‚Äôs very easy to use, and the food turns out exactly how you would hope. Unfortunately, at about 11 months of use, the fryer quit working. I figured we were out of luck and money. This is where I was incredibly impressed. I reached out to their customer service department. It was easy. They were friendly. They quickly stood by their product and replaced the air fryer. Im so happy to see high level customer service and integrity is alive and well!  Thank you Cosori!
title: Customer for life

author: D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review_content: This product would be a solid 5 stars, because it's GREAT at everything EXCEPT that whoever designed and tested this clearly doesn't have hearing and doesn't care about how awful loud it isI got a noise complaint from a neighbor upstairs about the beeping. Two floors up. Not the person above me, but the person above them.If you don't open the drawer when it wants you to shake, it will beep and beep and beep, every minute, as if somehow you didn't hear it the first time.This is a really great product that is made into a two star product because of this one glaring inconvenience.  They really should have tested this first or at least made an option to change the beep volume.
title: BEEPS so loud it will damage your hearing

author: Reddington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2021
review_content: I'm 30, and we've never had an air fryer before.  We have been talking about it for a while and caved in to get this: IT CHANGES EVERYTHING!  We've used this almost every day since we got it set up and it has changed how we cook food.  For certain things such as pizzas, it really keeps the original flavor that you'd get from ordering pizza out, including keeping the crust nice and crunchy.For steak, you rarely - if at all - actually have to flip the steaks.  This little thing is amazing and has become a staple of our house.  Something I did want to mention was clean-up after using it.  After using the stove or oven, clean up can be annoying.  Cleaning this one is VERY easy and takes no time at all.I'm extremely happy with this.
title: Changed the way we cooked things

author: Dave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†I bought this unit from Amazon Warehouse and it was listed as  Used - very good. The unit was brand new and the packaging was damaged. I used it for a few months and it quit working.  It was supposed to have a one year warranty so I contacted the manufacturer and explained that the basket latching system had failed.  I could  wiggle it and pull up and it would turn on the unit until you let loose. (see video)  They suggested that I clean the unit (even though I told them that I had already tried that) and they would not honor the warranty because it was listed a s used because  I bought it from Amazon Warehouse. The bottom line is that I will not purchase ANYTHING from Cosori. I believe that this product is defective in its design of its latching mechanism.  Cosori used a loop hole to justify not honoring their warranty.  The unit was never used before I received it.  It failed within the warranty period and they will not replace or repair the unit. BUYER BEWARE!(update)I reviewed the Amazon Warehouse policy and I was not eligible for the  company warranty as they had stated.I contacted  support noting that the unit was unused when  I received it and that I was disappointed that they wouldn't honor the warranty. In between time, I tore into the defective unit and found a micro switch that signaled the presence of the cooking tray had failed.  I ordered a replacement for $5 and it is on its way. Meanwhile Cosori contacted me  and made a ONE TIME EXCEPTION  and was shipping me a replacement unit.The bottom line is that I changed  this review to 3 stars because they considered the situation.
title: Defective Design - Manufacturer won't stand behind product (updated at end) happy ending

author: Paul H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: I love the air fryer itself, but after about 3 months of medium use, the controls on the machine stopped working. Thank god for the app and/or echo that allows me to control it or else I would have to throw it out. Regardless, it is a pain to have to control this device using my smart phone instead of just pressing the buttons,
title: Button panel controls stopped working

author: Raquel Padilla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020
review_content: Cleaned, plugged in, prepared to use. Turned on to see that 8 buttons are broken including the preheat and temp/time buttons. Only a few of the preset buttons are working. I've seen other reviews about how their first fryers arrived defective until they contacted customer support and got sent a new one. It should arrive working the first time. I will update after I contact them.UPDATE:It arrived in original packaging and taped up, similar to the first. Buttons work fine, however, the bottom of the air fryer does not completely push in or close, letting steam out the front. I've included pictures showing steam being released. If I push the handle in and hold it, the gap closes and steam is released from the back like it should. I believe it is a problem with the latch. The review will remain 1 star until I get one with no defects.UPDATE 2:I decided to keep it for a few days to test and see if the gap at bottom of the air fryer that was releasing steam would affect the product. To my dismay, in the middle of cooking chicken strips, the air fryer basket dislodged and shot across my counter, almost scattering my food around the kitchen. I looked in horror as the hot basket lay on my newly refurbished counter before quickly grabbing it and placing it on a heat resistant surface, wondering how, had I not been there watching intently, the damage could have been catastrophic. I am furious and I believe that receiving a faulty product twice, with the second one almost causing damage to my property and food, is not acceptable. Do not buy this product.
title: Arrived broken (TWICE)

author: TVSANTOS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019
review_content: I bought this Air Fryer two weeks ago, the item arrived fast. It was very well packed no damage. When I opened the box the Air Fryer looked brand new, however, the display was all scratched like someone has grabbed their keys and scratched all over the display. I called COSORI customer serviced, the gentlemen was so polite and professional, they offered a replacement right away. They grabbed my information and Amazon order number, I GIVE AN A+ FOR THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICES.The replacement arrived 4 days later, brand new no scratch, I am still learning how to use it, but we already love it. I cooked fries, chicken and steak. This air fryer is very hot so you have to be very careful with timing. I love how it beeps when you have to flip or shake.As for the taste, I don't know if it is because it is new, but my food tasted a little bit like the Cosori, I don't know how to explain in, but I'm guessing it is because the product is new, because the same thing happened with my pressure cooker.My husband and I definitely recommend this air fryer.
title: Great Product-Amazing Customer Service!

author: M. Cisneros
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†We bought the Cosori Air Fryer this year (2020) in March. We use it about 2-3 times a month. Today November 16 after trying to make some tots it would not stay shut thus making it inoperable. The lock latch function is poorly engineered and I‚Äôm afraid to force it or hold it shut
title: 8 Months Later

author: Marlyn Maibelli Le√≥n Urbina
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2019
review_content: No esperaba el momento en que llegara el air fryer lo estrenamos cocinando alitas de pollo y papitas fritas y quedaron deliciosamente crocantes y con un sabor espectacular y no usamos aceite por no tener en el momento pero compramos el aceite en spray de aove y solo lo usamos con un spray y todo el queda incre√≠blemente sabroso 100% recomendado
title: Que calidad!!!

author: Marla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2019
review_content: Unfortunately this didn‚Äôt work for us. The things were either overdone or underdone. It was however very easy to clean! We tried it 5 times. The food was not crispy even with the tip of adding 2 tablespoons of oil. So we ended up returning it.
title: Didn‚Äôt work for us

author: kjneil77
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2021
review_content: First reaction after tasting the first batch of French fries --- Wow! from an airfryer?! really?! This thing is amazing! Cooking chicken, veggies and whatever you could think of becomes a breeze, for marinated items make sure you pat it dry a tad or you'll make a mess or the catch tray below the "airfry" basket ( trust me I know haha) I haven't attempted baking in it yet but can't wait to give it  a go!This machine is a bit larger than I thought it would be, so if you don't have an awful lot of counter space be prepared for this thing to eat a good chunk of it or store it somewhere in your pantry and just take it out when you're going to use it, you need to pull it a few inches off the back splash when using it, you need enough ventilation for this big baby. The controls pad is nice and bright, temperature adjustment is a no brainer (+/-), all your preset menu is on the touch pad. it comes with a guide/cook book  as well for some really nice meal ideas! Clean up is a breeze especially if you followed instruction to not over marinate your goodies hahaha (guilty of not reading it well enough haha but the food still tasted good!)Overall, I give this unit the full 5 stars for performance, there's a bit of a fan noise but not enough to be a bother, I like the design as the square shape makes it easier to squeeze in my pantry. With Amazon's amazing exchange/return policy, try it!But I have a feeling you will keep it.Cheers!
title: Worth the money!

author: MysticalRose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2021
review_content: I have heard of air fryers for a long time now and I always thought I don't really need it and it will just be another appliance that will collect dust in the cabinet. I thought wrong!After reading so many reviews and asking friends, I decided on a Cosori 5.8qt size. After reading the manual thoroughly, I did all the test runs as suggested, wiped everything inside and out and washed the baskets and cooked my first food - salmon! It came out so delicious and faster than when I was using my Breville toaster oven. Now I cook vegetables and also cooked some tofu which came out crispy and very tasty.The casing or housing is not really that hot when it's on - can still be touched but not the back where the hot air vent is located. It's not that heavy - only 11.9 lbs.I like all the presets and especially like the beeping signal when it's time to shake or turn the food.This also came with a recipe book but I have not tried any of the recipes in there yet.The plug is not a 3-prong plug but a polarized plug - meaning one prong is larger than the other and can only be inserted in the wall plug one way. So I don't have to keep checking which way to plug, I put a dot of red nail polish on the front side and also unplug and hang the cord when not in use. (see my images)
title: I am in love with my air fryer!

author: Greg B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019
review_content: Controls are well laid out.  Pre-heat makes getting set easy.  Generous basket size.  Amazingly non-stick, even in the base unit with bacon or longer fried foods.  I've used foil to cover the base under the bracket to ease cleanup, but you really don't have to since it washes out SO EASILY.  The snowflake icon button for frozen foods is just right and I have developed a habit of delicious frozen brussel sprouts air fried on a regular basis.  Who would have thought?  Perfect for households of two or three, or even four.  Easy and fast chicken breasts or thighs or tenders, shrimp, asparagus, jicama fries, etc.  Haven't tried steak since I prefer sous vide slower cooking for those followed by a quick pan sear, but burgers were good.  Most pics show french fried potatoes, which are good, but don't overload the basket like those many photos show---that won't work well.  Oh, and I love the "shake" reminder which comes on autamically on a few of the icon button foods.  When you take the tray out to shake the oven pauses and restarts at the same place on the timer to continue the cook.  Highly recommend the Cosori Air fryer.
title: Didn't think I would use it this much !!

author: Jay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
review_content: Cosori's air fryer has some great features and a really nice aesthetic that will look nice in most kitchens.  The wifi capability and app control is a nice bonus.  Caution that it runs a bit hot--we had to shorten the length of most recipes by around 30% or else food would get burned.The real issue is it doesn't seem to be built to last, and most of the fryer's externals are made of pretty thin plastic.  After only around 6 months of use, the buttons on the air fryer itself stopped responding, so we could only use the phone app to control the air fryer.Not long after that, the plastic latch that engages when you put the cooking basket into the fryer broke off, so now it gives a "basket not inserted" error and refuses to cook.For this price, I would have hoped for a product that would have lasted longer than just 6 months, so I'm hesitant to recommend Cosori until they make some much needed improvements to the quality of their air fryer.
title: Worked well at first, but barely lasted 6 months :(

author: SoundSponge
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021
review_content: My fries, Tater Tots, and Hash Browns are the best in town.  You all know how poor all the fast food restaurants potato products have declined over the years....  I am embarrassed for them that they even serve them these days.So here's what you do...  Put your frozen fries in the fryer at 400 degrees for 12 minutes.  While they are cooking go get ya a Double Jack, or Whooper, or Quarter Pounder.  By the time you  get back home you will have a good sandwich you can put with great "Hot" Fries.... A much better plan than taking a few bites  of the cold soggy card board tasting fries and throwing the rest out.This air fryer allows you so many great options.  It has one job and does it well.  I strongly recommend this machine.
title: This opens the door to better ways!

author: Nea
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2021
review_content: I based this purchase on YouTube reviews and found this product a little lacking.The general use of the product is fairly intuitive if you know how to cook in a modern day kitchen and operate other cooking electronics.The touch screen has been problematic straight out of the box. Sometimes it just doesn't respond to pressing the function buttons and other times it's a delay response so it takes an inordinate amount of time to set the temperature and cook time.The WiFi function may become necessary in time when the display completely fails. Right now it holds no use for us.When the fryer is on it works as it should. Evenly and efficiently.The basket locking mechanism that joins the outer tray to the basket was a little tricky at first but works well.The nonstick coating on the basket was applied too thin. After the first wipe down, the coating was coming off. I definitely would hand wash the units components.As a new air fryer user this is a good entry level model but because of it's low quality, be prepared to buy new in under a year.I would not recommend this product because it's purchase price is not worth the amount of use you'd get from it.
title: Touch screen issues

author: Leidy Jim√©nez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2019
review_content: Waaaaaooooo me lleg√≥ s√∫per r√°pido creo que en dos d√≠as y me encant√≥, lleg√≥ en tres cajas muy bien empacado ning√∫n riesgo de romperse,en cuanto lleg√≥ hice unas pechugas de pollo y me encant√≥ el resultado y am√© el libro de cocina s√∫per buen√≠simos platos y bien saludables  estoy muy emocionada ya quiero hacer de todo , es la nueva reina de mi cocina, est√° bien grande eso me agrada porque somos familia de 4 ,la recomiendo 1000% jajajaj
title: La nueva Reina de mi cocina üëëüëëüëë

author: Kibbitzmom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020
review_content: I love crispy fried foods, but they don't love me.  What I use this for the most is made from scratch oven fried potatoes.  I make several servings in the oven, and they are great for the first meal.  Nice and crispy, but without all the junk that gets added to already prepared frozen potatoes.  Much healthier.  But subsequent reheating of portions is usually very disappointing.  I have been using the air fryer to reheat because it gets them nice and crisp and brown, even better than thee first portion fresh out of the oven.  I have found that cooking fresh potatoes in the air fryer first is a bit disappointing.  They don't get nearly as crisp.  But I realized that from other reviews and since that wasn't what I wanted anyway, it was perfect.  I've tried cooking a frozen hamburger and those come out wonderful as well.  I've started working on a number of favorite items that I can freeze and go from freezer to air fryer, or, like the potatoes, can precook in the oven and reheat in the air fryer.  I have to do most of my meal prep on weekends since I don't have time to cook a full meal when I get home from work.  So many things I am finding that I can do with this and I love the flavors and crispness.
title: Exactly what I needed

author: Nick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2020
review_content: This thing is LEGIT.I‚Äôll preface why with a little background info... My wife got an InstaPot a while back and it slowly became the bane of her existence. She went through Six-dozen eggs just trying to get consistent hard-boiled eggs, ruined two roasts and a litany of other dishes in a little over two weeks. She experienced firsthand the fleeting victory of accomplishing what she set out to do only three times. THREE. Needless to say, once she‚Äôd finished going through the multiple stages of grief, rage, depression and finally acceptance, I came home from work and saw the thing in pieces scattered across my driveway. She vowed ‚ÄúNEVER. AGAIN.‚Äù and that was that.Until this...Months had passed and she‚Äôs started noticing her friends using air fryers. She liked what she saw but the PTSD from the InstaPot was holding on strong. She was leery at first, then decided to pull the trigger... which may or may not have been helped along when I saw the pics of fries and chicken wings... fast-forward two weeks and I came home to ridiculously mouthwatering smells and tears. Only, this time, they were tears of JOY. I looked over and our kids were savagely attacking heaping mounds of fries, nuggets, wings, corn dogs, everything. She even fried half out veggie drawer. The table looked like a cartoon version of thanksgiving, only it was a Tuesday and only a week into the Covid quarantines. My 7-year-old told me to hurry up, sit and eat before she came to her senses and took it all away. To this day, our family has known no greater homemade feast.Five stars. Would recommend.
title: Forget You, InstaPot!!

author: Frugal Shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2021
review_content: I had another brand (as seen on tv crap) air fryer before I purchased this Cosori and couldn't for the life of me figure what all the hype was about. The other fryer was awful, never cooked anything well. My son told me to try this fryer. Wow. Now I see why everyone is air frying. I cook so much in this fryer and it all comes out so tasty, juicy, and healthy without all the oils. My only complaint is that the temps increase by 10s. ie Can't set something to 375 degrees. It's either 370 or 380. It's better to go lower. Other than that it's perfect. The inner baskets are dishwasher safe so clean up is a breeze. Highly recommend this air fryer.
title: Use it all the time. Love it.

author: Ronnie McCurry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019
review_content: I have tried chicken, bacon, egg recipes and destroyed all of them because no matter how much I cut the time back it makes shoe leather in a short period of time. Don't believe the phony reviews. This is a MICROWAVE. It is also a pain to use  and I would advise you to stay away from this at all cost. I almost made a mistake of putting an expensive steak in there. My dog likes it because he is eating well.
title: High dollar microwave and phony reviews

author: ZAP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2019
review_content: I habe been using the Cosori for a couple of weeks now and it was worth ever penny.  Great size, which was a must for me.  So far I have made fries (frozen), many chicken thighs and many, many chicken wings.  the Chicken thighs are so good, I find myself now craving them.  I spray them with a little oil, season with italian seasoning, salt and pepper, cook at 400 for about 15-20 mins and they come out delicious.  Skin gets as crispy as frying and juicy meat.  15-20 mins is decent speed for cooking bone-in thighs thoroughly.  Today I reheated wings I made yesterday and they were as crispy and juicy as fresh.  This is my first air-fryer, so i have a sample size of 1....but it is really hard for me to imagine other air fryers performing much better than this.  Clean up is a breeze, like most things, if you get to it when it's still hot.  Use pre-heat feature before cleaning if you want to put it off until after dinner.
title: Great device

author: W. T. Allen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_content: touch control panel was defective.  Strong plastic/chemical smell even after running thru dishwasher and wiping.
title: Better options

author: J Dean
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021
review_content: I absolutely loved this air fryer until last night when I was making multiple batches of french fries.  Each batch of fries took between 25-30 minutes on 380 degrees to cook and when I was done, I was shocked to see a gaping hole in the left side of the air fryer.  I am afraid to use this anymore as this is clearly a product defect and could have started a fire.
title: Side of air fryer melted off

author: Pablo Marquez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
review_content: Picked this up on Prime Day not expecting much, but I was honestly blown away by how good it is. The settings and temperature retention are especially good. It has a lot of presets, and the app it comes it is simplistic, but easy to navigate. On previous (cheap) air fryers I've owned, the temperature dial was a general ballpark of cookage and generally needed to be maintained at the highest temperature setting to cook thoroughly, but I cooked my first batch of food thinking it'd be the same with this one -- since then, I've used the presets to make delicious meat, fish, and chicken! I would have never cooked proper food (only frozen or reheat stuff) in my previous air fryers!! Seriously, try this and you won't be disappointed.
title: Quite Impressed

author: Gary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                      ¬†This shipped faulty. Something within the fan system would rattle during heating stages. Also, the control interface was horrible. Either the buttons were not aligned with the circuit board or it was just not wired right. The button pressing was intermittent. Oh, but you could control it by WiFi from your smartphone perfectly fine, which tells me that the company knew about this issue and were hoping the WiFi method would outweigh the the analog method and less returns would occur. It‚Äôs also filled the house with a plastic smell. The food that I tested came out great but for $129.00 I‚Äôll cook my bacon the old fashion way or buy Ninja!I bet the UPS store he shipped back hundreds of these. Don‚Äôt waste your hard earned money on this product until they redesign and rebuild A better product in the USA!
title: Back to the Drawing Board Cosori!

author: JCarlson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: My husband wanted an air fryer. He kept seeing the one TV infomercial but I when I read the Amazon reviews on it. I didn‚Äôt like the ‚Äòtoxic death smell‚Äô comments.  So after many days of research and reading reviews, I finally settled on the Corosi. First, I liked the supposed size of it.  And I also like the reviews of the preheating and shake features that make a difference from other fryers.  When it came in I was surprised at the size.And after a couple of months of owning it and using it - I AM SO GLAD I BOUGHT THIS.  Size is perfect for family compared to others.  I like the squared deep basket. It is big to keep out on my counter but no biggie to pull out of pantry when needed.  The nonstick basket is easy to clean and I even purchase paper cooking liners for it that help with things sticking.  Why you should buy: 1-Preheat. If you preheat like an oven you giving food a jump on being crispy. 2-shake feature.  No it does not shake for you. But half way through cooking it beeps to alert you to move, flip, toss, shake, shimmy - whatever your food.YOU WILL NEED A LITTLE OIL FOR MAXIMUM CRISPNESS. I bought an oil sprayer that allows to spritz the food with enough to cook/crisp food.  We have used a lot for frozen items instead of using oven.  Tip: for exception of potatoes like fries - keep things in one layer. If you throw in on top items, the bottom items may not crisp up enough or you will doing a lot of turning. Takes one more run maybe but it‚Äôs worth having crispy spring rolls or taquitos when they are cooked in one layer.Did cook burgers once. Feel like it really shrunk them but they came out ok.  Did hot dog and those came out great.  My husband has done frozen chicken wings and he loved how they came out.I did buy the additional kit that has a pizza pan and other items so will need to try those considering in lock down due to COVID-19 right now.UPDATE: I have read other reviews of basket handle breaking/cracking.  With all things you cannot manhandle it.  It should not be dropped.  All it takes is a gentle push of the button and slide out.  If you treat it well and take care of it, it will work fine.
title: Nice fryer on the first try!

author: BevMama1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2019
review_content: This fryer literally changed my life!  I am the queen of kitchen gadgets, but this is by far my best investment.  I use it DAILY for all kinds of foods (bacon, kale chips, brussel sprouts, sweet potatoes, french fries, eggs, crab cakes, chicken wings, pork chops, and so much more) and I can't stop singing its praises.  It makes everything so crispy and it does it quickly.  Very easy and quick cleanup.Now, this size is very big, so it takes up a lot of counter space, but I wanted a large size to make large portions easily.  This is my first fryer, but my friends have made comparisons to their fryers and it does seem like this particular brand/model is among the best because it actually does make crispy foods.  I also appreciate the recipes in the book that came with it.  I've made several of them....things I didn't even think to make in a fryer like cinnamon rolls and mini apple pies.  (My only issue with the recipe book is that it was cheaply made and the pages too easily fell apart.)  The only other caution that I have is that you have to be careful with things flying up to the top heater and "catching fire"/ smoking.
title: My Family Is Calling Me the Walking Infomercial

author: Brian T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2021
review_content: I purchased this for my wife a few months ago.  I waited to write a review so we could use it a number of times in a number of different ways.  Long story short, it has not disappointed.The air fryer is easy to use and easy to clean.  Everything we've cooked has come out fantastic.  We especially like the healthier outcomes (no oil) and the fact that the cook times are typically far lower than other methods (e.g. oven).  This, combined with the rapid pre-heating, is a real help for a busy family that's always on the go.  We also like that it's big enough to cook enough food for all of us at once.  Some of the other models we considered would have required us to cook multiple batches.  Definitely keep size in mind when selecting an air fryer.  Beyond that the unit is well-made ... durability has not been a concern.This air fryer does come with some documentation.  My only recommendation is to find an air fryer-specific cook book or website to help you get started.  This will allow you to cook with confidence, eliminating the initial guess and check process.  Beyond that minor commentary this unit has been a real winner and comes highly recommended.
title: Love It!

author: Happy In Texas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2021
review_content: I really wanted to get an air fryer to speed up cooking time and make some of my sons favorite foods with less fat!This unit is amazing. Very simple to use and sturdy in design. It takes up a lot of counter room so I could see someone with less space going for the smaller size unit. My son loves French fries and small frozen pizzas for lunch.I wasn‚Äôt really convinced that this would cook so many different foods to perfection in such a short amount of time. I was proven wrong very quickly as I was able to make him breakfast and lunch with no issues. Best of all - no dirty pots and pans!The reason I took one star off was the NOISE! This thing is NOT quiet. I have different types of appliances in my home such as an electric fireplace and air purifier. I expected from some of the reviews I read on here for this to be about as loud as my electric fireplace at most - but hoped it would be akin to my air purifier.Sadly this is way louder than both. It will take some getting use to for sure. The good news is it cooks food so quickly that at most I have to be burdened with the noise for 10-15 minutes at a time. It‚Äôs louder than my microwave as well which I didn‚Äôt expect.Other than that it works amazing and everything was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Tomorrow I will try salmon and veggies in it! Our all time favorite dinner meal.I‚Äôd recommend this to anyone.
title: Great price and Amazing Results!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018
review_content: I never write reviews, but in this case I will. This Cosori air fryer is a super nice fryer.  It's easy to use and the clean up is so easy.  I use it almost every day. I work long hours, this makes My time cooking so much quicker. Great Product.
title: This thing is great!

author: Angela Thorpe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
review_content: I was pretty skeptical about buying an air fryer.  When they first came out I laughed and thought they would be a novelty for a year and then folks would move on.  It's been a few years and I decided to pull the trigger.  Lots of research and I landed on the Cosori.  This thing is big and holds a lot.  Everything I have made so far has been great.  Broccoli, salmon, burgers, chicken - you name it.  I really love cooking Salmon in this thing.  Turns out perfect every single time. And I avoid heating up the house using the oven.  It's less shiny plastic looking if you want to leave it out on the counter.  Pretty easy to clean as well.  This thing is a game changer, kicking myself for not buying it sooner.
title: Better than expected

author: Klaubs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020
review_content: So I love using the AirFryer, it is my favorite cooking appliance now...  but that makes it worse that the handle snapped off of the basket.  This must be a common design flaw because even though it is in warranty there are no replacement baskets available from the manufacturer and even Amazon only has used baskets for sale.As for the Airfryer, it cooks well and cleans up very easily.Digital touch screen is annoying, I can see why the manual knobs option has come back.  The buttons have a delay between touching it and changing the settings so something as easy as changing the temp and time is bothersome (you have to go through temp to get to time).The App on the phone works well, and is good for alerting you if you are running the fryer and leave the room.  The App also has good recipes and is easier to use than the digital display to set temp and time.
title: Handle breaks off, digital buttons are no very responsive; but it is a great air fryer

author: SuzyQ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2019
review_content: I‚Äôm enjoying Cosori‚Äôs 5.8 quart air fryer, and use it almost every day. I purchased two, one for the main course and another for the side dish. I like that I only need a light spritz of oil (I use avocado oil) to get a super crispy coating on fish, chicken, and pork. This air fryer also does a nice job with vegetables, like carrots, green beans, brussel sprouts, and cauliflower - and of course french fries or homefries. I bought it to make chicken wings, and it‚Äôs the king of chicken wings. They always come out juicy, crispy and flavorful. You feel like you‚Äôre having something sinful, but there‚Äôs nothing sinful about a Tsp of oil for a meal to serve four people.I‚Äôm a baker, and so was pleasantly surprised to learn that most things bake nicely in this mini convection oven; muffins, cheesecake, and banana bread, wow! They all come out great. My blueberry-raspberry streusel topped muffins bake up in just 10 min in a 4-muffin tin. (see pics)Clean up is mostly a breeze, depending on what you put in there. I‚Äôve learned to brush a light coating of barbecue sauce on chicken with only three minutes cook time remaining, so to avoid food burning and staining/splatter where I can‚Äôt reach to clean well. I‚Äôve noticed that splatters sometimes do make it above the cooking element to the fan and above. It‚Äôs not easy to clean there, but a wet q-tip works pretty well. Mostly I want to avoid having something too saucy in there that will send splatters up where I‚Äôd rather not have to clean. Also, I worry about the lifetime of the unit in that regard.Cleaning the basket is usually pretty routine, except I‚Äôve noticed that non-stick spray is a big no-no. It tends to gum up on the basket after a few meals, and is difficult to clean off without marring the non-stick coating. The ‚Äúfins‚Äù design of the basket is ideal for allowing the hot air through, but not for cleaning. Don‚Äôt let that scare you away from buying, just be aware that you may need to soak the basket for a while. The bottom piece has never been a problem to clean.Cosori‚Äôs air fryer is a great addition to my kitchen. I imagine that it will be a huge blessing on hot days when heating the oven (and the kitchen with it) is the last thing I want to do. The Cosori staff and chefs have been great and quick about answering multiple questions. I‚Äôm impressed with their offering of an extra year‚Äôs warranty, too.
title: It‚Äôs a keeper - I bought two

author: Pamela Schorr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
review_content: I have been studying Air Fryers for some time and after many reviews, I decided on Cosori. I was looking forward to the "healthy but fast" form of cooking thinking it would simplify our life as well as making it easy for my 14 year old to do some cooking on his own. We made several dishes but was stuned to learn it takes at least 25 minutes to preheat the air fryer. Then when we took the 1st dish out to shake and redistribute food half way through, we didn't realize how heavy and awkward it was to do this. After finishing the first dish we had the food prepared for the second dish, not realizing it doesn't hold heat therefore had to restart another 20 plus minutes of heating before getting to the proper temperature.  2hrs later we are sitting down to eat. The food was good, but not sure about the value of time especially with time to preheat. Actually can cook healthy in less time conventionally. We also live in a condo with a smaller kitchen and it is quite a bulky small appliance. Will be returning.
title: Not a great value in time or space

author: Professor ata
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021
review_content: OK, so I bought this product about 6 months ago and waited to do a review b/c air fryers tend to break down easily (in my experience).  This replaced a standard air fryer without the smart capability - which i loved and used heavily until it died.  This one cooks just as well, was about the same price, and I ABSOLUTELY LOVE the smart functionality.  Imagine placing your raw meat into the fryer and then proceeding to rinse off the cutting board, load the dishes, etc.  Now you're in the process of washing your hands and you start to smell some smoke... no need to drag your dirty, dripping hands to the fryer and spread all those nasty germs... just tell Alexa to turn it off.  OR, your having a lazy Saturday lie in but you know you'll want to toast your bagel and bacon to get you going... have Alexa get the fryer all warmed up from the comfort of your bed.  Seriously LOVE this machine!!  (BTW - my microwave is also "smart", but it is pretty darn "dumb" compared to this little machine as it requires you to press a button before you can activate the smart features... so it was truly a pleasant surprise that Cosori was so much more convenient.  Nice job Cosori!!)  Also, the machine is holding up well so I hope I don't have to repurchase, but I would definitely buy again!  My only wish is that they would make the smart version in white or stainless.
title: LOVE the smart feature!!

author: Bay Area Mom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
review_content: I had a turbo convection oven and had love using it, but I broke the knob and debated replacing it with another turbo oven or getting an air fryer.  I decided to get an air fryer because I had a few people recommend it to me due to its ease of use and it doesn't take up as much counter space.  I had a hard time deciding getting this one or the Instant vortex mainly due to aesthetics.  I ultimately chose this one in white and have been very pleased.  I also feel like the food cooks a bit faster too.  Having all the presets is handy.  It cooks chicken extremely well.  I love how the skin gets so crispy.  I've made chicken/pork katsu, Goguma Mattang (carmelizing it in on the stovetop after the potatoes are air fried), miso soy seabass and reheating frozen food and have had great results.  My only disappointment was the fried tofu recipe I followed from their recipe book.  I would skip that.  I read some reviews that had issues with a plastic smell so I was really afraid of this.  I definitely wouldn't have kept it if my food smelled/teasted plasticky.  Luckily, I didn't have this problem.  I did wash the tray and basket and wiped down all the surfaces before using.  I also ran it a few times before using it to cook food that I was going to eat.
title: Love this!

author: Hien Cao
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
review_content: I bought this air fryer almost one year ago and use it very often. You can make so many different recipes and it‚Äôs very easy to use! A few months ago, the basket stopped closing so when I would cook things in it, I would place a heavy pot of some sort in front of the fryer to keep it from popping out. In looking back at the warranty, I noticed it was still under warranty. I called Cosori and spoke to a gentleman named Elijah. I explained to him about the basket popping out and was just hoping to possibly get a new basket for my fryer. Instead, he followed up with me via email, and within a week shipped me a new air fryer. Talk about great customer service. I definitely recommend this product and it‚Äôs something I use in the kitchen frequently so I‚Äôm very happy with the purchase and also the great customer service received from Cosori. Highly recommend! Thanks Cosori!
title: Great customer service!

author: Justin K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
review_content: While I love this product up until this week, things have changed based on my ability to contact the company.  I have had my air fryer for 5-6 months.  The food is always amazing, however i was cooking pork chops earlier this week and about 6 minutes in while I was making some sides, the drawer shot out of the air fryer and onto the floor.  The drawer broke and doesn't sit sealed in the air fryer any more.I figured i would contact the manufacture and just order a new drawer and bin to go inside the fryer.  However, they do not have an email to contact only a phone number.  While my work schedule in production I can't call during their business hours.  This has caused me to go from cooking with it every night to nothing and I don't know how to fix it.  I don't want to buy another complete unit, when only the drawer needs to be replaced on this one.
title: Projectile food

author: Michael Koch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2019
review_content: First unit that I received had water inside, enough to soak the inside packaging. Possibly a return. Decided to try another and the top had a vent hole of some kind, which the first one did not. Ran for 10 minutes or so and went dead. Nothing would bring it back to life. Obviously much lesser in quality product compared to the Philips. Went back to Philips. When you receive two clunkers in a row, it makes you wonder about some of the positive reviews.
title: Two in a row

author: M Simon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
review_content: I looked at specs and reviews of a number of products, but one review in particular recommended this one and remarked on the benefits of a square basket and this one has a square basket. I was originally considering spending less but based on the review I bought the Cosori, and I am happy with my decision. I love it and have made a variety of foods in it and everything has turned out great. And it is so easy to clean, simple to operate, doesn't get hot on the outside, and for the internal size, does not have a huge footprint. Fantastic product. If I had to select the kitchen appliances that I consider the most useful it would be the Cosori air fryer, a grill pan with interchangeable surfaces, a k-cup coffee machine and maybe a microwave. Do not hesitate to buy the Cosori!
title: Love it!

author: J. Rue
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021
review_content: This used-like new order exceeded my expectations. This seller was true to word. Both stickers were still on the unit, which was immaculate. Saved me enough money, I ordered the accessories this time. My old roommate murdered the first one by refusing to wash it after each use. Therefore he cooked old oil/grease/food, layer after layer to the point it was immovable.  The product itself is amazing. simple to follow instructions practically runs itself. Conversion charts [oven to fryer] can be found online with a quick search. Reduces time, saves money & simplifies meal prep. Just remember to wash it after each use ;-)
title: Just as good the secong time

author: Michael Haley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
review_content: I have gone crazy and been air frying everything. I cooked hamburgers, shrimp, anything frozen, pizza, steak (Which turn out awesome and only take 16 minutes.) bacon, sausage and any vegetable I can stick in there. The key is always pre-heat, spray with oil and seasoning. The picture I included was all cooked in the fryer. Hamburger steak, asparagus, corn on the cob and sauteed mushrooms. Well OK, the gravy was done on the stove. I can set the cooking temp or setting on my phone and hit start and there it goes. And the clean up is a breeze. Nothing stick, not grease, melted cheese nothing. I have talked my neighbors into buying this model and they must be crazy because they haven't taken it out of the box yet. Oh ye of little faith, Forgive them Lord they know not what they are missing. Their loss, but I understand people fear change. This throws everything we have been taught about cooking out the window. The food is done quicker and it actually taste better.My only complaint is that maybe just on mine but the buttons are not very responsive. But with always having my phone around this has not been a deal breaker. In fact is much easier to custom set it on my phone.I love this and the wife and I have joked that we need more to cook more things at once. But until then it's nothing the warm setting on the oven hasn't solved while I cook more items.Get one, get two you won't be sorry.
title: Only problem is I need maybe 3 more to uses all at once.

author: ashleigh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021
review_content: I've had my XL model for over a year and use 2 or 3 times a month. It seems like after a few uses the tiny screws that hold the basket on get loose, so now I check them often; also the clip that is supposed to hold the basket in the bottom unit doesn't always engage, but still allows it to close fully, and it has separated several times which has resulted in food on the floor and almost burns on my legs.  I will not buy this brand when I replace it. (also my daughter has the same model with the same problems)
title: the small screws in the basket become loose and can fall into the food

author: Raymond
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: This air fryer is relatively easy to clean and heats fries, fried chicken, and bread fairly evenly. (on par with convection ovens, and better than toaster/small ovens) However, the annoying thing about this air fryer is the loud beeps that there is no way to turn off. When I originally purchased this product, I was hoping to use it in the morning, but the loud beeps make it impossible since it will wake everyone in the house up. If the loud beeps are not a concern for you, I can recommend this product. However, for me the beeps are a deal breaker.
title: Easy to clean and cooks well/evenly but annoying to use

author: LP
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: Loved it at first, yay air fryer, super convenient. Pretty much used it instead of the oven for about 3 weeks. Then one day while cooking some chicken, 400 degrees for 13 minutes, pulled the sliding hopper out and the entire thing fell off the handle. Luckily didn't burn myself as I freaked myself out and then upon examining the basket and all... the screws heated up so much so that they melted through. Nasty messy. Refunding it, because the manufacturer wants to try and 'troubleshoot' yeah, let's troubleshoot plastic melting and the thing self-destructing.
title: Melted Itself and the handle snapped off.

author: Amazon Lover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
review_content: I love this air fryer, however...I contacted the company after I received my 5.8 quart because the basket is very wobbly and tilts to the left when seated in the drawer...this was my first one so I had nothing to compare it to, but it didn‚Äôt seem normal to me (as the food on the left will be farther away from the heating element than the food on the right...etc.). I sent a video and they told me that was completely normal...so I did not return it & trusted what they told me. I did question other things about my unit, as I had watched every video I could find showing un-boxing of the unit...etc. and there were slight variations in the way mine was packed & boxed. My unit also had some scratches...etc., on it‚Äôs face, which I let slide. However, I just ordered another one (from Amazon) for a different place, and it came packaged perfectly no scratches on the face (like my other) and while there is still a slight wobble and lean of the basket to the left it is nowhere near like the first one I bought. I can shake the new one without it banging and moving all over the place. So with that said, I do regret not exchanging the first one I bought, and question wether it was a return and re-sold to me as new? I will never know and my return window has closed. With all this said I do love this air fryer, and yes...the left side always takes longer to cook than the food on the right because it‚Äôs a little farther from the heating element, but I try to adjust and make it work. I have a Ninja as well that I bought after the Cosori, but they are VERY different in how they function...however the basket does sit perfectly and there is no issue with that. Again, I do love both of my Cosori units (even the slightly defective one). The lesson here is trust your instincts...if you think something is wrong return it...even if the company tells you it‚Äôs completely normal...these units are made in China after all so the quality can be different from unit to unit. Happy air frying!
title: 2 units bought through Amazon, not of the same quality-possible return that was sold as NEW?

author: TheBagman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
review_content: I use this for everything!!!! Everything made in this air fryer taste so much better then when they are made in other wats. Super super easy to use and very easy to clean.  If you don‚Äôt have this your missing out.
title: Everyone needs this!

author: TheTallDriver
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
review_content: This air fryer is great as the title suggests. I picked this one because of all of the positive reviews. It does exactly what the description says. It cooks great with little to no oil need and it will provide tasty and crispy food. Wifi is great also, I have it linked with my echos at home and my iPhone. So I can preheat, start/stop food cooking and change temp/time as remotely. 5.8 qt is good, I have a family of 3 most times unless friends come over. I wish it was maybe a 7-8 qt some time just to get more pork chops, ribs, burgers, etc. (I can get about 15 small chicken wings in at one time. My one big issue with it and a lot of peoples issues with it is the buttons They are very hard to use and some time no responsive at all. It's not only my unit, I joined the social media groups for Cosori and about 70% of people are having the same issue. It's not every time but a lot of times. Plus if your hands are wet or greasy it really doesn't realize which buttons you pressed because they aren't physical buttons.I'm keeping the air fryer because I do love it and luckily they give you an additional 12 months on your warranty when you register. So now I have a 24 month warranty.Final thoughts: There is a lot of benefits and it does what it says, if they could just fix the buttons this would be a 5 star air fryer.
title: Great air fryer, but with one big issue

author: CLINKC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2019
review_content: I found that the easy buttons work for some things and others I use the suggestions online, like Pinterest or other sites and blogs about food and recipes. The steak setting worked perfectly for three 6 oz venison steaks. The veggie and root veggie settings probably should be tweaked and set your own.The ease of the basket removal is a great feature and it makes it super easy to clean. I have not put it in the dishwasher, yet, because I clean it right away and it doesn't need any deep cleaning.Bread under the basket for bacon is a MUST, after two out of four batches to cook one 1lb package of bacon (spread the pieces out to cook thru) it started smoking pretty good, the water method is not really a good one!Read blogs and especially Pinterest for ideas, it's a great tool.You must turn things if you want crispy/browned on both sides.You must oil things (mist) to get a crispy texture.
title: Easy to use, Easy buttons or set own time and temp

author: Mouloua
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
review_content: This product is working very well for me. I am so happy I don't have to waste time waiting for an oven to heat up or a fryer anymore. I decided to get this air fryer due to fatty liver and I am so happy I did. So far I've made greek chicken kabobs, cake, tater tots, homemade fries, frozen fries, meatloaf, and entire chicken. Everything had a little crust or nice crunch to it. French fries look beautiful and taste great. You can taste the healthy cooking with this. I cook with alot of seasonings and flavor, so just enhances all the flavor. Frankly everything seems to hold the flavor just perfectly. When I cooked the whole chicken in it, I was expecting to find the juices in the bottom tray and there was none. I thought it may have dried out the chicken. Lo and behold after letting the chicken rest for 10 minutes I cut into it and all the liquid was still in the chicken, perfectly crust, and perfectly cooked. I have fed 5 people with this machine no problem. I do not put in dish washer and will continue to do that. It cleans up very easily, after every use, no scraping, necessary. The best thing of all is that I have no oily messy cleanup on my stove, etc. Wish I would have done this before. I cook alot and this makes things easier. Now I will just use my stove for boiling and cooking eggs- very little cleanup. Hopefully, my health will improve and this machine will last.
title: So far so good! Preserves food flavor.

author: Sandy Sparkles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: I like everything about this air fryer except that my fries have an off taste, that I can't quite describe (slight chemical maybe). I have cleaned everything according to instructions several times, and still the strange taste persists. This is my second purchase of a Cosori that I've made based on the many great reviews. I noticed that another customer had a similar issue, so it is not just my opinion. I think it might be a defective lot, but I still like it, and hope other customers do not have this issue, because it performs well otherwise. I might try notifying the manufacturer.
title: I like it BUT...

author: Jason
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
review_content: Literally has changed the way I/we eat. I eat steaks at home now ($5 ribeyes from the grocery store) that tastes great! Way different than the bland taste from the oven. hard to explain why, but there is a big difference. Plus, we do the frozen Kroger burgers and they're great as well. No after-taste, and just basic burger tastes as it should. But putting the bun on top for the last 30 seconds or so makes the difference as well, kind of crispy, warm bun with mayo, lettuce, etc and it's a THOUSAND times cleaner and easier to make than the skillet, where grease goes everywhere, plus the waste of time it takes on stove. As they all say, the fries are DIFFERENT than when in oven, way better, the wya they taste at the restaurant, but better.This from a live-long drive thru and take out person. We've literally eaten more, and way better, and cheaper, at home in past month than ever. It's easy to give up 10-15 minutes to make a meal, vs the stove or oven where it takes prep, hour or whatever, then cleanup, not happening with me. Never use my oven, mainly because after all that work it never tasted good.
