Eveyrthing they say is true, it tastes different, and is really quick. frozen burgers and crinkle fries together at once, in 10 minutes - you're eating! and crinkle fries tastes the way crinkle fries in deep fryer tastes, but no grease. I don't even use the spray or anything, they still taste great to me!
title: How did I live without?

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020
review_content: This air fryer is complete garbage. It will stop connecting to the app and the buttons do not work. I have an expensive piece of plasric taking up a ton of space on my countertop and I can‚Äôt turn it on. Avoid at all costs.
title: Buttons don‚Äôt work.

author: happygirl in kodiak
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2021
review_content: This little workhorse is a gem!  Arrived quickly, packaged well and 1st rate user manual, instructions and recipe book.  Very easy to clean, easy to use, perfect little addition to the kitchen. This size of the cooking area is substantial, holds a small bundt pan well.  The only down side -and it must be a safety issue - is that it won't go over 400 degrees.  And the increments are on in 10, not 5 degrees.  Not a big deal.  Everything I've used it for has turned out spectacular.  Burgers, potatoes, veggies.  The steak I did was good, just missed having grill marks - the same with the roasted veggies.  I'm looking forward to trying baked goods.
title: HEAVEN!!!

author: Dream
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021
review_content: I have had 4 air fryers at this point, different sizes and different brands and so far this one has been my favorite. I love how big it is and the square shape. However, what inspired me to buy it was the fact you can press a release button and the basket comes out. This makes it easy to dump the food right onto a plate or dish, my old ninja (which worked great) just had an attachment that fit snug in the bottom so I couldn‚Äôt dump the food out with out getting the crumbs, juices, and oil that had accumulated at the bottom on top of all the food. This is easy to use also. There are pre-set settings or you can change the temperature and cook time manually (just have to press a button once or twice) I have made frozen snack type food in it and food i battered or breaded myself. Both come out amazing. I bought an oil spritzer off Amazon and fill it with olive oil or coconut oil and spritz the food every 5 minutes then shake the basket and continue cooking. That really makes a difference in the final product when it comes to homemade breaded dishes. If you are thinking of buying an air fryer I highly recommend this one. This is even great to reheat leftovers. (Pizza may even be BETTER the next day if you are warm it up in the air fryer). I haven‚Äôt had any issues but I have only had it for like two weeks. With in those two weeks I have used it almost everyday. My kids love it and my 9 year old uses it by herself constantly. (Chicken nuggets, fish sticks, frozen popcorn shrimp, pizza pockets, cheese sticks all that junk) So yes I‚Äôd definitely recommend this air fryer!
title: Best Air-fryer ever!

author: R. Burr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: Love this thing.  Cooking is actually fun again -- no more sticking my hands in a hot oven or getting burned by splattering grease on the stovetop.  The steaks come out juicy and tender on the inside, as they should, yet they are still cooked properly.  And don't even get me started on the fantastic french fries.  I even cooked a whole chicken breast in there yesterday.  While it just fit in the basket diagonally, I did have to perform a little surgery on the sternum as the basket was not quite deep enough, but it was worth the effort.  I have had this air fryer for only a week and a half, but am using it daily to experiment with.  As for those complaints about these baskets falling apart easily, I am checking each time I use it to make sure both parts are latched together properly before lifting them, and being careful to not touch the release button (which has a built-in safety cover) until I have set the unit down.  It seems to be very well built and cleans easily.  Cosori even provides a customer-support phone number, which is rare these days, and they are also offering an extra year warranty for free, if the form they provide is sent in within two weeks of purchase, which I did.  All the directions are clear and easily understandable, and the recipe book is quite handy for learning of the possibilities.  Plus, the machine offers suggested temperatures and cook times on its dashboard, all of which can easily be overridden by any preferred changes.  All in all, I am completely satisfied... no, change that to "elated," by this product.  If anything changes, I will update this review.
title: Happy as a clam (where in the world did that expression ever come from?)

author: James Kay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2019
review_content: Have used it a dozen times and can see it's usefulness now. I think getting a good recipe down for the flour dusting used to dredging meats and seafood breading might take a while. I mock fried some butterflied shrimp I'd prepped with egg, flour and Panko. It came out pretty well but was clear heavily breaded stuff needs to be raised from the bottom of the basket. Solution is to purchase the optional kit of accessories. Which I did. Plus the extra basket.Definitely seeing the efficiency of this thing.Hate learning new icons but once you know the relative temps you're good.Even after you choose and icon setting you can fine tune the time and temp on the fly.Nice clear alarms. Depending on icon mode you select it will beeeep half way to let you flip items in the basket. And beep again when done.Even after you choose an icon setting you can fine tune the time and or temp on the fly as necessary.
title: Surprised actually

author: Jacqueline
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2021
review_content: I have had this air fryer for 6 months and use it at least 4 times a week. I do everything in it, chicken, steak, hambergers, sausage  you name it I use my air fryer. It cooks so fast and clean up is a breeze. When cooking fatty things place a piece of bread between. The baskets this Assets to absorb grease. Doing this not only gets  the grease but there will be no smoking. The taste with steaks is so good.So after 6 months I noticed that plastic on the outside cover was breaking off and had cracked. No problem I contacted Cosori and they sent me a new one. Great customer service  I would give it more stars but no way to do that.  If you do buy this brand rest assured that Cosori has a one year warranty and they do honor it .
title: Easy cooking

author: Michael R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: The touch panelyou change the temperature and minutes.is so finicky. Don't waste your time
title: Touch Panel Is Garbage

author: MWGal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2019
review_content: There are a few things to consider when purchasing this unit. I purchased the 5.8 quart size after reading reviews, and also considered overall reviews, the footprint of the unit, and the functionality for the cooking I wanted to do. I also wanted something that was dishwasher safe because many units do not have a dishwasher safe basket.I am very happy with the functionality and it does a nice job cooking food. Obviously this is key since it is the reason for the purchase.I also like the footprint which is smaller than mini units. This was important to me since the unit is a little bit large for my cupboard storage and I knew I would be leaving it on the counter. The unit measures 11 inches wide, 13 inches deep when you include the handle, and 12 inches high. Very similar in measurements to a coffee maker. I posted a picture with a coffee cup just to give some scale.My main disappointment is that The unit is very large to place into the dishwasher, taking up almost a quarter of my space in the dishwasher. See the picture I posted for reference, and my dishwasher is full size. That said, the size is also a blessing because you can cook for 2-3 people and the Unit gives you more flexibility. However even washing by hand I find a little bit difficult because of all the vent holes and it seems like it washes best with some kind of a sponge or brush so that you can get into the grooves to get it clean if you are not putting it in the dishwasher.Functionality for me rates a five, and I gave a four to the overall unit simply because of the lack of ease for cleaning in my opinion.
title: Here‚Äôs what to consider before purchasing

author: Jose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021
review_content: Let me start off by saying I have accustomed myself to my mothers cooking, if I am not eating food she's made I am usually eating out. I decided I should change that but wanted to find something that would be easy and fast to make great meals. I bought this with my rewards and oh boy does this feel like I am cheating! I used this to cook some chicken breasts, asparagus , carrots, broccoli and sliced potatoes in less than an hour with little to no mess.I highly recommend checking out Fabulessly Frugal (she uses this exact one) and Melanie Cooks on YT for great and easy to follow recipes.What else do you need with this? Avocado Oil is a must, or any other high heat oil, this will keep your Air Fryer safe. DO NOT use the spray oil as it can harm your Air Fryer. I'd also recommend getting a Oil Sprayer (I got the Misto) to spray the basket so your food doesnt stick, you dont need it but its faster and cleaner. I do not recommend the parchment paper as the COSORI is already very easy to clean.I do also like that when I pullout the tray to check on the food (and flip it depending on what it is) the COSORI automatically turns off, then when you slide it back in it picks up right where it left off.
title: Wow. For someone who is new to cooking this feels like cheating!

author: LexyLoo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2021
review_content: I love this thing! It has really sparked my passion for cooking again because of the ease of use, how good things taste, and how little time it can take to cook things! Things to note are‚Ä¶ It has a really loud beeper when it‚Äôs done cooking, but you can sort of rig something to tone it down. That seems to be people‚Äôs biggest complaint which is how we discovered you can modify the noise a bit. We must be desensitized to it now because we never changed it. I wouldn‚Äôt mind if the basket was slightly larger. I personally don‚Äôt use any of the smart controls. We‚Äôve made things out of their recipe book that comes with it which I think is a great way to reference cook times for that specific model. When finding recipes on the web, everyone‚Äôs cook time seems to really vary. I usually have to cut down the suggested cook time based on the suggested recipe ones from the internet. Last time is took possibly look at overall dimensions. This is not a small air fryer, but I think most of them are pretty substantial.
title: Well worth the investment!

author: James E. Floyd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021
review_content: I have purchase two Cosori units with handles and another 8 in one uses brand without the handle.  After using another brand without the handle I realized what a genius design this Cosori has.  Without the handle its pot holders, shelves and other parts that complicate the enjoyment of eating the finished product.  This is me and may not be you.  But I remove the cooking pot by the handle, fill it up from the prep area, load it back into the machine, grab the handle to shake up the contents, remove the finished product by the handle to the eating area.  with tongs i remove the warm food as needed.  To clean I grab the handle and clean easily in the sink or dishwasher.  All these products can cook but how many are this easy?
title: Its All about the Handle

author: jennijen2021
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2019
review_content: This product deserves more than 5 stars.. it‚Äôs that good. I have been going back and forth with the idea of purchasing an air fryer for about a year now but couldn‚Äôt justify spending over 100$ for one. This one came up on a Prime Day deal for around $70.. after reading all the reviews I decided to buy it and give it a try. The reviews did not lie! This thing is great! My 4 year old loves chicken nuggets and this thing cooked frozen chicken nuggets in 10 minutes and they came out so crispy.. I am so happy that I no longer have to worry about my 4 year old asking me 100 times If his chicken nuggets are done cooking. It also came with a recipe book that has so many other recipes and recommendations.. I was actually really surprised at how many different things you can cook in here (steaks, meatballs, chicken parm, muffins, French toast) I can‚Äôt wait to try them all. The presets are really convenient and the manual cooking is also really simple and it preheats in about 5 minutes which is awesome. Although this one is big and does take up a bit of counter space, it was a great purchase especially at the discounted prime day price. I‚Äôm very happy with this product so far and I‚Äôve already recommended it to my friends. I will definitely be purchasing the accessory set to complete this in the near future. This is definitely the best thing I‚Äôve ever purchased off of Amazon!
title: Don‚Äôt know how I lived without this

author: JVG
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2019
review_content: I got this for my birthday after reading the reviews.  I especially enjoyed reading the review from someone who said she was not a good cook.  I do consider myself a good cook.  I ordered two spray bottles that I filled with oil and I already had a digital thermometer which I consider essential.  I will try to give you some different experiences I have had with the Corsi.I have cooked frozen biscuits at about half the time as in our electric range.  Preheating takes only about 4-5 minutes as opposed to 10-12 minutes in our range for the same temp.  I cooked frozen ready made Cordon Bleu and cooked itat the recommended temp for only 17 minutes instead of the 31-33 recommended for a regular oven.  French Fries are great, especially Steak Fries by O.  About 10 minutes using the FF setting and reducing the time.  Steak, Pork Chops, and Meat Loaf turned out great too.  I used my digital therm. to check the doneness.  I don't eat seafood so I cannot comment on that.  Left over Pizza takes only 3-4 minutes after you preheat and tastes just as good as the first time.  I have not try any recipes from their cookbook but do check it out for ideas.  I have not baked in it yet but I have taken part of an unsliced loaf of bread out of the freezer, thawed it for 30 secs in the Micro and then put it in the Corsi for 3-5 minutes in the preheated unit.  Bread is soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside which is true of many items cooked in the Corsi.  Originally I made a place on a shelf to store it but now it is on the countertop because we use it almost every day. Cleaning is a snap too.  I put the cooking trays into soapy water in the sink.  Nothing has stuck yet. Cleans up easily and dries quickly.  It seemed like a large piece to put into the dishwasher and we use it almost everyday.  I forgot to mention that I purchase plain donuts from the supermarket and put them in a preheated unit for 2-3 minutes.  They taste great hot!We live in Florida where summers are hot and we don't like to heat up the kitchen with the range.  The sides get warm but not hot except for the vent in the back.  It is a little noisy, similar to low speed on a range hood.  Overall, we like it and find this size a good choice because most foods for us can prepared in this appliance.  I especially enjoy the French Fries.
title: Quick Cooking, Tasty Results
